description:
If you end your day here, be ready for a great time and an even greater hang over!  Don't think there's a better bang for buck martini/cocktail bar in town. For the price of one drink at most places, you basically get 5. They have really generous pours too. It's not just fruit juice in those drinks. You better be thirsty. 

The dance floor area is great. They control the crowd pretty well here so it isn't suffocating. The bartenders and security are super friendly and nice.  

Don't forget the bar in the back. Theirs never a crowd or line back there so you can get your drinks faster and easier.

Get there early and avoid the cover and line!
author: Mark W.

description:
Came here on a random Saturday night.  It was busy and short line to get in with a $5 dollar cover.  Surprised that a local bar had a cover but I guess.  The bar was busy cash only.  The bartender was attentive I wish however they remove some of the chairs as people hug the bar and it was at times impossible to order.  I dont remember what martini I had but it was good and dam strong.  

Met some locals and the night was enjoyable.  Next time im in town ill for sure stop by.
author: Rogelio S.

description: Cash only, FYI. There's an ATM located by the bathroom though. Stopped by here to watch 2nd quarter of the warriors game. Fun and lively ambience. Their martinis/cocktails come in a martini glass (majority of them), and a little "side car"...so it's a great deal!! Plus, their cocktails are yummy. I got the "blondalope"; cantaloupe with locally distilled gin (209). Service was friendly too! I saw a lot of people ordering the "chocolate mint kiss". A hersey kiss was placed at the bottom of the martini glass. Looked fun!
author: Kirby P.

description: LIT AF WITH THE LIVE MUSIC SUNDAY NIGHTS. The drinks are a tad expensive but they're HELLA strong too. One of my favorite places to go on a night that's NOT Friday or Saturday. Those days are usually packed and there's a cover.
author: Betsy G.

description: A bit sloppy but not in a terrible way. I don't know if I'd pay cover to go, but we got in kinda early and managed to avoid it. I had this same gin mule twice, with it tasting great and balanced the first time and much too sweet the second time. They were made by different bartenders so one is definitely better than the other.
author: Misha T.

description:
The staff here are extremely rude. So much so that they can completely kill your vibe, and make coming here not worth it at all. I suggest avoiding this place completely and going to one of the other bars in the Mission.

Came here again a year later to try to give this place another chance. No change. Staff are rude. The bouncer is rudest person alive. The place is disgusting. My skin crawls as soon as I walk in there. Don't come here unless you want to be treated like shit and want to feel like you're covered in grime.
author: Robin O.

description:
Our bar tender on Pride weekend was a complete jerk. It started off with me asking if he had a phone charger available behind the bar. He first said I could use it when another phone that was plugged in had a little more juice. About half an hour later I asked him if it was ready and he blew up, started lecturing me about how "that's not a service bars have to give to you" as if I was acting entitled to it when I was really trying my best not to pester him. This resulted in an argument. 

 We went to a different bar and the bartender said "sure no problem!" and plugged my phone right in. 

The whole episode was totally unnecessary. It's no surprise other reviews on here complain about their customer service. 

We were the only gay couple in the bar. I can't help but wonder if that had something to do with this. Another review here by gay woman accused them of discrimination too and the owner responded here on Yelp with "just because I'm ____ ain't going to fly this time buddy!" (Screenshots below)

Another review said she heard the owner say to the bouncer "Don't let any Asians in" and the owner responded with a defensive rant. (Screenshots below)

There are several accusations of discrimination against this place here on Yelp. None of which were taken seriously by the owner. 

Accusing me of pulling the gay card ain't going to fly in this review owner! You weren't there so don't try to pull the "you were intoxicated" card on me either!
author: Nick B.

description: Drinks are very strong. Atmosphere is fun and social. The bar is a bit dirty. Besides that, this is a great place to start the evening. Did I mention that the drinks are intense?!
author: Alex G.

description:
For a birthday work celebration, got here on a off day (as I have been told that this place is usually packed). We got here around 6, and the band was setting up around 8.

For $12 dollar, you can get a drink with a extra for your refill when you finish your first. I got a dirty classic martini with vodka instead of gin, as I dislike GIN a lot. It was tasty, but I am more of a whisky woman and though they have whisky, they did not have the one I usually drink. 

Not bad for a work event, but not really my place. It is close to BART, which is good.
author: Mei L.

description: Greatest bar ever, was there approximately six years ago and I literally saw the bartender get hit in the face of a hotdog. !!!!!  No FOOLIN !!! Funniest thing I ever saw my life. LOL ! I'd be so pist off !!!
author: Thomas C.

description:
Blondie's was recommended by a friend for their awesome martini drinks that come with sidecars :) it's like getting two drinks for the price of 1. unfortunately, they were out of the melon drop, so I tried a different flavor that wasn't that great in my opinion. Buttt I have a weird palate so I'm sure normal people would really like this place.

It was pretty empty on a weekday night and the bouncer guy kinda laughed when my friend asked if there was a cover. I guess normally on a typical weekend, this place gets pretty crowded and there is normally a cover. 

The bar area is probably about a fourth of the area the establishment takes up. There is a little outdoor area, with a high top counter and like 5 or 6 bar stools, which is cool. There are also a few booths inside. There is also a fairly large stage area haha I wonder what that's used for typically.
author: Krysten I.

description:
Blondie's is...interesting.

If I was in my early 20's, it might be my thing (actually...not so sure about that.).

The interior is jam-packed on weekend nights. As in, you're in a mosh pit. Thanks to that, it's also obscenely hot. You've been warned.

The music was fun in the, "I can't change it, so I might as well get into it." sense. Old school rap and some 90's-00's rap mixed in. I grew up on that stuff, so I can ALWAYS get into it, but I guess I expect some mix of pop/EDM at bars these days. That said, if you want music other than the latter, Blondie's has it!

Back to the crowd -- this was the first place that made me feel OLD af. I swear everyone was celebrating their 21st birthday when we were here. It felt like college all over again - girls spilling out of sausage-casing dresses, clueless dudes trying to grind up on them, wasted girls trying to grind back...oh man. It was more depressing than entertaining.

Drinks / music / interior were in no way enough for me to even think about coming back. And the fact that I was charged cover to get into this place...no. No, no, no, and no.

PRO TIP (if, god forbid, you do venture in here): CASH ONLY
author: Nic Z.

description:
A really large, strong drink for like $15. Yes, please! They have a large variety of drinks, from sweet to more savory flavors, and your choice of vodka or gin options. It is cash only, so bring some, otherwise, there's an ATM inside near the restroom. Everytime I've been here, they have had live music, which is pretty cool. They also have a dancing area, but IMO, the music is more for salsa type dancing. The dance floor doesn't get too packed, which is fine with me! But it's a little too lit in there, as in, please let the lights dim sum.

Come here if you've got cash, are heavy weight, like live music, and are looking to chill a bit.
author: Eva C.

description: Ummm, live music, strong drinks and in the heart of the Mission, what's not to love? Okay, so there's not a lot of seatting and the tables are always sticky but when you are pouring from the high ball to your martini glass, sticky table is expected. 12-14 dollars gets you what comes out to 3 drinks... yes, please!
author: D T.

description: Attempted to meet friends here after a concert on a Wednesday night, but the doorman said I was too drunk to go in. What?! I had no drinks for the past few hours and had just got done dancing for hours at the Elbo Room​. I was pretty sobered up. According to him, I was  "stumbling everywhere".  My husband, friends, and I got drinks elsewhere. Would recommend the same to others.
author: Braelyn M.

description: The non- serving cleaning girl is a Bitch!!! She asked if I wanted a drink I said yes and ask me to go around the to the counter and asked politely can I get a drink she responded I am not a bartender! Me so why in the hell did you ask.!! BITCH!!!!
author: Manuel R.

description: The doorman does not respect the line and the wait was over an hour.
author: Richard H.

description:
Like your dingy but love-able college bar with more high-brow (and expensive) cocktails. We went here with a group before dinner last Saturday night. We were there from around 8-9 so it wasn't too packed at this time. Had to FIGHT to get the bartenders' attention to order a drink. I would expect this to be more normal, if it were more crowded and later. But I was unimpressed by their un-enthusiasm to serve. 

The drinks were quite good though I have to say. The Moscow Mule was delicious as were the martinis... Just on the expensive side given the vibe and presentation of said drinks. That being said, we weren't there when there was live music and I would give it another try in the future if this were the case.
author: Grace A.

description:
Love the place for happy hour! $12 for basically 3 drinks... its incredible and really strong. I've only been here once at night and there was a cover + really crowded... but really good music.

Will definitely be back for some more HH though!
author: Carrie L.

description:
Cash only-strong ass drinks-live music to dance your booty off to- kinda bar

some local friends of mine brought me to this hidden gem
giant martinis that big enough to share.
cash only
live music
cool crowd

love this place
highly recommend
author: Marci A.

description: Love this bar. $12.50 a cocktail that gives you 3 drinks for the price of one. I like the dagwood (gin martini) for all the different kinds of olives that's in it. Sausage/garlic/cheese/.... string beans?? What a deal.
author: Elizabeth L.

description: SUPER FUN!! Very long line to get in if you come late but we we there by 10:00 and didn't have to wait at all. The martinis are huge and strong, everyone is dancing and it just has a great energy!
author: Jessica H.

description: Fun place! One of favorite places in the Mission, the people here are always looking for a good time. DJ typically places Hip-Hop & RnB with some throwbacks. Drinks here are also pretty cheap!
author: Aaron H.

description: I was once in this place and I will definitely never go back again. the people who work there are really stupid and by the way they treated me and my friends very bad. I had just ordered a drink and they took my drink without even asking. I paid $ 22 for that drink and they took it. DO NOT RECOMMEND this place ever. Keep rush, go away, bad karma! Absolutely no recomend.
author: Nathalia L.

description: We stopped in here around 4 on a Saturday and it was relatively empty. Got a seat at the bar and browsed the extensive cocktail menu. I got the Shaddy Daddy martini which seemed like a happy medium kind of option for that time of day. Surprisingly, it was about two drinks instead of one; the bartender gave the leftover amount in the shaker and it ended up filling the glass again! Good value for sure. I can't really say how it is at night or what the vibe is since not too many people were there but I really like the drinks so I'll be back at a busier time to assess it properly (and try some more cocktails!).
author: Pooja C.

description:
When in a new city I try to go with the flow and not let first impressions fool me into only venturing into tourists traps...this is how I ended up at Blondie's.  Can't say that there was anything wrong with my experience but I also don't think I would come back given a choice.  
My drink was fine, the bartender was fine, the environment was ok, cash only...you see where I'm going with this.  Not a bad option and they did have a little dance floor area if you literally can't find anywhere else to dance.  Side note-why is going dancing so difficult?! Only options are pretentious club or sketchy dive nowadays.  I guess I'll stick to dancing in my living room.
author: Allana D.

description: For the location and size of this bar, service regardless of size or location should be on par to what customer service expectations should be at. Having worked in settings similar to this not only am I aware that surroundings are considered but conditions are considered. After paying for drinks and being refused after handing out cash (cash only bar) why is it fair to pour out a drink after paying in full amount? After further investigation we realized who we dealt with was the GM- as recommended feedback for the GM - I recommend you are aware of who is paying for what... who is correlated with whom...and how to non-generalize your customer base...it is unacceptable and inappropriate.
author: Kristina T.

description:
Bars that don't serve food are probably run by smarter business owners because there is that period when you are cold sober and recognize what you're eating kinda sucks, dude. Now this is quickly replaced by the swimming thought that what you're eating is pretty awesome, dude, but probably not fast enough for me who has suffered the slings and arrows of bad nachos, stale chips and cold weenies. That was a long-winded way of stating that Blondie's doesn't serve food with their drinks. They don't have to because they serve lots of martinis, lots and lots of 16-ounce martinis, even though Jamie W. and I end up ordering the same two kinds every time we come here.

Y'see, we've been in love with Shade in Greenwich Village because they serve amazing cappuccino and espesso martinis (review: http://bit.ly/1Uo0zAV). In fact, we just had them again a couple of weeks ago on our annual pilgrimage to NYC. Jamie read about the Almond Mocha Martini served here, so we made a bee-line over here one Saturday afternoon to find the place not too crowded. People gather mostly on the mini-outdoor terrace to watch and be seen, I imagine. We prefer one of the three small booths inside where we can drink like we were in a 1950's movie where Elizabeth Taylor splashes her martini in her leading man's face and walks out carrying her sable coat like a well-used laundry bag.

We tried the Almond Mocha and really became obsessed with it. Who wouldn't with espresso vodka, creme de cacao, Absolute vanilla and frangelico all in a classic glass dusted with a chocolate rim (photo: http://bit.ly/1sAoC4X)? And like it was a milkshake at an old-fashioned soda fountain, you get the excess amount in a separate glass to keep your drunk on. We alternated that with the Chocolate Mint Kiss Martini that doesn't have the espresso vodka but does give you a Hershey's kiss on a toothpick (photo: http://bit.ly/1UtsKu7). That was delicious as well, though it does bother me a bit that the liquid in both drinks don't look chocolatey, just clear. OK, it doesn't bother me that much since I keep coming back.

DRINKS - 4 stars...doesn't give Shade shade but they are tasty treats on a lazy weekend
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...just a standard bar among the throngs of hipsters that come in and out like the tide
SERVICE - 4 stars...never had a bad martini here 
TOTAL - 4 stars...our go-to for martinis and not letting ourselves hold back
author: Ed U.

description: I have been coming to this place for years.  Lately the bartender who works weekends (read other reviews) became absolutely rude.  Last time I was there he took my money and didn't offer me change ($5).  After he put my money in the cash register, he went about his business like I wasn't even there. Wow.
author: Jacob D.

description:
Loved the ruby reds that come with the free refills!

However, bartenders need training in customer service. Gave $60 for a $36 tap, and asked for change so I could decently tip him. He walked away, and when prompted, he claimed I gave him $40 and refused to give the change. (Happened on 8/19 @ 9:30, quasi hipster bartender with glasses). Cheated for $20, defintely not coming back to this place.
author: Tania C.

description:
I kind of love Blondie's and I think you will too, if you like the following:
- 90's hip-hop/R&B
- strong martini - vodka based drinks - but they do have all other liquors. Are these the best martinis you'll ever have? Probably not. 
- standing - they have limited booths and bar stools and some benches in the back, but this is all about standing & dancing.
- This is a bar that reminds me of a NYC spot. Dark, a lil' grimey and you're there to party.

It's right by BART. You're in the Mission. The martinis priced at about $12ish are more like 2 drinks and they pack a punch!

Con: Cash only. That's just annoying on so many levels. In this day of age with technology you make it so easy for your customers to spend money. We left early because none of us had cash and didn't want to get jacked by the ATM fee.
I've never been here when I've had to pay a cover or it's annoyingly crowded. So I can't attest to those reviews.

Again, Blondie's is a diveyish martini bar that plays the jams and those items combined = a great pit stop to start or end the night if that's your thang!
author: Stephanie Y.

description: Pro tip: one martini is probably enough to last you all night (they're HUGE and very strong). Share with a friend and you'll probably save a few bucks and wont waste any of your giant drink either.
author: Chelsey B.

description:
Swung by Blondies last Saturday night after dining in the Mission. It had been years since I'd grabbed drinks here. And while the neighborhood has changed a lot in that time, I'm happy to report that Blondie's remains the same.

So what exactly is it? It's kind of a cheesy, divey martini bar (they have at least 25 gin/vodka concoctions on the menu) with a 90s/early 2000s decor/vibe. The drinks here are served in your larger-than-usual martini glasses, and the bartenders pour with a heavy hand. So if you're not careful or if you're a lightweight, you could get tanked pretty easily after just one libation. I had some sort of gin martini with a splash of Cointreau. It really hit the spot and gave me a nice buzz for the night. Nowadays, most bars in SF are serving $12- $15 cocktails (and they're pretty skimpy) At least at Blondie's, you are getting your $12 worth of booze and then some!

After a certain hour (I'm guess 9pm or 10pm), the place turns into a dance club. But I left before that happened (because I'm old and I live in the suburbs). I'm sure it's a fun time for the young, techy, hipster clientele.

All in all, Blondie's continues to be a fun watering hole. Be warned though: it's cash only here. They do have an in-house ATM near the bathrooms.
author: Kevin B.

description:
I had the most horrible and sexist experience here last week. I was with my coworkers grabbing some drinks  since it was one of ours birthday. At around 1, these two guys that were sitting by us told the bartender that I took the left over tip that some one had left on the table. I didn't hear when that conversation happened but those men were laughing at me when the bartender storms up to me, grabs my arm very very aggressively and pushes me to the door accusing me of stealing two dollars. I never felt so insulted and I couldn't believe I was being accused me stealing twooo dollars like are you freaking serious?!  
On my way out, I did manage to yell at those disrespectful and obnoxious mens that blamed me. No woman should be treated like that let alone be blamed for stealing. I would never go back there. Horrible horrible experience.
author: Shrishti B.

description: Quick talk cocktails nice place to go for happy hour and also the drinks are bang in especially the martinis have a Manhattan
author: RICHARD J.

description:
Such a great bar with A+ for ambiance. Good vibes. Brought my dad and 3 friends here since I had heard nothing but great things about this place. This was all of our first time coming here. We stopped in around 8pm on a Saturday night. Not too packed yet (but when we walked by later it was slammed!)

I ordered the Dimlit Gimlet which is so so yummy. You get one martini glass full, then basically another drink and a half (in a separate glass). Who woulda thunk? All for $13. Not too shabby. Such a fun bar. Can't wait to come back!
author: Ilana B.

description: Just. Don't. Bother. You'd think a bar that specializes in martinis would make great martinis...but they'd prove you wrong. My Polish martini turned out fishy, thanks to the so called "sausage-stuffed olives". Fool me once.
author: Kristen S.

description:
What bar doesn't serve Long Islands? 
Drinks were also really weak and just tasted like nasty water and the music was random and terrible.
author: Judy L.

description:
I went here on a late sunday night for memorial weekend.    The vibe was cool.   The service was horrible.  

We were waiting over 30 minutes for our drinks, while our bartender consistently navigated around us (we were in the FRONT of the bar).   I felt we were intentionally getting ignored because we didn't fit the type of customer they are used to having.    At the end of the night, the bartender was even yelling at the us LOL.   Thankfully tips aren't mandatory.

I had gotten my review removed initially because an employee there accused me of being in an altered state.  When in fact I was pretty much the most sober one there LOL.   

So if  you're into divey low key bars where there's good music, but you're waiting for 30 minutes for a drink.. then yea totally come here.

For me, i cannot wait that long.  

A more detailed review is posted on tripadvisor as well :)

Cheers!!
author: Sherry C.

description: DO NOT COME HERE!!!!  I went to blondies Saturday afternoon with a friend.  And the somoan security guard was being extremely rude.   He said " You guys don't look like you know what your doin" he judges us by how we looked. And after he checked our ID's and seen we were of  age  he still did not want to let us in.  He was telling me I'm young and my drink preference was immature.( I'm 25 years old ans the guy I was with was 28)  He was being extremely rude.  If you have a date.  Do not come here. Totally humiliating experience
author: CeeCee N.

description: they had a live band playing salsa music. cash only bar and it was fully packed. we had fun for sure.
author: Havalah W.

description:
One of my favorite deejays is a regular here, and you should check him out if you get a chance. It's DJ Hector! I brought a group of friends here on a Friday night to see him in action, and the hip hop tunes he mixes... so good. Lots of throwbacks and good vibes. Blondie's generally has a great atmosphere. As with any bar, get here EARLY. Otherwise you'll be waiting in the ridiculous line towards the end of the evening.

Apparently Blondie's is renown for their huge martinis, which I didn't get a chance to try, but I'll have to next time! I got a Moscow Mule instead. Strong and refreshing. They have an impressive cocktail menu in general. I'll definitely be coming back to Blondie's with my friends again and again to see DJ Hector and satisfy our dancing fix!
author: Stefanie C.

description:
Crazy Saturday Night Dancing!

Last Saturday, a few friends invited me over to Blondie's for dancing ($5 cover) and drinks. The music was great; the crowd was not. I'm not sure if it was that particular night, or Mercury in Retrograde, but the crowd was rude--not to mention just plain "ratchet." I'm talking sweaty people humping each other. Mind you, I went dancing at Double Dutch the weekend before, and it was the most fun I'd had in forever. In contrast, Blondie's was like my high school prom in the 90s when Nelly's "Hot in Here" was number one on the radio station. 

The scene is mixed ages, but mostly young adults. I was surprised to see some finance bros, but the hipsters definitely came in droves. 

The drinks were good, pretty standard. Didn't get too adventurous. Ordered Jameson and ginger ale -- my favorite.

If you leave the bar during dance night, they make you stand at the end of the line. Booooo!

Best part is when the bar closes at 2AM, Nizario's Pizza across the street is open late. Pizza for everyone!
author: Joanna S.

description:
I love this place.  Hubby and I come here quite often.  We love their chocolate martinis. They have two.  Mint kid and almond mocha.  For $15 you get a full glass, good for two pours into the martini glass 

Music is topic 40s and hip hop.  Old school hip hop before 10.  Best night I think it's Friday night.  I brought my girlfriends here tonight and danced the night away.  Have to get up early so bailing now.  

One of my girlfriend just moved here and she loved this place.  We will be back!
author: Lei H.

description:
skip. Blondie's reminds me of the type of spot I think my college-self would have loved. "$12.50 for a martini and a side car, like a two for one deal???" But, alas, this did not do it for me. Between the awkward dance floor in the back, dim lit leather booth and a overpowering musky smell, Blondie's was a miss in my book. 
I first read about Blondie's and the infamous sidecar massive martinis awhile ago and have been wanting to check out since.  Came here on a Friday night for some much needed after work strong martinis with my fiance.  The martini menu is pretty expansive, nothing crazy but mostly some sweet concoction of lemon, lime, and various mixers.  I went for a gin martini with lime and bitters. yuck. This huge drink was a struggle to get down. Maybe my mistake for ordering it but not sure why this drink is even on the menu, it is an odd balance of tart and bitter and just did not do it for me.  
Possibly I would go to Blondies again, but I think for 12.50 I could go to other bars in the area, pay the same amount and get a well balanced delicious cocktail, no sidecar necessary.
author: Kelsey B.

description:
NO JAMESON!?!? Nice space and stage in the on the left side. Cool additional bar in the back. DJ was playing the throwback joints that was mostly crackin'. $5 cover, but no dress code. The crowd? Not my cup of tea. 

First bar I've been to that didn't serve Jameson, I have no clue why. The crowd was not very diverse and some were more snobby than others. They have a small patio with bar seating. The bouncer was really cool. It definitely gets crowded. Security guards are more uptight than they should be and not very friendly. The bartenders were fast and was good at paying attention to everyone who walked up to the bar. 

While the music was great and the space is decent, the crowd and absence of Jameson is what made me give this place 2 stars. My friend was also not feelin' it. It was a great night regardless with people I care about!
author: Jenna T.

description:
My team absolutely *loves* this place. We usually hit it on the off nights/days when the music is playing but the crowds aren't too bad. Depending on your scene, you can find it sometime at this place: live music, quiet bar, party/club... You just have to show up at the right date/time.

You need to know: 
1) CASH ONLY
2) each drink is like 1 1/2 or 2
3) there is no food (unless you count the produce in your drinks - the Dagwood is a martini-meal, but that's the closest you get)
4) the "drink specials in the back" aren't any more special 

Don't forget to tip your bartender. When I've been, they're working really hard here and are more attentive than most, even when the place is packed.

I take a star off for cash only because it annoys me. I tend to not carry much cash.
author: Doug B.

description:
+It's got a little stage for live music/dancing area.
+It's got a killer menu for martinis
+Near the front there's a semi patio/outdoor seating if things get too loud inside.
+~4 martinins for $25!
+little hooks under the bar for bag and jacket
author: Mimi T.

description:
Went to Blondies tonight with a good friend.  We had not been there in years.  This is a bar that we used to go to  years ago and we were very excited to go again.  We had a really good time tonight.  The staff was nice and the drinks were great as usual.  There was one thing that ruined our experience and it was ONE BARTENDER.  A white female bartender, brunette. Probably about 5ft 8 or 5ft 9.   When her shift started, everything changed.  And it was not just us either, it was everyone around us.  This girl went OUT OF HER WAY TO BE RUDE TO PEOPLE.  Every single interaction I had with her was unpleasant and downright awkward.  It was the total opposite of my earlier in the night experiences with a black guy bartender with a scar on his face and some white guy bartender...blonde with a hat one.  Both of which were very helpful, courteous and pleasant.

I normally don't ever  write bad reviews on here but after tonights experience in one of my all time favorite bars....this girl was HORRIBLE.   

EVERY SINGLE INTERACTION WITH HER WAS BAD.  And this includes all of the people around me also.  I used to bartend at a busy bar here in The City while I was in college years ago. I made a ton of money and I was nice to people...busy or not...stressful or not.  

This girl was DOWNRIGHT RUDE TO EVERYONE.   FOR THE BAR...TWO THUMBS UP.  FOR HER...TWO THUMBS DOWN!
author: David C.

description: The blonde woman bartending last night made the experience go from a good time to a lousy one pretty quickly. Not only is she incredibly unfriendly (some life advice, don't bartend if you don't like people) but spilled a drink on me and couldn't be bothered to at least apologize. I'd expect that from the intoxicated, dancing crowd having a good time but not from people who work there.  Music was good for dancing (mix of old & new), crowd is young (average age ~25).  Good place to end a night & dance.
author: Kayla L.

description: Can't go wrong with any of the martinis. They come with an entire shaker - literally 3 extra drinks all for $10-12. Bartenders are always super friendly and the vibe is much chiller than other Mission bars.
author: Deena K.

description: drinks are STRONG.  they don't hold back on their drinks...  your dollar goes a long way here...  bring plenty of cash as that's all they accept. spacious place for groups to mingle.  great selection of cocktails.  you can't really go wrong.
author: Roger K.

description: The perfect place to go if you find yourself in the Mission after one too many and feel like dancing your ass off. It gets packed but if you can accept that, it's lit!
author: Lauren T.

description: Just left Blondies the bartender (who was a blond white woman with bangs) was extremely rude and inconsiderate. I've been here before and did not have a problem woth previous bartenders. I mean it's a Tuesday night, we came out just to celebrate a friends birthday, and this last was so disrespectful. I don't recommend it at all. Probably why everyone was either at Double Dutch, delirium, or the make-out room.
author: Adrian A.

description: The brunette bartender with the bangs - this one is for you! It's a cash bar which I didn't know, and I didn't have my ATM card on me to take out more cash but I had enough to pay for my drinks and left a small tip. The bartender made a point to walk around the bar and come outside where I was sitting and dropped the money I left into my hand/onto the floor and said she didn't want my tip. I walked up to the bar to ask her if everything was okay and if I offended her and she said 'honey, if you left that kind of tip you clearly need that money more than I do'. Sorry that you take tips personally and that you work somewhere that's too cheap to accept credit cards. Don't take it out on the patrons.
author: Christine J.

description: It's very grown. Meaning grown up. Mature crowd. Recognize. This place goes backs generations. It's Blondie's.
author: King L.

description: This guy who works at the bar named Isaiah physically assulted me and my wife. He was much larger than me and my wife but we did not put up a fight. He put his hands on us for no reason to push us out the bar. That is unacceptable to ever be treated like that. My wife was left crying because isiah forced us out. NICOLE DEWALD, as a manager  and owner you need to contact me. Terry at the door can speak to the whole event. I will be reporting to the BBB.
author: Josh L.

description:
Fun place for a great time and cheap drinks. The best and most memorable thing about this place is that drinks are less than $10 and the portions are huge. If you get anything that's served in a martini glass, they give you the extra in a glass with a strainer. So you're basically getting two (pretty strong) drinks for the price of one. What's to complain? My friend got the Ruby Red which I thought was delicious and definitely what I'm going for next time I'm back. I got the Moscow Mule which was fine -- definitely on the strong side. The place is pretty clean actually. It seems divey but it was actually a pretty fun scene.

tldr; super cheap, delicious drinks at a fun bar - I dig it
author: Jasmine X.

description: Heard it was a great cocktail bar. Only giving 2 stars for the free entertainment. I had a martini that was supremely mediocre.
author: David W.

description: First time visit and TERRIBLY DISAPPOINTED!  Bartender was completely disinterested in ensuring that my drink was well made. After one attempt to correct the ratios of lime to vodka, I was rudely ignored. Not recommending this place and not coming back
author: Tracey R.

description: Small bar, drinks were a bit pricey actually..came here for cinco de mayo hoping it wasn't packed, it wasn't but the vibe and people were a bit off..the music was not great..not really my preferred place..not many seats either
author: Minerva L.

description:
This is the place to start your night and circle back to on a Friday & Saturday Night.
every time I hit up the mission I hit up Blondie's bar first!
author: Sal B.

description: Blondie's is my favorite dive bar in the city. Friday/Saturday has the best 90s hip hop music and so much dancing. The pint sized martinis are amazing but beware. PS cash only and there is a cover after 10 pm
author: Rachel C.

description: Isaiah physically assaulted us ... In no way is it acceptable to put your hands on a customer. Nicole please take corrective action against your employee, I will be reporting this incident to the BBB.
author: Jennifer K.

description: This place suck. I came here on a Saturday night, paid 5 bucks for it, got a stamp and the door man told me I would have to take the line to get inside again. The line was like 20 min, and the place was packed.
author: Camila B.

description: Nicole (the owner?) is super cool. Had a great time drinking/dancing and can't wait to come back!
author: Jacob A.

description:
My favorite bar in SF!   I love the martinis here.  The Dagwood is a martini with every kind of garnish, including about 7 kind of olive, peril onion. a green bean, and an asparagus.  

The martinis are made in a pint glass, filled to the top, shaken and then pours as much as they can in a martini glass, followed by handing you the rest of the martini left in the pint glass.  So you roughly get 2.5 martinis for one price.  It is roughly $14 for one martini.  

The Dagwood is suppose to be a gin martini, but you can ask them to substitute the gin for vodka (that's what I did).  They have a HUGE menu on a chalk board above the bar with all their martinis.  They do a lot of gin and vodka martinis, and then secondly they do some sweet/girly martinis,  However their sweet/girl drinks are just as strong as the regular martinis.  My other favorite here is the Deep Blue Funk.  It really does taste like a Blueberry Freezie Pop.  Yum!

The best time to go, really depends on your preference.  If you looking for a chill/quiet place place to grab a drink with friend/date, then come anytime before 10:00pm.  If your looking for that crowded bar scene, then come here after 10:00pm on a Friday or Saturday.

Lastly, Bring Cash.  This is a Cash ONLY Bar.  They do however have an ATM inside if you forgot your cash, but it charges a high fee.
author: Rose Z.

description:
BEWARE OF PICKPOCKETS! I've been to Blondie's a few times, and really love it. In fact, I'd probably give it 4 or 5 stars if it weren't for the fact that someone took my phone from my pocket, and because it was so crowded I couldn't see or find the person who did it. 

Barring that minor issue, Blondies is pretty amazing. The martinis are delicious (not to mention you basically get 3 for the price of one), and the music and crowd are generally great. It's like a throwback to the 90s both in terms of music and dance styles. So as long as you're extra careful with your stuff (even if you're in a big group of 15 like I was), this place is pretty amazing.
author: Kavita P.

description:
Love this place! I discovered this bar when I moved to the bay area 2 years ago. I randomly was walking around Valencia Street and this has been one of my favorite spots in the city. It's a small bar with a dance floor which makes for the perfect combination for me. 

They have large drinks that are the size of 2. It's a cash only bar. They play hip hop from the early 2000s and the 90's and the dj is always on point! I always bring friends from out of town here. The best nights I've had in the city started with someone saying lets meet at Blondie's it usually unfolds in the best way possible. 

The only con about this place is it gets really packed. This place is legit and I've never gone and not had a story to tell after or had an amazing night!
author: Ebonie M.

description: Nice chill vibe. Good drinks with copious amounts of alcohol :) Moscow Mule for the win ;)
author: Food E.

description: Here from LA and just looking for a spot to have a good time without the "club" vibe. DJ had us dancing before we even got in, and the nicest bartender ever! Round on the house is always a plus! We will be back! GOOOO DODGERS!!!
author: Veronica R.

description: BOUNCER IS VIOLENT Saturday night. My girl friend was peeing herself and there was 5 girls ahead of us (there is only ONE bathroom stall for the womens restroom) and there was NO ONE in the guys restroom. So she went in there real quick. When she was leaving the bouncer grabbed her from her arm, and pulled her outside while yelling at her ear. She screamed YOU ARE HURTING ME, as he continously grasped onto her arm and pulled half of her hair. I started taking pictures and he grabbed my phone and yelled at me too. My boyfriend ordered 2 beers and paid cover and we didnt even have the chance to drink them before this bouncer that has no decent human respect threw my friend outside. My girlfriend never reacted violently or aggressive towards the staff or the bouncer and he was extremely aggressive. I have pictures, evidence, witnesses of what happened that night.This place has no respect towards WOMEN or people at all because the manager hasnt even bothered in contacting us after we reported the incident right away.
author: Melissa D.

description:
I have been to Blondie's a half-a-dozen times and I have had a great time dancing every single time! The music has always been awesome. Every time I was there the DJ did such a good job of mixing and created a good rhythm and transition from one song to another. Never a dull moment.

Most weekends I've been there's been a cover charge.

NOTE -- Cash ONLY bar!!!!
author: Kinjal S.

description:
Oh wow. Wow wow wow wow. This place is a recipe for disaster. A beautiful disaster. 

I came here with a group of friends to finally try some of those amazing martini's I've been hearing about. I ordered The "G-Spot", which is Stolichnaya Raspberry Cosmo garnished with a lemon twist..

The drink was phenomenal. Too good.. It tasted like fresh juice, was so refreshing, and I was convinced she forgot to put in the alcohol! I called over the bartender and asked her how much vodka was in it - she said a half pint! You know it's a high quality drink when you can barely taste a HALF PINT of vodka in it. 

Their drinks come in double, maybe even triple form. You got a full martini glass, and a full pint on the side. 3 in 1 basically. Convinced I was Super-Man, I ended up drinking 2 of these, totaling 6. 

Let's just say these martinis came in like a wrecking ball - I got the giggles, starting talking loud and the rest is history.
author: Alex G.

description: Great bar to start at if you're in the Mission.  I was very surprised to see how much one cocktail equates to here.  You'll get your drink in a large martini glass along with the leftovers in a full pint glass.  All this for $12.50 during Happy Hour.  The drinks aren't much more than sugar and alcohol here, but for the price you can't go wrong.  The bartenders here also make the drinks very strong.  My favorite drink was the Deep blue, a little more sour than the others and tasted like a blue icee.  I'd recommend this place if you're looking to get a buzz going.
author: Bryson L.

description:
-live music
-not too crowded
-fun even on weekdays
-martinis come with the shaker 
-bartenders are super nice
author: Derrick W.

description: I love Blondies! They serve the best drinks and the people here are great! Love it!!!!!!
author: Maribel M.

description: Awesome spot in the middle of it all!!! Its very nicely decorated , I loved the atmosphere just maybe some brighter lights but I get it !! I'm extremely picky when it comes to my drinks!! Yet alone with alcohol but my gosh this place nailed it!! I didn't want to drink for this reason alone but My sweet boyfriend walked over with more than just his beer on the second round! It was a lemon drop with some kind of watermelon and it was to die for!  I was very impressed !!  Definitely will be going back when I'm in the area !!
author: Cindy M.

description:
WORST BAR TENDER EVER - he was the actual worst. We asked for a lemon drop which they said was they're specialty which it wasn't. It was gross and when we asked to change to another drink the bartender said no and that we must pay 45 dollars for the drinks that we took maybe one sip of . After asking for another drink and being denied we had to 45

In addition - the guest singer ACTUALLY thought he was an Elvis impersonator in Vegas.
author: Katie L.

description:
Ok, so great drink specials, AMAZING martini's and Live Music that can easily be described as FANTASTIC! Pus the name on the sign is "Blondie's WET SPOT"...How do you NOT want to go in?

The thing is, I was visiting San Francisco on my birthday and we were walking around the Mission seeing what caught our fancy. We see a pub looking place that is pretty packed. (First good sign) We hear live music that makes us both smile and ready to dance (Next winning point) Then we head in and not only does the bouncer acknowledge my birthday (I am vain and love to be made a fuss of) but we instantly get a seat and see drink specials to put all others to shame! 8$ will get you a Heineken and a shot of Tequila?? That is insanity in Halifax. 

I went birthday route, aka I was not paying, and got myself a delicious martini of Cantaloupe and gin. OMG, amaaaaaazing and to boot, they fill your glass and hand you the entire shaker to keep filling it up!

The service was quick and they clearly know what they are doing! I love when a place can not only serve you, but school you on what a great martini is. This place has it all!

There was also an incredible live band playing jazz, blues and whatever else they felt like... I am confident in saying I think they can do it all! In the midst of is all, they invited a random man walking by with a sax to come up and play, so he did...and the crew killed it making some seriously fantastic music and the impromptu factor only made it better! 

The fact I was in San Fran, for my bday, with my brother was enough....but then this place exceeded every expectation and just made the experience so much better! I sincerely suggest heading out, I believe they said Tuesday and Sundays are the days the band plays, but I think you are safe any day of the week to go and "Wet" your whistle! (So to speak?)
author: Jacqueline N.

description: Rude and cocky bartender. Bad service. Inexperienced bartender. Too young.... sad seeing a place like blondie ran by newbie, really sad
author: Ted B.

description: Terrible bar. Wasted people stumbling around. Owners clearly don't care about the safety of their patrons.
author: Ric T.

description:
Ok....this is more of historical review, since I have been coming here for several years.  I will only come here with those that can handle their drink.  Professionals only.

Blondies always seems to be open.....and whether it is crowded or empty, it is always inviting.  

It is a dive bar, but stands up to that in every way.

The bartenders are very accommodating and they have always taken care of me and my parties.  On occasion, we have had customer martini's created based on our cravings.

Cash only, but ATM on site.  Very close to Bart....don't drive (be safe and have fun).
author: Tom P.

description: My coworkers and I absolutely love this place. Every time we are in town we make sure to stop by at least once. We go for the drinks and it is best when it is mostly empty. I have seen it turn into a club or something one night and was not a fan of it being crowded and loud. Almond mocha, blondealope and blue are our favorite drinks.
author: tina V.

description: I have died and gone to martini heaven! The drinks here are strong (like, how did I get home and where did I wake up) strong. They give you the extra portion in another shaker with a strainer so you end up getting at least two drinks for the price of one. The martini possibilities are endless and they always have great live music here. Great ambiance and great location!
author: Crystal P.

description:
What makes this bar unique and awesome?: they give you the whole SHAKER!! Well worth your $12.50!! 

Get to "Bohemian" - that one's a creeper! I didn't even know it had 151 until I was like "dude why am I so buzzed right now and I'm not even half way" and went to look at the ingredients again what do you know, it had 151! lol. It actually tasted good too! And I'm a girl so that should say a lot. I would much prefer this drink than an AMF.

Also tried the "Shady Daddy" and that one was kinda weak. It had citron vodka, 7UP, things that made it very citrus-y and fruity. The name was better than the taste.

Pic of the two drinks: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/F3LKV_cPyRBG_p67ph_6vw?select=2jWSZxSmDu9afsGLF2Ch4w#ygQ9Q5-BJFK5frqbqFns8A

Great location too because it's in the Mission! So if you're in the area and wanna get some drinks on, yes I would recommend coming here! 

If you're young (20 somethings) - come to pregame
If you're older - you can stay. haha
author: Raquel Y.

description: The drinks here are pretty good in my opinion. Its like $12-$13 for a cocktail, but they are a good sized serving. Service, it could be better. The first time I was there (on a Sunday night) the bartender was a bit rude, but whatever, nothing crazy.  The next time i was there (a Friday night), it was a different bartender, and she was really cool.  It was packed, and i found an empty bar stool. As i was about to sit, an employee took the seat away and said he had to take all the stools away... except he didn't do any of that. Everyone else got to stay seated  on their stool, and he never took any other empty stools. Pretty random... Also, it's cash only.
author: Fernando B.

description: It's a cool place to see sports, drink some martinis but space is a little tight. FYI CASH ONLY!!!!!!!!! If not no worries they have an arm next to the bathrooms
author: Orange G.

description: Fun, lively, casual, easy place. So really, it's basic--but sometimes it seems like it's hard to find a bar that meets the bare minimum, you know? This one is pretty reliable.
author: Lori J.

description:
I went to Blondie's recently with a group of friends and was blown away by the service we were provided by the bartender James! I have been to Blondie's before and always have had a nice time, but this was the first time with James behind the bar. I've only written a couple of yelp reviews but I had to this time :) 

James was the only bartender when a group of us came in for happy hour on a Friday afternoon. The bar filled up quickly as did the booths to the side and seats by the window. James was very attentive to all of the customers, giving each of us time and patience while we gawked at the board trying to decide which yummy martini to choose. I was being very indecisive and James helped me pick the perfect martini! I have worked in the industry myself as have most of my friends. It takes a great bartender to not only make a delicious drink but to also have this level of customer service. James I hope you are working when I visit again!
author: Angela B.

description:
When I first came to Blondie's, I was appalled by the $14 cocktail price tag, however, what you really get is the size of 2-3 cocktails, so it's definitely worth it.

Martinis are their thing and they have quite an extensive menu of martini combinations and other mixed drinks. I'd recommend sharing with friend or two, so you can try several since with one order you get enough for more than one drink. 

A couple tables which are nice if you can snag one early in the night (also before cover charge), a nice little seating area outside where you can get some air and watch people go by on the sidewalk. I've also been when there's live music, which is nice too, but then you gotta be willing to pay the cover.
author: MaryKate M.

description:
I love the vibe in this place. I have seen some wonderful musicians play here,
and great DJs! Wonderful cocktails to.
author: Mia A.

description:
Live
Music,
Heavy pours
With the shaker,
And sporadic cocktail lounge dancing.
author: Justin L.

description:
Came here on a Wednesday night and this bar was packed. They have their full menu listed on a chalk board above the bar with different creative combinations. The drinks are large and can be split or shared. Depending how strong you like your cocktails this place makes strong martinis. Worth the price. 

They had a live band playing and a small dance floor if that tickles your fancy. This is a cash only bar.
author: Annie V.

description:
When we walked into this place on Friday night (after spending a few minutes waiting in line outside), the first thing I said to my boyfriend was, "this is the kind of place you go to pick someone up." Lo and behold, my friend and I wereapproached by at least three different groups of guys while the boys went to the bar to grab our drinks. 

But it isn't just a meat market - we did end up having some hilarious conversations with other random groups hanging out around the bar. One of my favorite moments was when a guy dressed as an ear of corn bought my table shots...

If you don't like packed bars or sweaty places, this is not the bar for you. It was definitely crowded and noisy, but I have a feeling it is the PERFECT location for anyone that likes strong martinis and getting their buzzed booty shake on. I might describe it as a more laid-back take on the Marina scene.
author: Catie F.

description:
Yelp does a shitty job at being objective. 

First off, Yelp is not required to grade businesses based on overall positive and/or negative reviews using their 5-star scale. In fact, a federal judge in San Francisco agreed that they have the right to manipulate data aka set lower scores as a selling point for business owners looking to improve ratings. 

I have a feeling they borrowed this business model from drug cartels taxing businesses for protection. But in this instance is fine because it's a publicly-traded company. Maybe some shareholder perks to our federal judges?

I understand Yelp has to make $ to survive financially and there's no perfect world but this could have an enormous effect on local business owners and its community of operation. Now, I'm not saying negative customer reviews should be ignored. If a business is shitty to its patrons, shape up or shut the door. However, in this new world of like/love/stars buttons, we put too much emphasis on that tiny piece of information and without questioning it, we believe it accurately represents what we need. 

Sooooooo.......Blondie's is an awesome local bar where people socialize, dance and become kids again for a few hours--something we can all use!
author: Hector M.

description:
Cash only! But a great deal - for $14, each drink comes with a full martini AND another full pint glass (with ice) for a second round. The specialty mixes are original, yummy and fun. 

There's little more to the place than a whole lot of purple neon lights, some bar seating, a few booths and a little stage in the back. It's packed!
author: Danielle D.

description:
It's surprising how much of an effort it took to get us to go to this dive bar. It's also surprising how good of a set of drinks we got. Although some were flat out beer drinks from the bar, such as Ace Pear Cider, their Bloody Mary is something to consider. Take special note of the bartender's asking of if I was a vegetarian; many green olives were stuffed with various meats.

Anything above decent gets at least 3 stars, but almost every night, they're super-crowded-packed. If it was this "barren" (still nothing of the sort) during the day, it's still very difficult to get the one of the few front outdoor seats that represents Blondie's Bar from inside. Would like to try again, but no guarantees.
author: Garett T.

description: Stumbled on this bar on accident and now it has become my go to spot whenever I bring my friends to the mission. The options are endless. My favorite martini would have to be the chocolate mint kiss. It tastes exactly like an Andes mint. Whenever I decide to switch up my martini, the bartenders are very knowledgable in helping me make a good decision. I have yet to try a martini I don't like. Another plus is the live music and a whole extra cup of booze to refill your martini glass.
author: Megan K.

description:
Situation
- Out on a weekend evening/night
- Out on a weekday evening/night

The Good
- The variety of martini's
- The name's of the martini's
- Getting a martini in a martini glass and the remainder in a pint glass for $12.50

The Bad
- Cash only
- The service could be better
- Cover charge on weekend nights

Overall
- A decent spot for grabbing a martini (or beer) during the week or during the day on a weekend
author: Dipesh G.

description:
Came here on a saturday night with some friends.  The bar is pretty narrow in front, but opens up to a nice dance floor in the back followed by another bar, The Wet Bar, proceeding the dance floor.  Blondie's has a pretty extensive menu of martinis on their wall.  I had a Blondalope and a cholcolate-mint martini.  Both were equally good, strong, and relatively large (you get about 1.5 martinis for $14).  Not sure if the DJs mostly play late 90s-early 00s hip hop and pop, but they did the night I went.  Not a bad thing, but definitely not music that I would dance my heart out to.  

At first, this place feels like a high school dance: everyone is standing against the wall and there's this awkwardness in the air.  As the night progresses it definitely gets more lively.  A little wild even, as I saw a girl dance so hard she tripped and bit it on the stage.  Ouch!

I enjoyed myself, but I definitely prefer coming here during a weeknight when they have a live band playing and it's much easier to secure a booth with your friends.  

Tip: BRING CASH.  No cash, no drinks!  They unfortunately do not take any sort of plastic here.  

Second Tip: Get some fresh made pupusas after your night out, at a vendor that is right next door to Skylark.
author: Josh S.

description:
Worth it just for the martinis. I personally got the gspot one and it was an orgasm for my mouth. One order fills yours glass three times. That's three mouthgasms.

The house jazz band plays some nice jams too and you can egg them to keep going. Only problem is, if they are playing you can't hear anything because the place is tiny and the sound is stuck inside.
author: Cam C.

description:
I've been coming to Blondie's for over 5 years, and have always ordered the melon drop.
Today I wanted to try something different, so I ordered a green apple martini. I hated it, the taste was aweful and I couldn't drink it.
I asked the bartender (who was a young guy) if I could get a different drink, because I couldn't drink that one, and he was very inflexible and told me that he couldn't. I had to keep a drink that I hated and couldn't even drink.
I believe the customers deserve a better treatment. I love their drinks, but they aren't that cheap, and if I don't like them, I shouldn't have to drink them. I'm did not appreciate the treatment I got at Blondie's today.
author: Ana Carolina J.

description: Leo was awesome! The Wise Guy drink he made had such a good flavor, well balanced and of course, hooked up! They allow you to bring food in, so I enjoyed a great burrito with a good drink! Definitely will be back!
author: William E.

description:
Been here a while ago and finally writing a review. This is a small bar and dance floor in the mission. They play mostly 90s hits and top 40 dance music. There is a bar area near the front door and another bar area in a small room waay in the back of the place. The crowd is mixed and people are dressed on the more casual side. Guys in everyday collared shirts and girls in dresses. The dance floor isn't too crowded so my group of friends were able to move about. 

Also, there is a cover after 10pm so be sure to come early.
author: Cecile S.

description: Bartenders don't fool around here with wuessie drinks. They even have $8 PBR with JD shot till 8:30pm. Their chaser martini was excellent and strong.
author: Brian J.

description: I like this spot off Valencia...a nice place to start or end our night..generous martinis with a diverse group inside...it varies nightly though.  Not great for a large group as seating is limited and not awesome for first date as it can get loud inside...but good for a drink and catching up with a friend or two.
author: Cookee L.

description: This place is a super cute bar with old style 50's music. There's a ton of different types of people and swing dancing is brought back in this bar. I definitely wish there was a bar like this back home in LA. Super good vibes, no cliques, and no cover charge! The mixed drinks are pricey, but they give you the rest so it's like you're buying two drinks for the price of one. Beers are $6 mixed drinks are about $13. Enjoy!
author: Bailey A.

description:
Let's start here: How can you go wrong with 16oz Martinis??  Blondie's seriously has amazing drinks.  So many different specialty martinis, so many different garnishes, so many different delicious things to try!  You might think at first that the drinks are expensive...then you end up with an entire pint glass full of deliciousness and realize it's completely worth the price.

Now, I'm not a huge fan of the Marina, and I do admit that this bar can get a little "marina-guys-trying-to-live-dangerously-by-going-out-in-the-mission" on weekend nights, but any other time this bar is awesome.  If you are looking for a chill night to belly up to the bar and relax while enjoying any number of the array of fabulous drinks Blondie's has to offer, try Monday night!  The bartender, James, is phenomenal.  He always has the perfect drink to suggest depending on what you like, makes 'em quickly, and is an overall pleasure to be around.  He looks like a great bartender who clearly loves what he does.

Every time I've been to Blondie's I've had a great time.  The bartenders are always really nice and despite how crowded the bar can get, they still manage to serve everyone quickly. Also, on crowded nights, the back bar tends to be a nice place to escape the madness.  Keep in mind this is a cash-only bar, but there is an ATM in the back.
author: Allison R.

description: I think this place should have $$$ for the cost of drinks!  I ordered two margaritas, and granted I asked for silver patron, but $20 EACH?! And they tasted mostly like margarita mix...not a fresh margarita with real lime juice and cointreau.  I loved sitting at the open air bar stools for crowd watching, but what he charged me per drink was simply wrong.
author: Angie E.

description:
I really don't understand the low reviews of this place so I hope I can do a little to reverse the karma gods of this bar. I have gone a couple times and both times I was pleasantly surprised by how relaxing and fun it was to be there. It is an unassuming place with all of the options for distraction on Valencia. I think thats why I like it. You can dip in here at 8 or 9pm and actually find a place to sit and not be only "elbo room" close to other people. 

The drinks are by far the best part. I am a sweet drinks person and there were just so many options and so many things I wanted to try. I also like strong drinks and feeling buzzed when I can and this place does it so well. They specialize in martinis and have a huge list to choose from. I have had the same bartender each time and she is kind of cold unless you know her already so I don't even bother trying to make conversation. She obviously has her locales so do you lady. She serves bomb drinks though that are strong and you get all the leftover alcohol to pour your own refills at your table. That is AMAZING value for a bar in San Francisco. They could easily hold off on that but you are getting at least 3 martinis for 11 bucks. Yea. That wins every-time. 

The second time I went there was live blues music which I haven't heard in a long long time. Not since my days in the Fillmore. It was a welcome surprise and I just wanted to melt into my booth and close my eyes and nod away. Just the perfect atmosphere at night and during the day it is almost a ghost town to watch football on large TV's and sit on the patio and people watch. 

This place doesn't have any wild decor, or secret passwords, or glowing drinks. Its just quality alcohol and quality music in a time when it seems to be more about the presentation than the product. 

Long live the product.
author: Nick R.

description: Years ago I have had a couple of great nights there....I dont know if they are under new management or what ....But my visit last night would definitely change my mind about going back....There was a Older looking Blonde bartender who was Dancing and flirting with a guy right in front of me....it took me almost 5 minutes to order some drinks....by the time i finally got her attention....i ordered 3 drinks....2 Apple Martinis....and some Hennessy & coke....She told me they ran out of Hennessy....No biggie any other cognac will do....Granted this whole time she was still flirting with this guy in front of me....taking her time ....another 5 minutes....making the Apple martinis which i heard were great at Blondies....i dont know if she wasn't paying attention to what she was doing because she was talking to the guy in front of me ....too lazy to open another bottle....but she topped off the drinks with...I hate to say a Splash of Vodka....more like drips of vodka which was the last few of the bottle....then she says $35 for the three drinks....My girlfriend got her Apple Martini she said it tasted like juice.....she couldn't even taste the alcohol....we left as soon as we finished our Drinks / Juice.
author: Gerry G.

description: Blondie's has been really hit-or-miss for me - like I should only hit it on weekdays and miss it on weekends. Sometimes on Friday or Saturday they'll only have one bartender, who couldn't possibly keep up with demand, so then everybody gets crappy, watery drinks. Conversely, weeknights when it's calmer and they're playing jazz, a few friendly regulars hang around and it's an awesome spot for a date or drinks with friends.
author: Rachel M.

description: Oh hello cheap gigantic delicious cocktails. This place is ridiculous, in a good way. You get a cocktail and then you get a cupfull of the "leftovers" to keep refilling, just like getting a milkshake at IHOP.  The music is on point too! Good place to dance to live music or hangout in a booth. I'm a fan!
author: Kelly G.

description:
Went here for happy hour last week with a few people. The atmosphere was very laid back and thought the seating was great for groups to talk (half circle style). 

I didn't find their happy hour to be that compelling but did notice a lot of people were getting drinks served in martini's + a shaker on the side. They have PBR in a can for $3 and $1 certain beers during happy hour. 

Overall Thoughts

Cool bartender, chill atmosphere, ok Happy Hour
author: Eddie W.

description: Live music, huge drinks - what's not to love? You can order custom cocktails and they'll shake it up for you, serve it in a martini glass and give you the entire pint glass full of the rest of your drink so you can enjoy.
author: Amy Y.

description: Best place for martinis in the city hands down! chill spot in the mission great martini selection..cool music and vibes.
author: Marissa D.

description: One of the best bars I've experienced outside of New York. Relatives & friends from New Orleans and Brazil all agreed... Martinis are Brilliant!!! Wide range of choices, gin &/or vodka. Bar is fully stocked and bartenders gladly guide you, with a smile, should you have any questions. We will all be back.
author: C. Dupsi B.

description: The bartender was really rude. It's Saturday at 2:10 pm and the place had not opened. We saw the bartender leave the bar and asked if he was going to open. He rudely said "maybe" and continued to walk away. That is no place to run a business and that bartender just earned his tips. There were 10 people in our group.
author: Jorge G.

description: Sunday night blues by Kenya Baker Trio. Tip them well.
author: Inigo M.

description:
Blondie's is one of my go-to bars because for $12.50, you get 16 ounces of pure alcohol. Alot of the drinks are really sweet, or taste like you're swigging directly from a bottle of Jameson, so if you're looking for something in the middle I would ask for the Lemon Drop or the Basil Gimlet "less sweet". 

It get's pretty crowded on the weekends, so if you want a seat, come early to reserve one of their 3 booths. If you're with a small group and lucky, there's several seats you can grab al fresco. 

Cash Only.
author: Jess C.

description:
Decent sized bar with pleasant staff. We randomly chatted up some locals here just before it started to get packed.

I believe on weekends they start charging a cover after 10pm so be aware of that. It makes me laugh that No Grill is in their name so you know they only sell drinks.

Definitely a fine place to start a bar crawl. Music wasn't too bad - I heard some Lady Gaga and some other random tunes.
author: Amy J.

description: We came here recently for drinks before an event, and I know this place has been here forever, but this was my very first time!  They have quite the drink menu, with a nice selection of martinis.  I had to get a dirty martini, and they not only give you your martini in a martini glass but they give you the rest of it in the glass with ice and an ice strainer - nice!  So you get great value and plenty of drink to enjoy!  We were sitting inside at first, but quickly grabbed a couple seats at the front open window to the sidewalk as it was a rather warm San Francisco evening - and you've got to take advantage of great evening weather as that does not happen all the time in good ol' SF!  The martini was potent in a good way and I thoroughly enjoyed the drink + company.  I will be back!
author: Maile N.

description: My friend wanted to check out this bar that her friend had suggested. So we went on a Wednesday night thinking that it wouldn't be busy but it was super hard to find any parking!! We probably circled around the area a few times before we finally got parking a block away. Even though it was pretty late already there were surprisingly a lot of people out. Blondie's is easy o spot since the sign is a bright purple color. Upon walking in, I was surprised that it was pretty small but cozy. There are a few small booths, a live band playing, and the bar on the right side. We grabbed a seat by the bar and my friend ordered one of their martinis. I just got a beer since I gave up hard liquor for the year (Crazy I know!) Anyways while we watched the bartender make my friend's martini, she literally poured a good amount of Buleit in there and to top it off, her martini came in 2 glasses!! You definitely get your bang for the buck here. The next morning my friend texted me that she woke up drunk! Loll! The crowd here is also pretty chill and overall the bar had a mellow vibe to it especially with the live band playing in the background. I wonder how the place is like on the weekends but I guess theres only one way to find out. =)
author: Mary C.

description: Been coming here for several years and the drinks are usually really good. Today I didn't want anything fancy, just wanted a simple beer, unfortunately they were out of it. I got a Moscow Mule, minus the mug which takes away from the drink tremendously, if you ask me. Vibe is still the same which is cool but definitely nothing special going on. Still a decent place to hang out and grab a drink.
author: Annette S.

description:
Very cool bar -- kind of a retro-gothic-rock-ish vibe. 

A friendly, but over-worked bartender.

A dance floor, and a platform for live music (didn't get to see any as it was too early, and a school night at that. Not that Blondie cares if its a school night. Blondie probably cuts class, anyway.)

A mini-patio, suitable for people-watching and taking the air.

A funny bouncer, who first smilingly accused me of using a fake Canadian ID, but then recanted, saying that nobody in her right mind would use a name like mine, or pretend to be Canadian, of all things. 

Delicious martinis of dangerous proportions. I had a Jackie O Cosmo, and some sort of red grapefruit martini. I would have tried one of everything, but then I would be dead. And as I mentioned, it was a school night.
author: The Lady M.

description: You pay about $13 for a generous cocktail, which is great. One drink from here is enough to take me down. Cash only, but there is an ATM in the back. Spacing is a little tight, especially as it gets busy. There is a halfway outdoor seating area adjacent to the sidewalk, which is a great place to go if you want to people watch or try to block out the live music. Super close to 16th and Mission BART. I will be back!
author: Max V.

description: Good, solid bar. I like coming here on weekday afternoons/early evenings when it's not too crowded and I can sit outside. Good, strong drinks.
author: Sara S.

description: This is a nice  bar in the Mission. It gives you good solid drinks at not a cheap price. The people who work here are pretty good at what they do. I would recommend this place for your next Mission visit.
author: Ddc C.

description:
Was pretty packed for a Friday night. Managed to snag a booth for me and my date, had to share it with two other interesting characters- regular bar folks, just had some interesting questions for me.

Bartender seemed pretty chill, especially considering how packed it was.
author: Katie Z.

description:
Famous for Martinis you say?
Well it was a Monday, and I'm not much of martini gal, so I went for a nice old fashioned Blue Moon. Served fresh with some orange, the beer tasted great.

Unfortunately this place was dead during happy hour on a Monday and the open doors bring in much unwanted cool breeze. 
I can see the potential for a group happy hour or karaoke at this bar.
author: Ari A.

description:
This is a cool spot that I end up at a good deal more than I mean to. They have live music during the week, and DJs during the weekend. Usually a cover of $5-10 starting around 10 on weekends. The bartenders are quick, no bullshit, and great people as well, provided you aren't another bumbling jabronie. There always seems to be a pretty diverse crowd so I end up finding myself talking to different interesting or ridiculous people each time, which always proves entertaining. 

While it's not my drink of choice, their martinis are pretty excellent. Most are a bit sweet for my taste, but you can't beat their deal- $11 a pop and you get the entire shaker alongside your glass for a second pour. Beware! As is the case with most of the Mission, this place is cash only, however there is of course an ATM inside if you come unprepared. My only qualm about Blondie's is that it's such a great time, I hardly ever walk in without staying till closing. C'est la vie!
author: Sophie H.

description:
I really had a great time on a Saturday night. They played good hip hop and the vibe in the place was amazing. People were dancing and I could feel the positive energy. Very laid back. 

Also the bar is CASH only.
author: J Y.

description:
Yes, it's divey; yes, it's loud; and yes, the drinks are huge. 

We ended our night out in the Mission at Blondie's: grabbed a booth, ordered a giant martini and proceeded to people watch. They had a live band on the stage, but honestly, the music was subpar. We didn't stay long.

If you want to get very very drunk, this is the spot for you. If you are already very drunk, this is the spot for you. If you are not in one of these categories, proceed with caution.
author: Liza K.

description: hecka good!  plus, the bartender Schven is a total dream boat and knows how to shake and bake
author: Nick S.

description:
I love love blondies! I have been going there since the 90's.  Music is great, the owner of the bar is very sweet lady, and the bart tenders are fun! not to mention the famous "deep blue funk" martinis with the refill!  

I love to dance and I everytime I went to Blondies my feel would be killing me from so much dancing!  If you like fancy night clubs I dont recommended it....but if you like to go to a place that is low key, fun, and welcoming visit Blondies. 

You will have a story to tell on Monday!  LOL
author: Patricia B.

description: I've always had a good time when I'm here.  The place is clean and located in a cool neighborhood.  The drinks are good and the staff is friendly.
author: Shaun W.

description: Decent prices, okay space. It was pretty crowded. Drinks were fine. The melon martini was delicious. Definitely go to the back bar, especially if you feel like you need a break from all the people! Do played an odd mix of some great songs and some relatively unknown ones. Not dying to come back.
author: Nicola F.

description:
We came here on a Tuesday night out (for a group that works Thurs-Sunday, it's our weekend -- don't judge. Haha). The bar was decently busy for a random week night, but we still found space to sit in the little outdoor area. My friend recommended this place and started us out with a Deep Blue Funk and a Watermelon martini (ordered "to share"). This gave us four drinks in large martini glasses, $28 total.

The Watermelon martini was okay, but my favorite was definitely the Deep Blue Funk. True to the menu, it tastes like a blueberry Otter Pop! Definitely on the sweet side (my maturing taste buds can't handle a ton of sugar with my alcohol), but easy to sip.

This is a cool bar where the people are friendly and the band provides some really chill music.

BONUS: There's a great papusa place around the corner and they let you bring food into Blondie's!
author: Leana L.

description:
Giant martinis!  The chocolate mint was perfect, and so were the 3-4 I drank (ok, shared) after that.

Seating kind of stinks.  Just a few tables, all of which are filled, and then there's some bar stools.  There was an area at the rear which was empty space.  Fill it with some tables!

Great way to start our bar hop in the Mission District.  Don't skip this neighborhood as a tourist.
author: Angela P.

description:
I've aways loved Blondie's and I will continue to visit! It's also my mom's favorite place to visit when she comes into town. I recently went to the Mission to do the usual packed hip hop dance trail, i.e. double-dutch and skylark. Unlike those bars, Blondie's is not as narrow and hot and they have killer martinis! 

My recent Friday visit had me grooving in the "Wet Spot" with my friends. We were able to enjoy perfect drinks from a friendly and cute bartender, who managed to flawlessly help me and everyone else in this space. I was impressed with his ability to engage with everyone instead of the usual Friday "what do you want" bartender demeanor. 

I will of course come back, but now, Blondie's will be the start of my Friday night hip-hop dance parade through the Mission. Thanks for the great drinks, nice staff, and great mix of music, Blondie's!
author: Isidro M.

description:
Last Sunday night wandering the Mission after being declined admittance to the overfilled venue my partner and I were there to visit, found ourselves on Valencia St. and heard music coming from Blondie's.  

Our first surprise was the doorman wasn't there to collect a cover charge. Second surprise was the huge mixed drink menu and reasonable prices for an establishment which features live music. And the third and best surprise was the quality of the music - these are performers with quite an extensive repertoire and history of and with well known performers: pros!  AND this particular band, 'Kenya Baker Trio', is there every Sunday (blues / rock / Jazz) and Tuesday ("We get kinda funky").  I'll be back!
author: Frank H.

description:
Run of the mill bar in the Mission. Not particularly attractive and doesn't have anything special from what I take of it, but just a solid bar with pleasant people and GIANT martinis. 

I don't see anything spectacular about this besides their ginormous drinks, so I guess that's why I only gave it three stars rather than a solid four, but seriously check it out if you want decent priced and still good HUGE martinis to get f'd up on.

Cheers!
author: Joseph L.

description: They're a dive martini bar. Awesome selection. The Dagwood is brunch in a martini glass. Didn't go there. But respect.
author: A P.

description:
Martinis galore!

The menu consists of an assortment of different drinks but they're known for their martini variations priced at around $12.50 each.  These aren't regular sized Martinis though, they also give you a big glass filled with extra of the martini mix so you can pour more in after you're done with your first glass (easily two more drinks).
