Compliments to the bartender Wednesday, as he was working by himself and still managed to serve drinks that were strong and consistent to everyone in my group.

Blondies is also a good place to enjoy live  music.  On two different instances I've seen a Jazz performer and an Americana rock band so the music is always eclectic.

The crowd is a mixture of people in their late 20s and 30s.

My only complaint would be that they only take cash so make sure to bring plenty of it.
author: David P.

description: This is a very interesting bar. The most memorable moments was the door man Tim. He was a very kind person.
author: Julian F.

description:
This place is just fine. Doesn't get hoppin' until 11 or so, so be forewarned.

Service was hard to come by, and I learned a very valuable lesson: I do not like martinis. More so, I don't like huge $15 martinis. I'll stick with the beer, thankyouverymuch.

The good: ok place to get your drink and dance on.
The bad: slow and surly service.
author: Amanda B.

description:
Been here a few times, and I love the martini's here.  When I first ordered a drink I was like $14 is a bit steep for a drink despite me paying that much before.  This is after all a dive.  It turns out you get about 2 drinks or so in total for that price since they give you a shaker with the rest of the mix drink.  First place I've ever been to that has done this, so LOVE!  And the drink itself?  Awesome!  Tried G-Spot and the Blondalope which are both great.  I really like the Blondalope especially.

This bar usually has jazz music LIVE, so the noise level is up there.  Also, there are not many seats there, so when it's busy, good luck.  You will probably have to stand.  Definitely a great place to go for martini's so, I recommend it if you like martini's.
author: Andrew N.

description: Nicole..  The bartender.  First, I was not rude to any bartender. I even asked my friend was I done something wrong. Otherwise I will apologize for my action. My friend said not at all and she was not drinking. You were standing with no client that's why I went to you. Of course,  I was a bit tipsy. Hello..  We are in the bar. LoL but I was not that intoxicated not to know how to behave in public bars. Instead,  you just waved your hands and chased me away without any reason. This is the first time I've been treated with such a poor manner. Very disappointed!  With all above, it makes me wondering with the solution of either the person is sexist, racist or discriminated. Did not come up with the gay accuse just because I got deny serving drinks. Eventually, I got drinks from the bartender who was next to you and he was so nice. Well, If you have any problems, leave it at home or just call sick. Working in this servicing industry, should you have more service mind and stable temper. Nowadays, the social is worldwide. Be careful with your action. You got paid because of those people..  Be thankful Buddy
author: Senee S.

description: Hopping place on a Saturday night but there is a $5cover and the long barely moves around 11pm.  The dance floor is fun but very small.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
Bring cash. Not a dive bar, but small and intimate. Clean. The bartender was accommodating and a pro. Kept the bar area clean and he was clearly well organized. Owners... give the guy a raise. The band was great, too, on a Sunday night. Loved it when they were just jamming for like 15 minutes straight. 

Unfortunately for me, I didn't experience the bartender's talents 'cause i had a beer. But it looks like he can craft some good martinis. Will try it next time.
author: Phil N.

description: WHY the F is there only one bathroom stall?! Awful. BYE! Also WHY IS IT CASH ONLY omg I have so many questions. Never again. Also, after paying cover and getting a stamp, we were told to wait in line again. Literally screw this place. Oh there's an incompetent DJ too - cherry on top!
author: Kate H.

description:
Every time my friends and I go into Blondie's and look at the crowd, that line from the high-school kid in Superbad pops into my head, "You know when you hear a girl saying: 'Ah, I was so drunk last night. I shouldn't have hooked up with that guy.' We could be that mistake!" Every cute girl I know has not only recommended Blondie's, but most of them have a "Last time I was there, I got sooooo drunk that I..." story, so while I can't say I love the place, they have to be doing something right.

I think I might have just doubled Blondie's' business, but completely blown the ratio. Oh well.

I've only been to Blondie's on afternoons weeknights, so I may have missed their most epic evenings, but there's always plenty of the, "We just had three mimosas at brunch, we may as well make a day of it" crowd. It's cash-only, because it's the Mission and that's required. They've got a copious cocktail menu, and while the Hot Toddy is not on it, the bartender did know his way around a sazerac. There's enough room for crowds or dancing, and an ominous blue neon sign advertising the Wet Spot bar down below. Maybe someday I'll have the guts to venture below decks. In the meantime, if you're looking for cocktails in the Mission, and your friends aren't too pretentious - or they don't want to cab it all the way to the Marina, Blondie's will fit the bill.
author: Kevin B.

description:
The drinks at Blondie's are the kind of drinks your mom warned you about when you were young. When you got to high school and your parents start to acutely freak out about alcohol being more accessible to you, and your mom sits you down for Part 3 of a series of never-ending lectures of things to be careful about. Well Part 3? It's about deliciously fruity drinks that taste nothing like alcohol but get you tippin' like an unknowing cow on a farm. Start here or end here, whatever you like. Blondie's is a fave of mine!

P.S. Every drink I've had here is delicious, but the Blondalope is exceptionally good...and damn effective!
author: Emmeline A.

description:
update. so the "owner" felt the need to respond to my message.  Hey its a free country why not.  When i originally posted this i didnt blast it on FB or IG but since she felt a need to defend her bar, i will defend my opinion.  When your friend gets kicked out for false reason of course everyone in the party wants to apologize and pay for this "drink" she didnt pay for.  We had a party of 10 and $5 cover meant we just spend $50 just to get in.  No one is going to say oh your wrong for kicking out my friend lets leave and let this place steal our $50.  We were only there for less then 20 mins.  As for her being drunk. She had 2 drinks for dinner which was 2 hours long and this was her 2nd drink at blondies.  I already know the business angle of bars.  I have friends who own bars, clubs, etc...  I didnt even say like i felt they kicked us out because we were the only asian party in there.  

But lets go away from person feelings and events and go to the fact.  People if your looking for a 45+year old location that you pay cover and cash only bar, here is your spot.

and now this will be on FB and IG.  Thanks for the 10 min entertainment.  Apparently the events for night was so crazy the "owner" remember the whole thing and responded to it almost a month later.
author: Justin I.

description:
It's a good spot! Hats are okay! There are seats comfortable ones! Everybody there is so welcoming! More popular than the ones around! It's cool... More bright than the ones around and defiantly more chicks than the ones around! Chance of finding a cute chick is higher than at the ones around! They got a menu big menu unlike some others where they ain't got no menu or a small one! 
I like that spot Eventhough the ceiling needed some work done to it as there was one spot where it was dripping! 
Ps you can wear you hat inside of there no biggy
author: Mahmoud A.

description:
This should have been a 4 star review but.... I dropped it down to 2 for the rudeness by the bouncers.
4 stars:- Friday night, no cover if you come in early (I entered around 9pm). $11 gives you an amazing amount of delicious martini. That's all I needed for the night. DJ was alright but I paid no cover so, I'm not complaining.
-2 stars:- Its about 1am. Everyone's having a good time. Dance floor is less crowded, its time for selfies and group pictures. One of my friend climbs on top of a wooden bench attached to the wall and tries to take a few pictures. Suddenly a bouncer who was happily(?) taking group pictures of us, tries to snatch the phone out of the girl's hand. I don't get the rude behavior. He could've probably asked her to come down instead of getting rough. There was no need for that.

Plans for coming back?:- I might drop in for the $11 sweetened martinis but that's it.
author: G B.

description:
I'm a bit obsessed with Blondie's. I love it here. I will admit...I am a martini snob. I'm picky about everything from the garnish to glass. I love that Blondie's has such a large variety of olives and other garnishes. One of my favorites is the pickled asparagus martini....so good! They also have blue cheese olives, jalapeno olives, cocktail onions, etc. I love their martini glasses too. Nice and big so you don't have to worry about spilling your precious martini while standing or migrating around the bar. 

The best part of course...is that you get an entire shaker of martini with each drink...so you're really getting more like a 3 for 1 deal. They also are happy to give you a second glass and even a second garnish if you would like to split a martini. I also love that they always ask if you would like grey goose or kettle one automatically when you order a martini. 

The crowd is always fabulous. Definitely not your Polk/Marina peeps. Usually a mix of ages during the week and much younger on the weekends. People are very friendly and usually strike up a conversation, which is always fun.

It's also very close to Tartine, Puerto Alegre, and Limon...so it's a great place to grab a drink while you wait for a table.
author: Juliet S.

description: This place worked for us.  We got seats at the bar and what seemed like a double martini even though we ordered only one.
author: Myles L.

description:
I came with a big group on Sunday. It was my first, their second, stop on a pub crawl. We were literally the only people there, so if you want personalized service, apparently that's the time to go!

I ordered the sidecar martini and boy was it tasty! Plus, you get a whole shaker of martini goodness to get you nice and buzzed. 

The bad? This place is cash only (although they do have an ATM but of course they charge you like $4 to use it)

They have a huge list of cocktails that all sound delicious so I look forward to coming back and trying more in the future.
author: Rachel E.

description:
The other day, I was tasked with the super easy challenge of helping a coworker fall in love with SF. After a successful morning brunch and renegade-style touring (jumping out of the car to take the classic photos), we introduced her to Dolores Park, but that's another review. After the park, we headed to Blondies. THIS PLACE IS AWESOME SAUCE! I had been here before and knew what she was getting herself into by ordering a martini, but I didn't say anything....the element of surprise is important in helping people fall in love ;p

The music is ALWAYS spot on in this place, and both times I've been here, they didn't have a DJ. Once they had a live funk band that was pretty decent. 

The bartenders: The one I had before was much more personable and willing to strike up a conversation. This last one was a bit too hipster for me, but hey, we're in, what the hipsters call "The Mish" so....overall good enough service, and of course, the pour is amazing!

The drinks: Order a martini, any martini, just order one. Because you will actually get four drinks for the price of one. Other than that, you're only getting one cocktail for the same price that everyone else is paying to get WASTED. And wasted, you will get, unless you watch yourself. I've had the Blondalope (super tasty), Orange Cosmo (yum) and I've tasted a couple of others, and no, sadly, I cannot remember their names because I was little too blurred lines. 

Our coworker loved it here, and if you want to know, she did end up falling in love with the ever-mesmerizing City by the Bay...
author: Samantha D.

description: Cool bar with the best olives and Martinis I've had. Nice bartender with good suggestions and knowledge.  I will definitely be going back here.
author: Tim T.

description: I enjoyed this place during my trip to San Francisco. Great atmosphere, cocktails, and James the bartender is very professional and rocks dry martinis. Highly recommended for groups or just stop by.
author: Angel E.

description:
My problem with trendy places is they sometimes lack substance.
Call me crazy, but I like going to places that have something to them not simply because everyone else is going there.

Fortunately, Blondie's Bar is a trendy place that has a something I'm looking for: drinks that cause memory loss, slurred speech, and general merriment.

I assume we've all been to places that charge way too much for a drink.
Initially, I thought I was in one of those places when I heard a standard (as opposed to high end) martini cost $11.
What I didn't realize was the drink also came with a shaker filled with two additional re-fills.  Talk about a good buzz.
The bartender not only knew how to make a stiff drink -- the folks at Oola should take note or lessons -- but also knew the Tamale Lady would be at the bar around 9 pm to quash my famine and help sober me up a little: insight and alcohol all in one convenient spot.

Sufficed to say, now I can see why this bar (with no grill) gets crowded.
author: Dan B.

description: Blondies' martini's are incredible. The place gets crowded and there is a $5 cover most nights. In Mission in proximity to a few options and pizza places
author: Jim N.

description: Blondie's is always a good go to spot when you don't know what to do in the mission. I hate that they charge a $5 cover, because seriously...its a box. But don't worry its worth it. The drinks are strong and they're usually always playing hip hop, which is becoming extremely rare in the city. Everyone should have a night at Blondie's at some point in their SF life.
author: Natalia H.

description:
I love the selection of Martinis at Blondie's.  They're all very original and have super cool names like "The Shady Daddy" and "The  G Spot"...and not to mention, are yummy!  Our bartender was awesome and our first round (chilled grey goose shots...yeah, we're a bunch of super classy ladies) were more than double shots!  Aggggh!  On to our second round with the coolio Martinis.  Not only do you get the Martini in the Martini glass, but you get all the "extras" in a second pint glass for your drinking pleasure.  Kinda like at Denny's where you get almost an entirely second milkshake in the canister.  For that alone, I'm a fan!  Order a Martini and you instantly get a Martini x3!  

You aren't coming here for ambiance.  This is a bare bones dive bar, but what they do, they do well.

Prices are extremely reasonable....or we got hooked up....or I'm used to being ripped off living in NYC now.  You've been forewarned: Cash only!
author: Sandee L.

description:
Our bar tender made today's experience awesome. She was hilarious and friendly.
I had the Jordanianna and my friend had this blue funk thing. Both were delicious. I recommend mixing the two. Sure you'll go in to diabetic shock, but it'll be worth it.
author: Rich P.

description:
This place has an entire menu of specialty martinis, and all the ones I've tried are so delicious! They're like $14 or something each, but they give you the whole pint glass to refill your glass, so it comes out to about 3 martini glasses full. And boy are they strong!

After a certain time, either a live band or DJ will come on and people start dancing in the back. I enjoy stopping here from time to time.
author: Mike C.

description: I would give this place is a 2.5 stars. If you want cheap drinks with large portions, this is the place. Otherwise, this place is seedy and doesn't fit with the gentrification in the Mission. The restroom is pretty gross and I had to witness an Asian woman getting fingered by some old bald dude. They definitely capture the attention of everyone. The place is quite spacious with not much places to sit since there is a pretty descent size dance floor for a bar. The drinks are not very imaginative and very standard. If you are looking for a place to get drunk, this is the place.
author: Gary I.

description: I would give it all 5 stars, but the bartender kept on giving me the wrong drink and didn't want to bother going back to change it, since it took me seemed an hour to get it.
author: Iris G.

description: Apart from being a just terrible place to drink and "have fun" (there was no fun had here), they have ONE STALL for the women's restroom. That means on a Saturday night, a 20+ minute wait in a sweaty bathroom. Mostly because of this one fact,'I will avoid this bar like the plague.
author: Alison R.

description:
For the money, the best martinis in the city.  I know what you are thinking, martinis are all about the bartender, ingredients and preparation.  Which i agree, but there is also something else... style.

At Blondie's, you walk into a bar which is relaxed and without the usual cocktail snobs that want to know what the process of how the vermouth was chilled, stored. So lets be clear here, when it comes to cocktails, if you want a highbrow drink go to B&B or Alembic.  But if you want a stress free, inexpensive and well made drink the word is Blondie's.

Speaking of style, when you order a Blondie's martini, they not only give you just about the best damn cocktail that would make your granddaddy proud, but they also give you the shaker.  That is about a 16 to 20 oz martini!

Here are the particulars:
Top shelf vodkas and gins
16 to 20oz martinis
10 to 13 bucks

As for me, my preference is:
Dirty Hendricks gin martini with 3 olives... and keep them coming!

Oh ya, and for the love of GOD (cocktail gods) leave a dollar tip as these drinks are carefully made to order. Geeze!
author: Jai D.

description: These people pour generously.... I've had two drinks and I'm now typing with one eye open...
author: John S.

description:
Blondie's was the first stop (actually the only stop since we stayed there so long) on my cousins birthday party bus. 

At 3 in the afternoon, the bar was pretty much all ours. It was my first time there during the day and there was hardly anyone there. At night, it's a totally different story - it's always PACKED. No cover while we were there but I believe they charge a cover at night.

After a long day of day drinking on the party bus, we decided to end the day with some Bloody Mary's. It's like killing two birds with one stone - alcohol and a little meal ;) The Bloody's ran us about $10 each but they were made with tons of alcohol and the bartender made them spicy and with tons of olives.

Overall, it's a solid place to grab a drink during the day or at night - they play booty shakin' music at night too! 

*CASH ONLY
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Love this place. I somehow find myself here at least once a week. Great Martina's and fun music. It is cash only but then again pretty much every bar in the mission is cash only.

I will say they lost a star after watching the bar back dig his hand into the costco size Cherry container and just grabbing them and placing them into the condiment storage on the bar. Kinda gross. 

But other than that, I will of course keep finding myself here on my weekends but avoid ordering any drinks that have a cherry as a garnish. Oh and each bartender charges different amounts for the same drink, one will charge $12 while the other charges $14. Doesn't bother me but just make sure you choose the female bartender ;)
author: Lindsey M.

description:
I LOVED this bar!!!!! They have a massive martini list... I had the Dutch martini which was just your classic Ketal One vodka martini with bleu cheese stuffed olives. Lord, I only had one and I was reeling (granted it was on an empty stomach).

The bartenders are quick and the pours are generous. We were lucky enough to grab some stools cuz this place got packed after 11 pm. Eye candy is a hit or miss but most bars are anyway... Oh and this place is a CASH ONLY bar!!!
author: Julie B.

description:
a nice mix of 20 and 40 year olds.  no in betweens.  this is weird to me.  but somehow it's not as weird / creepy as it sounds.

i come to the mission when i don't want to pay that much for alcohol, but the $5 cover is kind of a set back.  if you don't have cash, they'll hold onto your ID, and let you run to an ATM in the backroom.  whatever.  

i liked that there was a raised stage area where you could stand / dance.  not bad for people watching!

the place is pretty similar to tope in north beach if that's a point of reference for anyone.  i hate giving it 3 stars, especially since the staff was super friendly, but it's just ... whatever.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Blondies had always been one of my favorite bars in the city. Good martini's are harder to find than I like, and with such a large menu, the bartenders here are obviously talented. The staff has always been friendly and I'd never had a bad time here. Last night my cousin decided to use the men's restroom because the line for the women's was so long. No big deal, right? Apparently wrong. The bouncer herded all of us out of the bar when she came back to our group and wouldn't even let us speak to him. So, so bummed with what used to by go-to place for a good drink.
author: Mauricio G.

description:
My new favorite spot in the city. I went the night of Santacon. Despite the fact that a guy had approached me near the dance floor, and upon him asking where I was from and what I did, he was hit over the head with a glass bottle and the entire bar fled in panic -- I'd say I had a pretty good night (I don't think I can say the same for the guy who was talking to me... Not even sure what went down!). The bouncers there were incredibly kind! Especially Terry, who took the time to make sure I was okay after the whole bottle ordeal. 

The crowd is super laid back. Music was good. Drinks were better. Bartenders were quick.

Tips: Bring cash for cover. The Independence Day pin ball machine ate my quarters, so just stay away from that, and you're golden! I'd advise everyone to head here the night of Santacon if you want to see drunk Santas, slutty Santas, and hipster Santas all in one place.
author: Anna Marie T.

description:
Great Martini Bar that you will most definitely get tipsy at if you don't share. By "you" I mean smaller female who hasn't been drinking a lot lately due to swearing off getting drunk since that one time...

There is this almond mocha martini that is kick ass. Seems expensive  at first glance,  BUT you actually get a drink in a martini glass + a cup of the drink in a separate glass for when your martini glass is running low - I'd say about 2.5 martinis total?

Oh, and the bartenders are pleasant too.
author: Wendy M.

description: I like this place. There's not a ton of seating (a few booths, then most of the space is devoted to dance floor purposes), but there are a ton of martini selections, and the almond mocha was on point! Every drink also seems to come with a whole other glass and strainer for when you've finished your first serving, so this was very much like having three consecutive shots. Not for the weak of tolerance like moi!
author: Shendi X.

description:
4 stars for the big ol' martinis!   It's basically two and a half martinis for the price of one!   They make the martini in a pint glass and they fill it all the way up.  Then they pour some into a martini glass and give you the rest of the pint glass with a cocktail strainer.  They have over a dozen varieties of martinis, all deliciously alcoholic.  My favorite is the Dagwood, which is a gin martini with something like 4 different kinds of olives.

The place is kind of sketch for dancing, but well-priced drink options abound. Great place to get tipsy (or drunk off your ass) on the cheap.
author: Michael N.

description:
Pretty simply, I love everything about this place. This is my favorite bar, ever.
* Decor is excellent: subtle but ironic purple neon rings the ceiling, and the furnishings and walls are dark.
* Two (2!) bars: the main bar, and "The Wet Spot", a convenience bar in back.
* Bartenders are awesome: Efficient, clean, and patient with the pour.
* Drinks are incredible: Huge variety of menu martinis, nearly all of which I have tried.
* Music is perfectly balanced between what you grew up with and what's new.
* Crowd is mixed in great way: you see all sorts of people in here, and you know they all must be cool because they all like Blondie's.

It is impossible for me to say no any time anyone suggests going to Blondie's.  

$12 16-ounce martinis. DYL.

Never change, Blondie.
author: Alex D.

description:
The owner is sassy as hell, and really awesome (she's blond, are you surprised?).   She is the owner/manager, hence why she allows her big slobbering dog to sit on the booth seats at the 5:00pm "rush" on Mondays.

Overall, drinks are solid and their Diet Coke is the yummiest fountain soda EVVERRRR.  Don't be too surprised when your tab is like, 14 bux for one drink... their cocktails are no joke on their pricing.  

Otherwise, all in all a great bar with good music, seats at the bar and outside, and there is an ATM in case you forget your cash.

Shout out to Blondie... you might live in Noe Valley but I know you are not a lesbian!
author: Tamara W.

description: Wow if I could give them a negative infinite review I would. If only I checked their horrible rating on yelp beforehand. Because seriously the owner, she has an issue with Asians apparently. Telling the bouncer "to keep the Asians out." Way to be racists. Don't think we didn't hear you. I would not spend my money here had I known what a horrible establishment this place was. I normally don't have an issue with anywhere but, please, keep you're comments about your patron up your own sorry a*** and in your mouth before you spew it out. I'm glad you're losing customers and I hope you continue to.
author: Stephanie T.

description:
I love that Blondie's is a bar with no grill. It is exactly this same snarky cheekiness that pretty much encapsulates the charm of the place. 

Now if you love your martinis big, then you'll love it here. For $12.50, you get to pick one of their house specials - a whole pint of it. I stuck with beer all night though which isn't bad because Blondie's has a nice selection of brews including Leffe on tap. Special mention goes to the bartender when he realized he had forgotten about my drink (It was like my 4th or 5th pint so I was in no hurry anyway) and poured me one on the house. Cheers. 

It wasn't crowded early on but it definitely picked up as the night wore on. Don't think I would want to pay a cover to come in to Blondie's but it's great for an early evening pit stop in a night of trouble.
author: Jon L.

description:
Pros
- Live music on a Thursday night which is always awesome
- Cool space and vibe
- Not too crowded
- Location on Valencia

Cons
- One bartender and one other waiter (that doesn't take drink orders) which means getting a drink takes a while - I understand it's a weeknight and there aren't too many people, but still!
author: Victoria K.

description:
Blondie's. Big cocktails and funky fun dancing. Well not on Wednesdays or Thursdays  but Saturday night can get a little crazy. They have an awesome list of cocktails, priced $12 to $14 or so. I prefer the Bohemian. They give you the pint they mixed it in as well! The stage is a nice addition to the dance floor. Bartenders are skilled and efficient. 

Location in the mission is ideal and is close to late night snacks after last call.
author: Matt F.

description:
5 stars for the music and drinks. The martinis are amazing and they played every old school hip hop song I love. 

The only downside of this spot would be that as the evening wore on the crowd went really downhill. Early in the evening there were a lot of good looking young professionals but by the time we left the crowd on the dance floor was pretty similar to the crowd outside of the 16th st Bart. Fun place to start the night but move on before it gets weird.
author: Kathryn V.

description:
They serve martinis with a side of... SHAKER OF MARTINI. 

I had to get that out of the way. This past Friday marked the first time I've been to Blondie's (mostly) sober. It's amazing how different your experience is without beer/tequila/vodka goggles! 

- Not very big, one of those long narrow bars.
- A small-ish dance floor on the back with a stage off to the side - for what purpose, I have no idea
- Many drinks get spilled on that dancefloor, and be careful not to fall off the stage if you're drunk and dancing.  
- There is only one bathroom stall for the ladies tucked away in a tiny, tiny little hallway. 
- There is ANOTHER bar hidden in the back - Blondie's Wet Spot Bar. It took me 10 trips to notice this. 
- Extensive martini list

I have nothing really remarkable to say about this place - if I had to come here sober I'd probably hate it. But for some inexplicable reason drunk Leilani LOVES this place. So, 3 stars eh?
author: Leilani H.

description: I'm crazy for their Deep Blue Funk! Get there before 8:30 and you'll get happy hour prices and a chance to find some seating. Be prepared to wait because they sometimes only have one bartender working. Dad and boyfriend are crazy about their extra dirty martinis with hand-stuffed bleu cheese olives. Great atmosphere and super close to BART!
author: Dayton E.

description: I love Blondie's.  There is just no place that offers the great music, great drinks and a comfortable atmosphere to enjoy people watching in San Francisco.  I take my co-workers and friends alike to Blondie's and I have never been disappointed...
author: Rik A.

description:
I luved this place.. 
Went on Tuesday night and the most amazing  jazz for free.
If you like your alcohol and chocolate you got to try their white chocolate mint margarita..

It was amazing with a Hershey's mint chocolate cube floating in a  chocolate rim glass!! 

Luved the music, the cocktails and al of it!
author: Tejal D.

description: Where my iphone got stolen out of my purse as I was dancing.  Happened to another girlfriend a few months later.  Beware of shady clientele.
author: Josie M.

description: This place was an enigma for me. When I paid $25 for 2 martinis at a divey bar I was a little surprised. Until she handed us full martini glasses AND full pint glasses with strainers. Literally 3 Martinis. Let's just say I was glad I took uber home. Oh and the grapefruit martini was super tasty.
author: Richard P.

description:
Came in for a couple of drinks late night. The place was pretty empty but hey it was a Monday...lol. The bartender (Kevin) rocks! He was puttin it down with some beats on his iPod and the people who were there were all hella friendly and very cool (I still remember the octopus tattoo this girl had, sick!). They had my Macallan 18 (now how can you NOT like a place that has that?! Impossible!) And do a pretty nice Amaretto Martini (yeah I tried it....hella sweet but somehow it works). 

Overall I have to give it 4 stars (ok honestly the bartender gets a 5 star rating alone, but since it was a slow night I did not get the full on experience, so for now, 4 stars is the best I can give) and I plan to return @ some point to see how it goes down on a weekend. 

The only downside honestly (for me) was the fact that people smoke like crazy right outside and they have open windows that flood the place with smoke.....yuk!
author: Bella B.

description: martini + the shaker? Watch out! I have yet to visit without having a great time and a terrible hangover. When they have live music it is a great party scene.
author: Danny B.

description: the bartender is great. She is very friendly and does the best martinis by far! check out my full review http://thewestcoastexplorer.me/2014/05/12/fajitas-martinis/
author: Tamara S.

description: Went in here to grab a margarita while we waited for dinner next door at Puerto Alegre.  The bartender poured up a glass of triple sec with lime juice and very little tequila and charged us 10.00 each.   When we took a sip it tasted like triple sec.  We kindly asked the bartender for another with less triple sec since the recipe is usually 3 Oz of tequila per 1 Oz of triple sec she told us to stop with the criticism and order another drink.  She eventually refunded the money and tip.  At least she didn't mess up my can of Red Bull.  I would avoid this place completely.
author: Shawn L.

description:
WARNING

I would not have reviewed this place, but after seeing Olivia K.'s review about her stolen iPhone, I had to post as well.

My iPhone 4 was also stolen from this place tonight, right out of my purse. I like the DJ and drinks and all, but SKETCHY THIEVES ROAM THIS PLACE apparently, and commit repeat thefts.

To reiterate, PEOPLE WILL STEAL THINGS OUT OF YOUR PURSE FROM THIS ESTABLISHMENT. I'm sorry to do this because the staff there are nice and the music/drinks are good, but thieves come here and will steal your shit. It's not worth it. Please take warning.
author: Rhea K.

description: Great music and people. Good vibes. Not my typical type of place and I still had a blast. The live performers were great. Good job!
author: Brandon M.

description: For $12 you get a martini with a glass fu of extra martini. After I finished I think it was about4 drinks altogether. This is the place to pregame in the Mission! I was stumbling out and enjoying my cheap but high end alcohol buzz.
author: Brittini S.

description:
Fruity cocktail kind of girls will love their selection of martinis. 

Ordered the Blondalope (gin and cantaloupe) martini and had no regrets! It packed a punch, definitely stronger than most martinis I've had before! It's not served with just your typical foncy martini glass, they also hand you the great amount of overflow in a separate glass. Now that, my friends, is pretty awesome. 

Looks like a favorite neighborhood bar and I wouldn't mind stopping by again when Im in the area.
author: Millie Mae H.

description: Waiting for a restaurant across the street.  Great dive joint.  Nice bartender.  Extra strong drinks.  Small stage and dance area, but nothing playing while we were there, bummer.  Good place.
author: Lola K P.

description:
This is where black out time occurs. Everyone (who drinks) knows what I'm talking about. You're out with friends on a Friday or Tuesday night, the first bar is a warm up with beer, the second bar includes beer and a heavy amount of shots, the third bar is kind of a blur but you think you had more shots and perhaps some cocktails. At this point you think you're okay but really you're on the verge of being completely wasted. That's how I left Blondie's.

This little dive bar with a stage in back has a massive amount of martinis to choose from. The martinis cost around $13 each but they give you the shaker which equals to about 2.5 drinks. Currently, I'd recommend getting the Blondalope (refreshing and easy to drink with a nice cantaloupe accent) and the Wise Guy (whiskey based with a hint of citrus). All the martinis are made with a heavy hand. Thank you, bartender!

I can guarantee that you will leave here either buzzed or wasted. If you're neither, then you shouldn't be coming here or drinking period. There's nothing exceptional about the bar space, layout, service, etc. People come here for the strong tipples and that's what they get....black out time.

***CASH ONLY***
author: J R.

description: Glanced over and saw "bar" stopped by and was def the best decision of the day .  The bartender (Robbin ) was awesome he acknowledged us as soon as we walked in, immediately asked for Ids which was a little different BUT ever drink wAs perfect, drinks were on point, he was attentive but not annoying.. Anddddd so knowledgable. Chill environment , laid back atmosphere -friendly staff. Def coming back ! Ty for making our sf trip with it!
author: Tawny K.

description:
Damn you Blondie's and your pint glass sized cocktails! Why must they be so delicious? And what did you put in the first Manhattan that made me think that I need a second. 

Magic Hat No. 9 on draft? What? That's a win for the kids from Vermont.

The only disappointment here is myself. Next time I need to kick my liver in the sack I will return.
author: Karsten R.

description:
Blondie's is definitely a spot worth checking out.  I was here on a Saturday, mid afternoon, and had a phenomenal time.  There was plenty of room to sit at the bar, and enjoy your martini while chatting it up with the friendly bartender.  The martinis, while not cheap, are DEFINITELY going to put your on your A$$.  You order one, and you get what seems like three or four!  Maybe a bit aggressive to go the Dirty Martini route at 2:00 PM on a Saturday afternoon...but hey, sometimes that's just the way the cookie crumbles!  The martinis are definitely well made and potent.

On a nice day, there's a ledge where you can sit facing the open windows and people watch.  There's definitely an eclectic mix of people in this neighborhood.  It's cash only, so come prepared--but really all you need is one drink here.  Trust me, you'll be feeling just fiiiine!
author: Christina H.

description: Good bar, I had fun. The drinks were awesome, very strong. Some of the customers were a little sketchy the prices were a bit high but you do get a lot for your money.
author: April W.

description: About 10 of went in there yesterday after having lunch nearby. The bartender was extremely rude to us all. After we finally got a drink, a couple walked in to the bar and left after 5 minutes saying how horrible he treated them. He completely ignored us when we tried to order a second round of drinks. So we all left and went across the street to Casanovas and stayed there for 3 hours. That's up to Blondies if they want to lose that kind of business.
author: Cate H.

description:
This place is danergous and I mean that in the best way possible. I'm used to paying $12 for a cocktail in a small glass but a $12.50 for a cocktail AND the rest of full tumbler glass!? My brain is jumping for joy and my liver will be screaming like hell tomorrow.

Overall, well mixed cocktails and clearly I'm down for the portion size. The night we went was pretty dead but I can imagine it gets decently packed in there. We also waltzed in with an extra larger pizza and ate the whole thing while sitting on the floor without them saying anything to us.

Cash only, like most places in the Mission.

Alas, I will definetly be back to Blondies.
author: Rachel C.

description: Have been here twice and had a great time on both visits. The drinks are big and tasty. Staff have always been great with service. Anna is my favourite. Will definitely go back.
author: Liz S.

description:
This place is great. If you want a strong drink, go to Blondie's. 

-cash only
-limited seating

Every martini i've tried has been delicious.
author: Ashley H.

description: 16oz martinis? omfg. Friendly bartender, decent amount of bar seating. Fun  music.
author: Elizabeth L.

description:
Small divey bar which charged us $5 cover to get in. 
Charged my other friends either $4 or nothing at all...wtf....

Also couldn't even order drinks because the back bar said they "ran out of glasses." What bar runs out of glasses?!?!?

At least there was a "dance floor" and music going on. The only saving grace.
author: Paul B.

description: I went to this bar with a friend in a Friday night. We ordered margaritas and they were pretty good. However there us a cover at 10 and it does not worth it. The blond girl at the entrance is very rude and does not seem to understand that she is working in this bar thank to customers. I do not recommend this bar after 10pm.
author: Batiste G.

description: Terrible place. Avoid at all costs. $5 cover.. Are you kidding me? Guys were all creeps. One star for the lemon drop.
author: Lisa K.

description: Was in San Fransisco for a conference and we were looking for a place that served martinis with stuffed olives. A quick google search brought us here!  They had a variety of stuffed olives and massive delicious martinis. They had an extensive drink menu written in a chalkboard above the bar. Leo was our bartender. He had an AMAZING Spotify playlist and also gave great suggestions for different vodkas available for the drinks depending on the olive type you wanted!  I had a couple pints of local beers on tap which were great suggestion from Leo as well. Everyone in our group agreed they were the best martinis they'd ever had. Blondes is definitely worth the trip if you're in the area and looking for a cool atmosphere with great music and drinks.
author: Lisa C.

description: I'm rounding up from a 3.5. Here's why: they've got a $5 cover, but I'm not sure why. Their little outdoor booth is cute, but has very limited space, and no smoking is allowed. The drinks are tasty (I recommend the G spot, fruity martini that also comes with the rest of the shaker glass. The best redeeming quality was the great music. Not sure if this is the vibe all the time, but throwback hip hop will get you an extra .5 star on my Yelp anytime.
author: Lili T.

description: I was there on Saturday night, having been ther ebefore I though tI would take friend that doesnt really care for SF, she loved it!  The bartender made her a "special drink" as she couldnt make up her mind.  There was three of us, we chatted over martinis into the night, then went next door (after seeing the bartenders burrito) had dinner and came right back.  At the time a DJ had come in, played great music, crowd was a lot younger than us, but we still had a great time!  Everyone was nice and no drama, we will for sure be going back!
author: Monica R.

description:
My first time at Blondies bar was definitely one to remember. The music was great and the bouncer was very friendly but the thing that made me leave and probably never go back was the attitude of the bar back. My group of 7 and I were there Saturday (01.17.2015) night and had ordered several beers and cocktails. I can't speak for my friends but I tipped everything I bought something. Now considering that this is a CASH ONLY bar with a $5 cover, we were not prepared with loads of cash for the occasion. After ordering rounds of drinks and shots, the last round of shots, which ended up being $49, was one I will always remember. We gave them $50, which the bartender gave us back $1. The bar back, some guy with a hat, literally HANDED me the $1 and said "we don't want your dollar". At first, I thought this was a joke, that he was kidding. But after trying to leave the dollar and trying to purchase my drink so I could tip them more, the bar back said "we don't want your dollar, just so you know, we are basically paying to pour you drinks." I was so shocked that I told him that I was going to tip him for our shots after I purchased my drink and got change back and that my friends did not have any more cash for tip. He basically replied that it was not his problem and that "you should know better". i kept trying to tell him that I was going to tip more but he would not accept that and kept yelling at me that we did not tip for the round of shots. This exchange made me and my friends leave to find another bar with better service. I used to work in the restaurant industry and NEVER did I SCOLD a customer for not tipping. I probably will never return to this bar again, despite the great music, due to the awful attitude of this bar back.  Hopefully, the owners/managers will see this and address this with the specific bar back and teach him exactly what customer service entails. 

For the record, everyone else in this bar was very polite and nice, his attitude ruined the whole experience for me and my friends.
author: Jane G.

description: GREAT cocktails. This is the bar you should go to if you want to get totally hammered. The drinks are expensive, but man will they mess with your head. Most of the friends I brought there don't remember stepping out.
author: Leo L.

description:
This bar never disappoints.

Dirty martinis are the best.

Music on saturday night was awesome.Met some cool people there.

ya cash only- $5 cover after 10
author: farah b.

description:
Disclaimer:  This review is based on my friends testimonials and not my actual experience because i don't remember my actual experience. 

I came here this past weekend based on a friends recommendation for my bday.
Standard bar with dance floor. Cheap 5 buck cover. The downside was 3 bartenders for like 60 people.

Anyway, i remember the huge dirty martini, the beer, and 2 shots of 151.
(Apparently i had 3 cocktails after, but those are based on my friends testimonials)

One minute i'm dancing with 2 of my friends @ 12:34am, the next minute i'm waking up at 9:30am in my own bed. That's all i remember. 

Apparently i was introducing myself to every chick that night and kissing them on their hands and cheeks then somehow got this engaged foreign chick to dance with me which she later allowed  to touch her boobs and  then threw up so much in the bathroom (with friend support) that security politely checked in on us to make sure everything was okay. There was more, but those were the highlights according to my friends testimonials.


Of course i don't remember any of this. So this could be a shame, but i doubt my friends are lying. This bar gets 5 stars for not kicking me out amidst my bday for going full drunktard!

I promise i'll remember what happens here next time!
author: Steven C.

description: THIS PLACE HAS THE MOST UNPROFESSIONAL EMPLOYEES EVER !I'am a Bostonian whom is constantly traveling and I have never experienced unprofessionalism until I visited this bar. It was my first night in San Francisco and I came across this bar,My friends and I were having a good time yet according to one of the "workers" we were in "his" way ( I didn't know dancing at a bar was prohibited according to him we were "bumping" into him), this worker had the audacity to disrespect us and tell us that we were getting in his way, he was very rude and clearly uneducated ! After this incident we ignored him and proceeded with our celebration, this "worker" walked by us again and CLEARLY had something against us, next thing we are approached by a 6' bouncer whom was watching our EVERY MOVE ( we felt violated and harassed ) we were offended by the way this bouncer was eyeing us, my friend stood up to this bouncer to get an understanding why he was validating us ,( we were three women about 5' ) this uneducated/disrespectful bouncer tells us we need to go ( for no apparent reason, we were conversing amongst ourselves ) . This bouncer then starts picking a fight with one of my friends whom is WOMAN and is 4'11 !!! , this bouncer pushed my friend and bystanders were appalled and clearly against what was going on ! The service provided by the staff in this bar was atrocious and revolting ! I will never recommended anyone to visit this venue! Stay awayyyyyyy ! This place does not even deserve a one star for the discrimination I witnessed !
author: Lauris G.

description:
Blondies is a neighborhood joint.  It's for chill people who understand a few points...

1.  cash only...all the cool bars are doing it.
2. it's a MARTINI bar.  people go there for the MARTINIS.  even if you think you don't like MARTINIS, you'll find one you like at this place.  open the menu.  
3. if you're complaining about the service, you're probably a tool.  
4. if all you wanna do is dance and judge the DJ's, don't walk into a tiny dive MARTINI bar, go to a club, tool.

the coolest thing about this place is that there is a martini for every taste, sweet, sour, clean, classic, bitter...AND they give you a PINT GLASS with the left over martini in it...so you basically get two drinks.
author: Natalie Venus De H.

description: Oh yikes!  This place is always packed.  I know you can't expect to much from a dive bar but sweet Jesus they have the worst well whiskey I've ever had. Handed it off to my 3 other companions and the third was the only one that was able to gag it down.  He immediately regretted it. The bartender was also pretty rude and miserable.
author: Chelsea D.

description: The drinks are pretty good and the music wasn't bad but it needed more volume. The bartender wasn't very nice we paid him and he tried to get the money again.
author: Irving S.

description:
Nikki obviously does not understand the golden rule of customer service: the customer is always right. It's evident how little faith she has in her own establishment--could she have been any more defensive in her response? Most management would have apologized and invited customers to give another try. She, however, did just the opposite.

Nikki, please re-read my initial review. I repeatedly wrote sister, not friend. She was neither belligerent nor drunk. How could she be when she had no drinks to begin with?! I had no drinks either, so yes, I would know. You should not make any false accusations, especially when you were never there to attend to our situation. Learn how to read and listen before you respond. Do not copy and paste responses. Doing so only shows how ignorant you and your staff truly are. Then again, I guess these are the wonderful "ideals" and "rules" you referred to upholding. Many thanks for reminding me why my experience was so terrible.

Stay away from this ghetto, lackluster hellhole, people. Stay far, far away!
author: Emily C.

description:
16oz martinis are you kidding me...

Dropped in here for the first time last night for a quick cocktail before heading off to dinner.  It was early in the evening around 8 so it wasn't too busy, got a seat at the bar right when we walked in.  The bartender was quick to take our order, a little small talk a few laughs and our drinks were ready.  I had a martini and my friend had.... I don't remember not a martini. Mine was perfect!  She (the bartender) topped it off with a couple blue cheese stuffed olives and I was in gin soaked heaven.  

I'm sure it gets a little more lively as the night goes on, there was a stage and a dance floor but for pre-dinner drinks or just out with friends you can't go wrong.
author: Ryan S.

description:
Seriously people?!  This place deserves WAY more credit!

The martini's are AMMMMAZING, LARGE and STRONG. 

 If you enjoy a legit martini this is your place.  Yes, it's a bit divey (but what's not in SF?) and they do charge a cover, which I agree is lame.  Yet, the music is banging and I have never left this place not fully intoxicated which is kind of special.

Be sure to bring CASH... not only for the cover, drinks and to avoid the ATM fees but most importantly for the drunken late-night tacos... just sayin
author: Tiffany L.

description:
I'm just here to echo what everyone else is saying about the Martinis. They're super expensive, but you get so much that you're drunk by the end of your first glass.

I hate the people that come here; it's always crowded, hot and sweaty. And the space kinda sucks.
author: Camille R.

description: Real great vibe to the place. Went out with some friends to have martinis and was delightfully surprised by their large and varied options. I ended up having the deep blue funk; sweet but very good! They give you about 3 portions which was definitely a good share for the money. The live music was incredible on Tuesday night. They really get down!!
author: Chris H.

description:
Blondie's makes martinis well. She makes them mean, sweet, and sometimes down right dirty, but they're so big you just have to share. At 16 ounces for twelve-fitty, it's enough to start a party. Split it into two glasses and voila! It's a menage a trois between a blondie's martini, you and your BFF. But if you must, Blondie's full bar has everything else, including some beer on tap (yawn).

There's DJ music on the weekends mostly playing hip hop and rap with the occasional old skool tunes thrown into the mix. $5 cover starts at 10. The vibe is chill with a little hipster mixed in. It is the Mission after all, but those hipsters all dance at Blondie's.
author: Rina W.

description: This place is an absolute gem. There are very few places left in SF where you feel like the culture of what made SF is maintained and I absolutely felt that vibe in this wonderfully cool and casually fun bar. The bartender Leo was incredibly gracious and attentive to all people at the bar, and he added a sense of familiarity that is hard to come by in your general establishment. Great drinks, great price, no reason to not try.
author: Fatima L.

description: I love this place! The reason I give it 4 stars instead of the whole 5 is because on the weekends it gets way too packed and they charge a cover. Also, depending on the bartender, the Moscow mule I order I'd either amazing or completely disgusting
author: Miriam G.

description:
I have read some of the other reviews and can understand some of the frustration.

But if you are looking for a good Martini look no farther!  Great selection and you don't just get a Martini....they leave you the shaker that has another Martini in it!  WHAT the what?!

I took my little sisters there recently and it was the cheapest night out ever.  1 drink a piece and they danced th enight away on the no so nice dance floor.  But it did the job....
author: Reggie A.

description:
Saturday night music is the best, they don't let too many people in so it isn't totally packed and they have booths...just your normal round restaurant seating but at night you can post up and (as our group did) have half the people dancing and when they wanna rest you sent the other half out! this way no one is standing the whole night....

they have really good ruby red martinis, $12.50 cash only you get the glass PLUS THE SHAKER!!! omg...what a good deal in the city! we came here for my sisters bachelorette party and they did not disappoint! Getting in, only 5 bucks, and you won't wanna leave!
author: Jessica L.

description:
So gross, and yet, so fun. 

Are you looking for somewhere to drink big gulp-sized martinis and dance with your friends? Yes. Do you mind if that includes getting beer spilled on you? Nope. Can the place have a cover charge? Sure. How do you feel about drunk people falling all over you and gross bar restrooms? Ah, I'm ok with it.

If you agree with all of the above, Blondies might be for you. It's generally a pretty gross bar -- lots of drunk people falling, spilling and breaking things. The bathroom is always a hot mess. However, they play great music and if you just want to dance your pants off, this could be the spot for you. 

Proceed with caution.
author: Gretchen S.

description:
As a martini-phile, Blondie's had a calling innate to me as Graceland would to an Elvis fan.  And it didn't disappoint.

Interesting concoctions of jumbo martinis -- though (purist that I am) I always get the Tanq with a twist. Had a group of friends visit SF several years ago, brought them there -- they were so smitten with the "Deep Blue Funk" (two flavored vodkas, blue berry schnapps, and other things) they demanded a second visit before their return home. Can't tell you how hard it is to take someone serious who's talking to you with a big buzz and a blue tongue. But who wants to be serious after a couple of birdbath-sized drinks?

Best for post-work drinks or early evening, get there early to grab a worn but comfy booth. Decent jukebox music, not so loud that you can't have a conversation.  Eclectic mix of folks.  Yes they don't take plastic (it keeps the drinks coming faster so no complaint from me there) but they do have an ATM in the back.

That said, occasionally my martinis have been on the weak side, no worse than most places.  And cannot speak to its after-9 crowd, as by then we've already ducked out for dinner (usually the baby-arm burritos at Taqueria Pancho Villa around the corner on 16th.)
author: John Z.

description:
No happy hour and cash only, but otherwise a great find!

Home of the 16 oz martinis, and they're not kidding. Each $12 cocktail is served in a big martini glass with a full glass on the side. lots of liquor choices, interesting combinations and an array of garnish choices (sausage stuffed olives!?!). 

Adorable beagle that comes to hang out. Very friendly and a good addition to any bar. 

Smoking allowed at the small bar adjoining the main area. A welcome respite.
author: Zachary S.

description: The only reason why this place gets one star is because their bouncer was amazing. He was honestly so kind about everything going on that night. Otherwise there was an angry worker that kicked multiple people out that night for no reason. Customer service is key in terms of where I spend my money at and with their business succeeding. Unfortunately one person was on point tonight but I won't be going there ever again due to the rudeness and mean customer service of one person.
author: Juliet M.

description: You did me right. You did me proud. You did me dirty. And I'm into it. If loving that melon bar martini is wrong, I don't want to be right.
author: Greg J.

description:
I always have a great time at Blondie's.

I don't order their Martini and cocktails very often, but when I do, I really feel like I get a good deal. In general I order their specials. Right now they have $3 Bud light and Tecate, $6 can of Bush and a shot of Dickel....

Their new special is the Orange Julius, Seagram's 7 Stone Cherry with OJ and 7Up. Its pretty good, strong enough, hard to find a better deal for $3 in the Mission.

They recently renovated their little patio area and removed the small tables. Now, it feels like you are at the bar with a view on Valencia St. Perfect people watching spot. Make sure to come early if you want to secure a sit in the patio, there are only 5 or 6 out there.
author: Jeremy B.

description: For the sake of setting the story straight, the 6-pack incident happened LONG after we were in the bar.  We were apologetic and in no way trying to get anyone into trouble or be sneaky, nor were we touching or consuming the beer in the bar because we didn't even realize we still had it with us; someone had been carrying it all day and was simply not thinking about still having it in their possession when we came into the bar.  It took the bartender, as well as us, over an hour to realize that 6-pack was sitting next to one of our barstools on the floor.  So, even though you immediately jumped to the bartender's defense and assumed that he was justifiably rude because of the beer - that is wrong.  We were feeling "AWKWARD" and unwelcome in your bar for about an hour before that incident took place.  Funny how the bartender conveniently arranged the story to justify his rudeness.  And as a business owner, you are immediately assuming the customer is 100% wrong, even though you weren't there.  Like I said, we were and are very sorry for our mistake, but it can't be used as an excuse for how we were greeted and served because we were on our way out before the 6-pack of beer was even noticed.
author: Kristen F.

description:
For a Tuesday night, this place was excellent. When you order a martini, it's like when you get a milkshake and they give you the extra on the side... But here the extra is alcohol!!!

They had cool live music when I was here, but I could still hear my friends and have a conversation.
author: Diana M.

description: Mix crowd. On a Saturday, they played some cheesy music ...while I was enjoying my gin ntonic. I was like.... Where did that come from???? Decent size of dance floor, a few cute guys here and there. Might come back again...
author: Claudine V.

description:
Blondie's should suck out loud on all fronts but it doesn't and here's why: they serve some of the best damn martinis in town, in a one-size-fits-all 16 ounce glass, with garNishes up the wazoo. 
 
My personal favorite is The Dagwood, which if memory serves (and it typically doesn't after fiNishing one drink here), contains gin and a mess of olives stuffed with pimento, spicy sausage, blue cheese and a cocktail onion. This is the modern translation of a liquid meal!

Best times to go (in this humble yelper's opinion) are during the afternoons of Saturday or Sunday, when you can watch the shoppers and Valencia Street denizens come to and fro.
author: Nish N.

description:
I have to admit I've only been once and it was a Saturday day when there wasn't any music. It was pretty dead when I first walked in but I was with a group of friends so it was perfect! The bartender was awesome! We had some fun coming up with a new drink for the bar.

Did I mention the martini's??? 16oz martini's really?!?! They were amazing and well worth the money! They pour one into a martini glass and give you the rest of the 16oz glass on the side. If you happen to be drinking slowly they'll pour it into another martini glass for you so the ice doesn't melt. So if you like double fisting this is the place to go! And they let you bring dogs in! At least on a Saturday afternoon they did. Love this place!
author: Erica C.

description:
I always assumed Blondies must be kind of fun if it has cover and is almost always crowded.

I would never go because of the cover, and the unappealing tunes that are constantly playing. It was a friend's birthday, so out of obligation, I tagged along.

I was inspired to write a review because I heard the refrain of every Top 40 dirty song from 2003 - 2009. Maybe my knowledge of mashup is lacking, but it was literally chorus after chorus of songs like Candy Shop and 3 6 9, damn shes fine, etc.
author: Torrey R.

description:
Feel like getting drunk with the bridge and tunnel crew? What about some 45 year old desperate women? Well, if you can stomach two of the Blondie's martinis, then you may surprisingly find yourself saying pile on the B&Ts and GMILFs.

In all seriousness though, the place is a bit of a crap show on weekends, but if you are in the mood for some dirty dancing (sweaty and gross supreme) then it's an okay spot. The place is much better during the week, when it is less crowded and may have live music.
author: E-dough R.

description:
MARTINI ALL THE WAY!!  BEST MARTINIs in SF! 

Large strong drinks of martinis with extra served on the side definitely makes it worth $12 and done for the night ! Good drinks,music and dance.. what else you ask for on a Saturday night party? Definitely not for the ones looking for a quiet place to lounge and relax. 

Loved my "Blondalope", so refreshing and tasty! Would like to come back to try the chocolate and all the rest !!!

PROS:
1. BIG SIZE MARTINIS! with extra served to pour after one drink, 1 drink = 2.5 drinks!!  
2. Large selection of martinis in the menu
3. DJ playing hip hop on Fri & Saturday
4. Small dance floor to shake your legs after buzz wit the drink!
5. Fun time
6. Small patio overlooking the street for people watching and smoke, lovely!

CONS:
1. Cash only
2. $5 Cover charge on weekend nights
3. Inspite of getting stamped once, if you get out of the door for a smoke or anything else will have to stand back in the queue to enter , tats ridiculous! So dont go out until you decide to leave!

Blondies is definitely one of my favourites in Mission and i'm a fan of your martinis!
author: Payal B.

description:
A pre drink before the photo shoot shesh!

I've been here on several occasions and the place is always a hit. The drinks are great and well priced. This is definitely one of my favorite spots when I go to SF. It's my meet spot with friends.
author: Daisy R.

description:
OMG. The friggin martinis in PINT glasses, or at least the rest of your martini (so like, two more) in a pint glass. :) Martinis are my fave now because of this place! 
I have never left this place without a black out and a great time. 
For that reason, it's ALMOST off limits for me, but not quite. I think I'll learn how to balance it all out...maybe.
Dancing: always. Fun: Definitely. Live band: sometimes, DJ the rest of the time.
author: Emdeezy F.

description:
Are you looking to end your Saturday night getting cursed out by a bar back?

Do you want to pay $3 for the privilege?  

Then Blondie's is the place for you!

Went here for a friend's bday.  Tried to be good sports, despite the crowds of falling over drunk half dressed girls spilling my beer all over me.  Tried to be good sports until my bf used the only available, albeit "out of service" bathroom and was cursed out by a bar back who dropped the F bomb WAY more than the situation warranted.  Oh, and when my bf tried to calmly explain how someone told him to go in that particular bathroom, he got kicked out of the bar.  Real classy, Blondie's.

If management is reading this, I understand your clientele may not be the cream of the crop, but there's no reason to treat your sober, paying customers with total disrespect.  

Don't go here unless you want to be treated like the filth on the floor (which, by the way, girls are dancing on barefoot.)
author: Kristin P.

description:
I THREW UP HERE.

I was invited here by a friend for some happy hour drinks (it wasn't cheap drinks, but when alcohol is involved, when isn't it a happy hour?) and while waiting for him, i hopped on foursquare to see what it had to say. "Get the Dagwood!" How could i say no?!

One of the guys i met up with had a cocktail glass with a bunch of olives (YES), an onion (YES), and some green beans (YES), and i asked him what it was. A damn Dagwood. Deal was done.

It's mostly gin (okay, all gin--Hendrick's at that!), with 5 different types of stuffed olives, a pearl onion, and 2 pickled green beans. It was delicious. What happens is the bartender fills up a pint glass with crushed ice, pours gin to the brim, shakes it for show, and pours a bit into a giant ass cocktail glass with these savory delights. The nearly full pint glass of alcohol? Sidecar. Really it's more like 2.5 drinks in one. And i had two of these.

The guys said i went through a rite of passage they had all gone through at some point, and hoped that i wasn't turned off by Blondie's. But really, how could i ever be? Looking forward to the next happy hour!
author: Phuong M.

description:
MY FRIEND THREW UP HERE.

Blondie's is a good place to go if you're looking to get completely smashed, because the martinis are GINORMOUS. When my best friend and I came here, the DJ was spinning a really awesome mix. The dance floor was empty at first because everyone just stared at it awkwardly, not wanting to be the first to dance. My best friend single-handedly fixed that. I couldn't finish my portion of martini, but SHE did, that champ. And just like that, she was belligerently (but cutely) drunk outside calling ex-boyfriends. We danced our asses off and had a great time. If it's around $25 bucks for two huge martinis (including the excess left in the shakers, which ends up being about 3 martinis in each one), you'd think they'd take credit cards, but I've come to accept that most places in the city are CASH ONLY.
author: Erin F.

description: Pretty good size bar. They played 90's music all night long. I am not sure if that is normal for this place or if it was just last night. They have a $5 cover to get in. There was a pretty mixed group, which was nice to see.
author: Katie R.

description: Tried and true bar in the Mission, Blondie's never disappoints. Cover can be kinda expensive and the crowd is borderline hipster, but they have super strong drinks and great hiphop throwbacks on Sat nights.
author: Vivian H.

description:
Tip: If it's crowded, head straight to the bar in the back. Get served with the quickness. 

Cash only, but they have an ATM out in the back.
author: Chris C.

description:
People say it's good to know what you don't want. I respect Blondie's because it makes very clear it does not have...food. 

As a customer, I liked it. It was a good place to grab a drink with a friend without battling crowds and a scene.
author: Katie M.

description:
Oh Blondie's how you have tricked me twice, I will never know!

The music here is TERRIBLE. Mainly the DJ loves to pull the bait and switch by playing ten seconds of your favorite song and then awkwardly transition with his lack of skill to your least favorite song. It is impossible to dance to this DJs spinning. I had to pay $5 to have my ears bleed??

On the positive, my friends all loved the dick and bush deal, probably just because it's called dick and bush.

Also, if you are down for a 16oz martini, this is the place to go. They do not however, know how to make anything that is not on the menu. If you order anything else, they assume you mean a 16oz martini, and give you one.
author: Caitlin H.

description: 7.2.14: DO NOT SUPPORT CURRENT MALE ASSHOLE BARTENDER!!! I went in last night after work for my bday, I have a friend in town from Memphis and I've been bragging about how amazing the atmosphere and drinks are! Love blondies. We go in last night, we are the only people, and I'm all excited it's my bday I'm Thirsty, let's do this! He comes over and I'm like we're not quite sure can we have two bday cake shots while we wait? "I don't know how to make those they aren't on the menu I only know how to make our drinks..." I'm like, oh, ok I can google it, or we just need another minute if that's ok. He comes back we order and he goes that'll be $25.00 cash only. I've been here before, I'm aware it's cash only and I'm like, "no worries" "thank you" and he goes, "no, I don't like anything left open, that'll be $25". Let me reiterate I just got off work (at a hospital), I look good and professional I have a wallet full of bday cash I'm happy to spend at your establishment, we are the ONLY people here. I have never felt more unwelcome or treated so poorly in my life. I worked as a waitress for almost 6 years in high school and college and a little after I always tip 20%, hell 40%!if I like you and my inhibitions are lowered. I left this guy a $1 bill so he would know I wasn't just stiffing him I was insulting him back the only way I knew how. Needless to say we left without even finishing our drinks and watched 3 other groups come and go immediately. If the owner is reading this I went and spent over $300 at a different establishment solely based on your customer service, get a new bartender!!!!!!  Otherwise blondies is a true San Francisco treat and I wouldn't discourage anyone from giving it a go under normal circumstances!
author: gretchen S.

description:
Blondies is like one of my high school dances--drunk, crowded, sweaty, and full of boys with erections, only here they're actually of-age raunchy men. Not to mention the old-school hip hop beats--girl you looks good, won't you back that ass up!

The only reason I came here last night was because they shut down the guestlist at Temple at 11:15 and would have charged us each 20 bucks to get in. A hop, skip and a belligerent cab ride later we were in the Mission and paying $3 to spend a night of dirty dancing at Blondies (#1 reason to go back). #1 complaint: Bouncer who told me to get off when I tried to dance on a table. Way to ruin the party! #1 thing to look for: Older man dancing on stage with a plastic hanger in one hand and spinning a towel in the air with the other. He's always there!

Ok, a tad more exciting than a high school dance. Not by very much though.
author: Kate V.

description:
Their martini's are huge!  Seriously.  A full martini glass and the remainder can fill a pint glass.

This is a great place to meet friends after work or before dinner.
author: James B.

description:
Saturday Night

Guy: *Offers his hand as if asking for a dance*
Me: Oh, no thanks, I'm dancing with my friend.
Guy: Let me just twirl you.
Me: Uh, okay. *Twirl* Thanks, bye.
Guy: Don't worry, I'm gay. Can we dance now?
Me: Um...good for you? No thanks.

I haven't heard this before. Maybe I'll start using it too? Haha.

Being at this bar is like watching a bad music video with terrible dancers and no rhythm, yet, you can't help but to watch.  

Nice place to hang out, not too empty and not too crowded.

My friends and I were sitting in a booth, drinking, and chatting. This guy, bless his heart for trying to get everyone to dance, but became easily annoying. Let's call him "Mr. Jazz Hands" - my friend coined that term after his, well, rendition of off beat dancing with jazz hands.  

He kept trying to use his jazz hands to summon women to the dance floor, but to no avail. Two minutes later, you turn around and see him thrusting and grinding into a man. Oh my stars! 

Point: Somewhat of an older crowd of misfits, maniacs river dancing across the stage, swaying arms, jazz hands, and a lot of stomping. Strange, yet, entertaining.

The bouncer is watching and shaking his head in shame. Then he suggests us go to the back bar - Blondie's Wet Spot Bar - to be shielded from these maniacs since a few of them almost dance bumped our drinks off the table. 

Maniacs, I tell you, maniacs!

The truth is I practiced some of these awesome dance moves for a future dance routine that I will bust out at the clubs except I have infused the little bit of rhythm that I have into it. :) The routine shall be properly named - MANIAC. Look out for it at a club near you!
author: Dolores L.

description:
A friend once explained Blondie's as "the HiFi of the Mission." Finally checked it out for the first time last night, and as predicted it was love. It's one of those places you won't want to hit up until you already have  couple cocktails in you but ohhhh the dancing. I really need to get out the Mission more often for dinner/drinks but hopefully when I do Blondies will be a frequent last stop.

Make sure you bring cash.
author: Brianna H.

description: Definitely a fan. I've only been once and it was pretty early in the night but hey, that may be how to do it! Lobo the German Shepherd was hanging out at that time too. So cute. I tried the G Spot while my friend had the Lobo (no not the dog, the cocktail). They were fun drinks and of course you really get your money's worth. Next time I want to try just a straight up dirty martini. Ohhh maybe with those jalapeno olives!
author: Jessie M.

description:
Have not written on Yelp in 2 years but this place calls for a review.


WARNING ----- SKETCHY PEOPLE ---- THEFT

I got my Iphone 4 stolen out of my purse (that was on me and closed) at this bar this past Saturday.  

If that shouldn't be warning enough to stay away from this bar, the dancefloor sucks and the music does too.
author: Olivia K.

description: If you are looking for a place to go on a Sunday night, this place is great! They have a very good live band and awesome martinis!
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Weird place.

I don't get why they charge cover. Would definitely be open to dropping in again if not for that -- it's not exactly like a club or lounge where you anticipate staying for a while.

HOWEVER, the almond mocha martini is super delicious.  And yeah, it's like, $15 for a martini, but they serve it to you in a 16oz glass, so it's really 3 martinis.
author: Richa A.

description: HUGE MARTINIS! Went here with a group of 6 people and it was great! There wasn't much for seating--then again it was a Saturday and REALLY busy (always a good sign)
author: Ashley K.

description:
I love Blondies!
If you're looking to have a super fun Friday or Saturday night, then Blondies is the place to go. The music is excellent, the drinks are great, and cover is $3 - $5. The ambience is decent.. it's not an upscale club (it is in the mission after all :) ), so if you're looking for a pretentious place full of snobs, where you have to pay $20+ to get in, and stand in like for 15+ minutes, then this is not where you want to be. But if you just wanna chill,  dance & have a good time, and then eat some pizza across the street to kill your buzz before you drive back home.. try Blondies! 
The only reason I'm giving it 4 instead of 5 stars is because:
1) They take Cash only, and that could be a pain sometimes!
2) Finding parking close by late on a Fri/Sat night is not the easiest thing!
author: Karuna S.

description:
One of my friends always likes to go to this bar.  She calls me up and says, "Let's go to Blondie's."  And I always say yes.  I really like this bar.  It's in the Heroin Addicts and hipsters Unite Corridor of SF.  Luckily, the heroin addicts don't come in inside Blondie's...the drink prices are too high.

I think the name of the drink I always get is the sweet melons.  This is my warm-up bar before I go somewhere else.  I never stay here all night long.  I just go in, have a drink or two, smile, thank the bartender then off to the next spot.  A nice intimate spot to have a drink with a date.
author: Cynthia B.

description:
Blondie's Blue Drinks @ 22:

Trouble. A not quite sure of our limits yet post-college crowd getting rowdy. Shameless dancing to classic hip-hop from the '90s (Snoop, Dre, 2Pac). A few nights where the memory is a bit hazy.

Blondie's Blue Drinks @32:

After a 7+ year hiatus, my buddy and I vowed to have at least a round for old times sake. It was one of the most effeminate bar purchases ever. The girls in front of us shook their heads in disgust. Dance floor quickly filled with a barely out of college crowd loving the terrible hip-hop of today. Music is too loud. Kind of want to go to bed early.

My younger self gives five stars, my current self gives one.

One thing that hasn't changed: those Blue Drinks are still mighty good. And full of trouble.
author: Jason B.

description: Love the place. The music is GREAT, but some of the bartenders are really rude. I asked one to recommend a drink and his response "you have to pick your own drink. I don't recommend drinks"  he was a complete dick so we left.
author: Elizabeth L.

description:
Me: (to bartender) I'll have one of those beers
Him:  alright
Me: guess what?
Him: what?
Me: it's my birthday!
Him:  that's $7

NOPE
author: Maxwell M.

description: My brother told me about this bar I had to try, and was trying to explain to me the whole concept of giving the left over martini in the shaker glass.  My immediate response was, "Well that's just stupid, it's just water at that point."  He tried to explain to me that this was not in fact what he was talking about.  Imagine my surprise when I ordered a martini, and GOT ANOTHER ONE IN A GLASS!  I was SOLD.  They also have super cute half pints if you don't want a full glass of beer.  (Why you would do this, I don't know, but it's awesome the option was there).  Bar was clean and popular for a Tuesday night, and the staff was very nice and attentive.  Plus it even came with it's crazy regular at the end of the bar.  Bar atmosphere complete.
author: Cindy B.

description:
Positives: a great place to get your groove on to the best/worst of the 80s/90s/00s. people watching. delicious adult beverages. minimal cover charge.

Negatives: cash only.
author: Valeria H.

description:
So I don't actually barhop enough to know the difference between someplace awesome and someplace just okay.
