What I do know is that Blondie's makes some pretty tasty drinks, plays some pretty fun music and has a remarkably clean ladies room.  When Poppy is wobbly the last thing she wants is to worry about balancing in a gross potty.

I think that maybe the drinks were expensive but Will W was there to pay the tab! 

ps. olives stuffed with sausage?!  olives with blue cheese?!  it's like dinner in my martini. thumbs up.
author: Poppy C.

description: This place was so fun! Love the huge martini menu because i love martinis and they gave you a HEALTHY amount which was fun and different. I loved that the music was like rap music from 5-6 years ago it was fun. We were also able to get a table pretty easily and it was nice sitting in a circle in a crowded bar.
author: Alexandra W.

description: I left my account logged in on my roommate's computer, and he wrote this review, but I think I'll keep it up, because I love this place too and find it literally impossible to not have an incredible time here.
author: Maia B.

description: Enormous drinks.  Horrible music.  Divey as hell.  Perfect.
author: Eric B.

description:
I used to think Blondie's was ghetto, but going there on a Monday night was pretty chill.  Nobody tried to grind me while I thought "save drink or run?"  We're making progress.  I suggest Monday nights.  

Nice bartenders and the drinks are HUGE!  Plus they don't kick you out if one of your party members is sleeping.  *Cough cough...Double Dutch*
author: Justine D.

description:
Blondie's: a real one and done experience.

$13 for a cocktail AND the rest of the shaker? Well, Blondie's, you have my full attention. This place serves up some really deadly drinks if you aren't careful about your intake. Overall, all of the mixed beverages on the overhead board are excellent and taste amazing without being overwhelming. My personal favorites are the Bohemian and the Sidecar. Now, we've all had a couple of drinks that just scream alcohol in your face, but Blondie's has managed to muffle that unpleasantness without taking off the bite. Personally, I can only handle one of their drinks and I'm at a fine state for the rest of the night. It's just enough to get a good buzz but not enough to convince you that the blonde across the room is giving you sexy eyes. In other words, it's the perfect amount. Just remember: one and done. Say it to yourself a few times before making any regrettable choices. So, Blondie's makes a good drink. There's definitely no question about that.

Now, the service and the atmosphere makes Blondie's a little tricky. I feel this place is understaffed and awkwardly crowded. On most nights, I've only seen one bartender at work for 30+ people. If you do the math, that means you'll be waiting a while for your drink, but at least that one drink will probably be enough. But then, even after you get the drink, you really have no place to sit. The bar isn't quite big enough for everyone on a crowded night and the booths on the other side of bar are only so big. This makes for a lot of tight squeezes and shoulder-to-shoulder drinking. Combine that with people who've obviously had too much and not enough room between the bar and the booths and you get awkwardness. in retrospect, most of the time at Blondie's, I'm either waiting for a drink or looking for a seat. Eh, at least the drinks are good.
author: Frank Y.

description:
Blondie's is my favorite bar in the Mission for a weeknight martini (yes, I said martini). I always go here either on a Wednesday, Thursday, or sometimes on Sunday afternoons. I avoid Fri/Sat nights because that is when the party rockers drop by ready to dance! There is a cover on these nights. I go on quieter nights (damm am I getting old?)...

I like the fact that you can sit inside the tiny little patio, enjoy your drink, have a smoke, and watch all the craziness in the mission. And the mission is craaaazy! It's great for people watching and you see all types pass by from trannies to tourists. It can be hilarious. The bartenders are nice and personable! The martinins are strong. So, if you're looking for a non-pretentious all welcoming chill bar, then stop by. If you don't like, there are many more nearby.
author: Leonel R.

description: So I came back here after a few years to see if much has changed. It has not, but I came during the day time and it's definitely a different scene. It's pretty trendy, but the layout makes no sense. Why have a dance floor and stage if it's not going to be utilized other than sitting around? I mean, you could probably set up more boots/tables/chairs for nights that you don't have a band playing (I'm guessing that's what it was intended for), this also applies to the "wet spot". It was less crowded than most of the other places I went to on a Friday night.
author: Phan H.

description: Cheap drinks, $5 cover, good enough music (I like it, at least - a lot of rap and hip hop from the 90's), but the crowd is just okay (lots of straight guys dancing with no moves).  I had fun when I went.
author: Ryan S.

description: Saw a really funny comedy show here tonight with some friends and was having a killer time with the generous martinis when some French ex-pats decided their foreigner status made them non-creeps. Wrong! They were handsy, asshole drunks and my female friend and I managed to divert them, only to watch them creep onward down the bar, lady by lady. Funny enough, the last pair happened to be friends with a male friend of ours who was hanging out so we chatted them up/intervened. And here's where the awesomeness of Blondie's as a bar chimes in: after our male friend left, these French boys got especially gropey with our new pals and the bartender James heard us trying to politely get these guys to back off, stepped in, and warned the dudes to take their hands off the girls. They pretended not to notice, he warned again and finally they called the bouncer to kick the jerks out after a final "I'm gonna kick u out if u don't let up" declaration. I already was having a great time and great service experience absent the other rude customers, but seeing the staff step in to look out for their clientele was really unique and awesome. Big thanks to James with the tattoos tending bar tonight and Darnell the bouncer, a pair of local heroes. Also I recommend the Dimlet Gimlet. Cheers!
author: Nicole C.

description: Been here a few times and it is a nice little spot for some yummy drinks.  They tend to be pretty generous with the alcohol and pretty quick.  The space is small, but I have been their mostly at off hours so I don't know how packed it gets.  Love going back there when I am in the area.
author: Robin L.

description: Intense but tasty Martinis. Each Martini is $15 but you get twice the amount you would normally get. It's a regular but nice bar. Waiters seemed to be quite overwhelmed and were not that friendly.
author: Chris S.

description:
The mood you are in will dramatically determine how well you like this bar. If you are in the mood for HUGE and DELICIOUS martinis in a chill and laid back atmosphere then you will be happy. If you are looking for cute and classy then too bad so sad. 

A large group of us went here last Saturday night. The service was fast and the drinks were great. I got the Red martini and really enjoyed it. My friends stated that the G-Spot martini and Almond Mocha were also yummy! The large booths inside allowed us to sit and talk even with a very busy bar all around us.

Definitely will go back when the mood strikes again!
author: Tuesday C.

description:
This place is awesome. If you are looking for some great martinis and friendly bar staff. You can never go to Blondies for just 1 martini. 

I would recommend getting there before you need to pay to get in. As this place is fairly popular it gets busy fast - the best time to come is midweek or during the afternoon when you can sit at the bar, in a booth or people watch on your perch onto valencia. 

The martini menu should provide enough options for the most picky of drinkers and the 16oz drinks are great shared or solo.
author: J J.

description:
Come early before all the "tourists" from the other parts of town arrive.

Cash only bar. Drinks on average are $12.50, However, The pour equals a pint when all is said and done...that's 2.25 cocktails for $12!

Service can be slow as only one bartender is working the bar at any given point in time.  Be patient and you will be rewarded.

Fantastic Martinis and other libations await as you curl up into the dark banquettes or sit outside on the make shift deck.
author: Shayne S.

description:
I've been to Blondie's twice and both times was left with a BAD taste in my mouth. The first time, I was yelled at by a bartender for taking a lemon for my drink out of the tray that was sitting open on the counter after he ignored my simple request for minutes. Despite the rude service, I enjoyed the dancing (even if the DJ refused to play anything we requested). 

However, after my second trip, I am NEVER going back. I've grown accustomed to the pretentious hipster attitudes from most bartenders in the Mission, but I've never been treated as poorly as me and my friends were a few weeks ago (see Ginna and Jenna's posts below). One of the bouncers was INCREDIBLY rude and constantly hassling us and pressuring us to drink more (even saying "If you're not going to drink, you gotta get out"). When I sarcastically replied, "Would you like me to take my 25 girls and all of our money and go somewhere else?" He scoffed, "I'll just get 25 more. Whatever." On that note, we started leaving and as I was explaining what happened to the nice bouncer at the door, the bartender yelled at me "If you want to leave, just get the f*ck out!" Oh hell to the nah. 

So we bounced. And we went to Double Dutch and spent hundreds of dollars and got incredibly sweaty in the hottest dance area (literally, not figuratively) in the Mission, but at least we were treated well and could enjoy ourselves. 

Blondie's, NEVER AGAIN!
author: Phoebe B.

description:
It's saturday night. It's your girl's birthday and you're already tpsy on the sangria from Cha Cha Cha. You want to DANCE at 11pm. Well, this was NOT the place to do that. After a $3 cover and a sugary martini something (it hurt my teeth), we quickly bolted to other watering holes, as it was just a collection of older men leering and young (possibly underage) girls getting trashed.

Hasn't been my scene since freshman year in college.
author: Vee B.

description:
Normally I only go there when I am waiting for a table at Puerto Allegre..but my companions last night suggested going their for a strong martini after dinner.
When we arrived the place was still fairly empty, with two bartenders. The bartender with the short hair was busy setting up the bar, while the one with long curly hair slowly made her way to us. 
My GF didn't care for her drink..and her BF was nice enough to trade her his..so we didn't have to bother the bartender. 
For the next 20 mins we sat at the bar and listened to the long hair bartender complain about how the bar wasn't set up to her liking...and how she couldn't find this or that...
Unhappy bartenders = Unhappy patrons..we left without ordering a second drink...didn't' want that negative energy to rub off....
author: Mimi T.

description:
Wow, great place to run into after a Sunday Brunch at Maverick's. Dark inside, with a hint of vodka in the air- how does that song go again by Journey.... Anyways, my friends and I sat at the bar and ordered, what else, martini's. I ordered a Diiiiirrrty Martini, that didn't disappoint. Ordering a martini at Blondies, is like ordering a milkshake at an old school diner, they give you the extra stuff as well- nuff said. This place, as the English might say, is "smashing". 

Will definitely be coming back again.  As a former Seattlelite this is one of my fave new spots in SF.
author: Derrick E.

description:
Cute bar in the Mission area.  There lots of drinks to order and all are located on huge black board above the bar.  The only problem is which one to order, they all sound good and different.  Some cons are this is a cash only place and I wish there was more places to sit.  The music was not bad on a Saturday night.  Not a bad place to hang out, dance, and have a few drinks with friends.  

HAPPY BDAY GILL.  LOVE YA!
author: Donna Y.

description:
Okay, so I've been in Vegas since 2004, yet somehow once a year when I make my one trip back, I always end up at Blondie's...not sure what it is about Blondie's that draws me in...maybe it's the Jackie O's...Oh yes...the Jackie O's...
It's a dive bar..tiny place, tiny dance floor...but it's all good cause if you're a local, live in the neighborhood then you know you will always run into friends and can always get a great martini...
author: Lei T.

description:
This place is cool.  It's in a great location and a small dance floor if you want to shake your booty.  I'm not a big martini drinker but I tried the deep blue and it was sickeningly sweet.  My stomach rejected it almost instantaneously.  

All in all I don't come here for the drinks but I do come here for the atmosphere.
author: Eleanor L.

description:
I'm kind of up in the air with this one.

Blondies is a super fun environment if you get there early enough before annoying tourist do. Also, if you get there early you don't have to pay a cover so thats cool. The drink prices are pretty expensive in my opinion but the martinis are pretty awesome so i guess it evens out. It gets really packed and the bathrooms are in an annoying spot so it gets packed and uncomfortable. but all in all, its a pretty chill bar.
author: Victoria G.

description:
Just this night, I am in this place dancing in my underwear and the bartender has the courtesy to not kick me out and just yells "Dude! Pants!" Though at the time I was pissed off for having to put clothes back on, now, at this time, I am thankful that on my deathbed, I can say that I one time in my life somebody yelled at me "Dude! Pants!" and meant it. So this place is A-OK in my book, which according to Yelp means it gets 3 stars

PS Actually, it was someone else's underwear I was wearing

PPS None of this is a joke

PPPS What is wrong with me?
author: Nicholas B.

description: Just as the names says.. a good hangout place only if u wanna have some drinks. though .u wont get any eats here..
author: Karen B.

description:
I showed up a bit late with my friend...we were meeting his boyfriend and the boyfriend's friend there. 

They had half of their martinit's already gone, and because they had been drinking earlier, we were able to grab the remainders of the glass.

Ok, so I did think it was slightly odd that they bring the tumbler with the strainer to you, but also it was kinda cool.

I only gave it 3 stars, cause I don't know what exactly the place is like. Seemed pretty chill, but a little too dark. And there wasn't that many people there. But I'll definitely go back to check it out for myself and have a tumbler all to me. Woot!
author: Nicolas H.

description:
Really, you can't argue with the Martini's - at 16oz, they are huge and generally the bartenders know what they are mixing.  Your best bet is to hit this place up for your first drink of the evening, and get out! ...that is...unless you want to be vodka-drenched cougar food...

The service is TERRIBLE - it's not rare I have to wait (i'm not kidding) close to 10 minutes to make an order, even in a medium-load crowd, without so much as an, "i'll be with you in a minute".  The music almost always sucks, and the owner or one of the employees has a big golden retriever - very cute - but inappropriate around tippy martini glasses and expensive fabric.
author: Mario G.

description:
I was bored and felt like getting a drink. I was supposed to meet a friend later but decided I didn't want to wait and had a crazy craving for not beer. Usually I drink beer and sip the occasional shot of whiskey but this night I was in the mood for not beer, was it a full moon?

They have this huge faded and hard to read board of specialty cocktails; I refuse to call them martini's. 

My first choice The Shaddy Daddy: Kettel 1 vodka with a splash of 'sour apple' garnished with a twist.

Then I wanted to try something called "The Jordannia" but they didn't have grenadine.

Finally I created my own drink, a Sidecar but with the Brandy and Cointreau replaced with B&B, I'd have rather had it with straight Benedictine but they didn't have that. I asked the bartender to name the drink after me if it gets popular and he said, "don't worry it won't". 

The specialty drinks are strong and they give you enough for two glasses worth, which averages out to $5.50 a drink.

I think I have that weird not beer craving out of my system but I know where to go if it ever comes back.
author: Manny F.

description: I met up with a big group here on a Saturday night and thought it was fun. Pretty packed by 12 or 1am, and annoying to get bumped into constantly by drunk girls falling down, but if you're there to dance and have the right group the place is OK. I found the drink prices to be average ($7 for a vodka soda). I like that they have two bars so even when it was packed I was never waiting in line forever to get drinks.
author: Lauren C.

description:
Only been there twice, both recent on Saturday nights but both were good times. Three things that made this place great  (1) Love the old Hip Hop music they played and its not that old because it gets the entire crowd going (2) They pour your martini glass out and give you the SHAKER with  the rest of the Martini, its like 3 drinks in one. I liked the Blue Funk (3) There is a pizza place with good pizza right across the street so when your buzzed and hungry just walk a few steps away and done. 

Two things to keep in mind to keep in mind (1) usually a $3-5 cover after 10pm (2) CASH ONLY
author: Sunny S.

description: I came here on a Wednesday night and was pleasantly surprised to find a chill band playing and three open spots on their patio waiting for my friends and I. The beer was pretty good, definitely a place I will have to return to for a martini. Other than a couple snogging at the end of the bar the place was really chill. Definitely bring friends.
author: Mike S.

description:
Girls trickled in for at least an hour as we waited to get our entire group together. (See Ginna B's review below.) They were showing a fight but yet there were hardly any seats so we sat on the dirty stage and speakers. Only one flat screen tv, mind you. Martinis were plentiful and there was a good selection but my martini was just OK. Waited, waited, waited for music as the fight went on and got treated badly by the annoying bouncer saying we were obligated to buy drinks and kept reminding us every 10 minutes even though we WERE buying drinks. Finally we told him we were leaving and he made an incredibly rude comment to one of our friends. 

My first time in San Francisco as an adult and was really unimpressed with Blondies. Bad service and rude.  

Go somewhere else to dance and/or watch sports!
author: Jenna A.

description:
Oh man. I've been avoiding this bar for quite some time because I knew if I I ever stepped foot inside, I'd be hooked and never go to another bar in the mission. I walk by this place daily, and for months now the purple lights, the non-hipster crowd, and the hip-hop beats that bring me back to my youth (well, high school dances at least) have screamed out "KELSEY! Come inside. You'll love it here." Just like Hansel and Grettle, except inside the witch doesn't want to eat me, she wants to give me giant, strong drinks and get me wasted.

Everything I thought about this place is true: it's so awesome that I'm probably not going anywhere else. Blondies is the only place I've seen that makes most (if not all) cocktails in a pint glass and, after they've poured it into a cocktail glass, give you the extra with a strainer. It's like 2 drinks in 1! I don't have to order long islands here because they do the economizing for me! Let me give you a Kelsequation to illustrate:

Kelsey + 2 cosmos for the price of 1 = Drunk and happy

Not only were drinks delicious, but they have a stage to dance on! And, we all know that if there is a stage in my vicinity, I have no choice but to get up there and work it. Oh yeah my friend, I've been known to bust out a mean robot on occasion, and last Friday night was no exception! Luckily the place didn't get too crowded so I had room to really get down.

Blondies: my new go-to bar in the Mission.
author: Kelsey E.

description:
Yeah, Super Size Martinis
I love the Shady Daddy! 
and the shaker too...love it
I have never had a bad time here, I like the music too and the stage!
author: Dee D.

description:
Don't be scared by $13 martinis- you're really getting 3 for that price. Hello, a martini WITH the shaker? SOLD. I tried the JackieO which had a lovely orange flavor and a good vodka kick. My friend had the Sidecar, which was tasty and strong. I'd say I left Blondie's quite happy that evening, and for a very reasonable price you can bet I'll be back.

The only reason I give this place 4 stars instead of 5 is because the crowd can get a little dodgy. It's right off of 16th St BART, and apparently becomes a bit like an offshoot of that BART station. I got there around 6 on a Saturday, and there were already some folks who should be packing it in for the night based on their BAC. I got a lemon squirted on me accidentally by someone too drunk to notice, and I saw the bartender refuse to serve quite a few folks. Don't let this stop you from enjoying the killer martini menu, though. I can't wait to go again!
author: Rose M.

description:
Been here 3 times so far (twice on a Saturday and once on a Friday). Here is the verdict:

PROS: cute girls that are not stuck up, decent DJ (depending on the night), comfortable dance floor (not one of the biggest, but seems to really work for the place), $3 cover charge on weekends (which depending on the night, can be a pro or a con), on a good night with the right amount of girls and a good vibe, this place can be a fun night out.

CONS: expensive drinks, can be slow with no one dancing, even on a night when people are dancing (usually around 12-2) it can feel dead. 

Recommendations: Don't come here to start your night off, instead finish it off here. Make sure you have had plenty of alcohol before coming here. And most important, take a peak inside to scope out the scene before you go barreling in with the $3 cover charge.
author: Nick C.

description: I've learned to greatly appreciate this bar.  I'm in love with their blondieloupe martini.  Although, I'm sad it's still cash only...
author: Jacquelynne S.

description: Great place to hang out with a few friends!  They have live jazz on Tuesday nights and it's not too crowded.  Awesome pint-size martinis and the staff is very friendly.
author: Mindy H.

description:
OMG! What a cute place. It got pretty crowded later in the night and there was live music ... even better , they do this EVERYDAY OF THE WEEK!! =)
I had a great time here. There is outdoor seating and a small dance floor. If you want to have a good time with your friends or wanna take your visitors to some neighborhood coolness, try this place in the mish!=) You wont be disappointed!

All of us walked around before settling at Blondie's and wow, the area is worth coming back to.. there are pretty cool places around! I will be back!
Mission is cool in its own way!
=)
author: C A.

description:
As you walk in, you probably think it's a chill bar. People are usually dressed down and it is a very much relaxed atmosphere but as soon as the DJ gets behind the booth and starts playing the mix of tunes, you are quickly on your feet and dancing like you do in front of your mirror! (+1 star)

And as far as the drinks, the BEST martini/cosmo selection in SF! quite a variety of flavors and unique mixtures. We came here for a girls night and ended up having quite a variety- Jackie-O Cosmo- GSpot- the Bohemian- Deep Blue Funk and the Blondieloupe (MY FAVORITE)(+1 star) and i was extremely pleased with the results plus the bartender was BEAUTIFUL! so for that they get a star! (+1)
You literally get 3 martinis for $13 bucks! what a deal! 

Good looking crowd, but of course, at every place you will find the typical douche bags... sadly.. even in the Mission :( This place is cash only (- points) and it can get packed so be prepared. Unfortunately, we had to experience Blondie's with a bit of the marina crowd- wild females, lack of rhythm, and lots of drunken messes but I will come back for their famous martinis!
author: Marcela R.

description:
For all of those Fridays after a rough week when I wished I could have ordered a "pint of bourbon, on the rocks", Blondies, you understand that the CostCo principle does not just apply to toilet paper and 5 pound tubs of Goldfish crackers. 

It's too crowded for me past 9pm, so I've only been here on off hours.  But Blondie's is the only place in town that I know of where you can order an excessively large Maker's Manhattan without receiving death stares from other folks at the bar, or having to pay $20. 

Sometimes even the most respectable of girls just needs a gargantuan $12 Manhattan.  You say "lush", I say "buy in bulk".
author: Sarah J.

description:
Really?? This bar is so full of itself it's about to implode. 
What a crappy place to visit. The bartenders have more attitude then they deserve, you're not on a UN peace keeping mission, you just pour drinks into glasses!
 "Robert" the bartender was a total piece of work, a sign on one of the doors' to the back bar states, "free wifi...ask the bartender for the password", I being the iPhone addict that I am, wanted to access the Internet (to write a review on Yelp of course!) when I asked "Robert" he stated that he was NOT a bartender and then turned his back on me and preceded to make drinks. Wow, great customer service!
 The clientele while more than happy to pack in like sardines and dance to the half rate DJ, believe they are a hipsters dream, more like a ASU frat  nightmare. I honestly turned to my friend at one point and asked her if somehow we got transported to the Marina.
Get a clue Blondie's, your scene is more nightmare then eclectic. Avoid at all costs unless you wish to wax nostalgic about your college days at the local bar.
author: Eden F.

description:
Blondies makes THE BEST martinis. I highly reccomend their Blondalope and Deep Blue Funk. Been here three times and the DJ is always really good. I also like that everyone is dressed pretty casual.

not five stars because its cash only!
author: Susana M.

description: Not sure why this place isn't more packed. The martinis aren't really martinis, they're really 10 ounces of vodka/gin on the rocks. I guess you can call them martinis because they'll give you 4 delicious bleu cheese stuffed olives on the side. Whatever they are, I don't know many places you are set after 2 drinks!
author: Mars C.

description: As a general rule, I try and avoid bars with $12+ martinis.  That is of course unless the bar is named Blondies, has a front patio for nice days, and comes with both the martini glass and a shaker (good for 2- 3 martinis)!  For that, I'm willing to make an exception.
author: Sean H.

description:
I love blondies. BUT, it is not one of those places I would recommend to "everyone".

The music isn't very "cool"- it's basically a mix of 80s/90s and the current club playlist- but I happen to love it. The drinks are expensive ($10) but tasty and HUGE. It gets crowded and typically the crowd can be a little lame (my friend actually used a different word to describe the crowd, but I feel weird about typing out words like that, so use your imagination). Even though it gets crowded, if you want to sit down- you can usually find a seat at the bar or in a booth.

For whatever reason, all of that adds up to make Blondies one of my favorite dance spots in the city for a Friday/Saturday night.

(oh- low cover as well, usually $3-5)
author: Rebecca A.

description: 4/5 be careful what you order! and don't waste a drop :)
author: Alvin D.

description:
Last night I went to the most poorly organized show I've ever been to and it was at this lame ass bar. Seriously, it took some fools an hour to set up an ipod. And you know what? They sucked! The only real band with real instruments didn't even go on until 11:50 even though they were slated to go on at 9. Seriously? On a Monday night? Plus the website is out of date. Plus the crowd sucked. Just lame all around. At least it was free, although a totally run of the mill martini set me back eleven bucks. 

I was not impressed and I can reasonably say I probably won't return. The DJs & bartender were nice, however.
author: Penelope C.

description: Holy smokes...(good) martini's the size of a small child and a oober efficient, friendly bartender to boot, (this doesn't happen very often in The Mish) OY to the world folks!
author: Shira O.

description:
Although this isn't the kind of bar I would recommend to someone who wants to go out and get crazy and meet a ton of people, but I would go here any night of the week.  They have live music almost every night and the nights that they don't they place the type of old school music that you miss as well as some newer songs.  I have experienced 3 bartenders here...1 of them was not rude, he was just very quiet and even though the bar was fairly empty you had to wave him down to get his attention...the other 2, were both very nice, talkative, and gave free shots as they came on duty!

This is the perfect bar for a mid week happy hour/late night when you just feel like chilling with some friends, listening to good music, and drinking delicious/strong/cheap drinks.

Yes, it is a cash bar, but there are plenty of those in this city, so just be prepared.  If you aren't prepared, they have an ATM by the restrooms.

The drinks are 10 dollars for a martini and they are so good and since they give you the shaker it is basically like you get 2 and a half drinks.  Someone else's post said that they kick you out if you don't drink...I have gone and spent 3 hours in this bar and only had 2 drinks and they didn't kick us out at all or even hint to us anything like that.

Anyhow, this place is very chill and close to all the other mission bars so I would suggest not only going during the work week, but also going here to get a few drinks before heading to some other more expensive bar.
author: M M.

description:
This place is OK. It has good music, decent drinks, and a fun atmosphere. The reason it only earns 3 stars, however, is the rudeness of the bar staff. My boyfriend and I were getting drinks at the back bar last night when the bartender--trying to do too many things at once--knocked over my boyfriend's full beer while wiping down the tables and trying to take another group's order. We thought, okay, no big deal, accidents happen, we'll just ask for a new one when the bartender gets a chance. But no. When we did finally get his attention he tried to charge us for the beer that he knocked over. When we--very calmly--explained what happened, he proceeded to get extremely defensive and actually poured out the full beer he was going to charge us for. All in all, not a good experience. The bartender was clearly overwhelmed and didn't know what he was doing. My drink was downright bad and others around us did not look too please with theirs either. The one saving grace was that the owner of the bar replaced my boyfriend's beer with no questions asked. I just hope they get rid of that guy in the back... I know bartenders deal with drunk folks all night long and tend to use that as an excuse to get gruff with people, but when it comes down to it they should still treat customers with at least a modicum of respect.

TL;DR stay out of the back room if you can and stick with the owner--she's great!
author: Amy L.

description: Wonderful cocktails, great location. Open area to people watch on a sunny day. Go on a Wednesday night when Andre Thierry and the Zydeco Magic is playing, so much fun!!
author: Shelley M.

description:
The most overrated Mission bar I've been to.  I cannot, for the life of me, understand why this place is recommended by so many guidebooks.  Perhaps this is the kind of cheesiness that guidebook writers love. The place is way too small.  If you went there with a group of over 4 friends, you'd feel like your crew was taking up too much precious space.  The security is indeed bizarre.  The last night I was there, around midnight, one of the security guys came around to the tables, telling us they close at 1:45.  He came back around every 15 minutes giving us a running update of how long we had left.  What?!?  Destroyed whatever little positive vibe the place was mustering.

The clientele seems full of people from outside the Mission who are there to "experience a wild night in the Mission."  I felt like everyone was scared of me in there.  Blondie's reputation is better outside the Mission than inside.  That's a clue.

Skip it.
author: Jack H.

description:
I think this place changed its M.O.  It used to have the raised stage on the left hand side when you walked in...which used to have a DJ and the groupies of the DJ hanging out.  It was raised quite a bit, so imagine my surprise when I walked in on St. Patty's day, only to see a much smaller stage with a band.  No DJ booth...a band.   I'm pretty sure this place is a live music joint now...and unless I'm wrong, that's pretty cool.  Small bands need places to play too.

Small bands (and I don't mean stature), can come to a bar that has a nice beer selection, in addition to the most insane martini menu this side of the Mississippi.  Seriously.  Every liquor, and they even have a section on their board that is kind of a DIY thing.  Pick a liquor, pick a juice, etc.  The coolest part is that they serve the martini in the martini glass, with the shaker (which happens to be a glass) next to it.  With a strainer.  They definitely don't skimp on the liquor.  

While I wasn't a huge fan of this bar pre-makeover (if they actually had a makeover), I'm a little more likely to come back now.  See another small band... (hopefully this time one small in stature).
author: Lauren F.

description:
I came on a Tuesday so the place was basically dead except for my crew and a few others. 

The layout of the bar confused me a little because of the huge open area in the back with not enough tables or seats. I guess it gets more crowded on weekends and possibly involves dancing, but it was a little uncomfortable trying to share two stools among like 6 people.

What really drove me crazy about the bar though was what happened when I tried to get a drink. As I approached the bar, there was no one behind it. Okay, fine, it's a Tuesday. You don't actually have to chill AT the bar all bored and alone waiting for someone to order. But usually the bartender at least keeps an eye on the bar so that when someone DOES want to purchase a drink, they are able to do so in a timely fashion.

No. I waited. And waited. And waited. 

I read the descriptions of ALL the cocktails. They sounded fine. I considered the apple martini but decided I hadn't had a good enough or bad enough day to warrant a cocktail.

I started to get nervous that maybe my looking at the cocktail list indicated that I was not ready to order and thus discouraging the bartender from showing up, so I tried pointedly to not look at the menu.

I looked at the place where the bartender should be. I looked at the dog sitting on the stool next to me. He hadn't been served yet either. I looked around for people who looked like the bartender, so I could ask them politely for a beer.

Suddenly, this very angry woman ran behind the bar and made herself a drink. 

Ah, I thought. It must be serve yourself night.

She looked directly at me and said, "It's okay, I work here." But before I could say, "I'd like an Anchorsteam," she had disappeared.

She reappeared later, not to take any orders, but to turn on the music. Someone else who worked there came around to tell her to turn it off. Now there were TWO bartenders behind the bar debating whether the music should be on or off and not serving the growing crowd. 

They started having a very childish fight where one would flip it on, then one would flip it off, then one would flip it on, and so forth. It would have been amusing were it not standing in between me and my beer.

FINALLY, the other, less angry, bartender started actually waiting on customers. No apology. No "thanks for your patience". No "would you like a free 'wow you are really patient' cocktail?" (although I probably should have demanded such a cocktail rather than expecting it would have been offered). 

I don't have many other complaints about this bar. I find the name amusing. It would have been a 3, maybe even 4-star experience otherwise. But I think one of the worst business practices imaginable is making your customers wait long periods of time to pay for things when there isn't a good reason (like a line of other paying customers) for it.
author: Liz G.

description:
All I can say is, they make a damn good Snakebite here and they do it with Guinness. Yummee!

I don't know how many times I've had to talk bartenders through the ins and outs of a decent SB, but this cat nailed it, so it was much appreciated. He also made a pretty solid Manhattan which can be way too strong or way too sweet at other places, so there's a few points for that. 

All in all, this is a great middle of the day bar in the Mission where you can slink down low into a booth and shoot the shit and have some laughs. My favorite kind of bar.
author: Stephy S.

description:
Oof. Bachelorette party train whistle stop. Perfumed men. One of the larger douchebag annexes in the 16th Street area.

A place to avoid unless you know the bartender. But even then, there's a security cam trained on you both, so you can't win.
author: Jeremy W.

description:
I love this place for their delicious dirty martinis (with gin, not vodka, of course). It is a great place to go after work with some friends to wind down. And what is better than an $11 martini that is actually 3 martinis (and three olives!)? 

Split it with a friend if its too much, you lightweight!

BUT! I was a little perturbed last time I went and let me tell you why...The woman making my drink said "I am going to throw some spicy beans in, you'll love it, I promise!" I was doubtful ,because I am serious about my dirty martinis with OLIVES. Was she going to add the beans on the side, mix them in with my olives, WHAT!? The suspense was killing me...

To make a long, and anxiety ridden, story short she TRADED IN MY OLIVES FOR GREEN BEANS. Yes, you read me right.  I thought, its okay, maybe I will like it-be adventurous, Siobhan, try something new. 

It was horrible. It made my martini taste like spicy green beans, and she also didn't make my martini dirty, because that would just taste *weird* with spicy beans. 

OMG WTF.

I won't hold it against you Blondie's.  But Word to the Wise: do NOT screw with a martini drinkers dirty gin martini with extra olives. Just don't.

I need a drink.
author: S F.

description:
Don't come here unless you want douche bags hitting on you. The crowd is terrible. Nothing but trashy patrons. I rather go to a dive bar than this.

nuff said! (TM Stanley K)
author: Stanley K.

description:
Blondie's, I had never been here before but seen it many times.  I'm not a cigarette smoker and I'm guessing that's a big draw to the bar since it has a nice outdoor/semi indoor patio.  We decided to go in after being discapointed in Double Dutch not having a free keg on Tuesday's=(  But this was a good decision that felt much better.  I had a gin and pineapple juice, it's been my new mix up drink and a Tecate pint on tap.  Which I have never seen before, I usually drink my Tecate out of a tall can or a 18 pack for $9.99.  I will be sure to bring lime's ever time I drink one though, thanks Mr. Bartender!

The best part was the live music and incredibly hot guys everywhere.  Again Kristen's black eye helped us out on getting the attention of guys.  God I love that, its like a pick up line from us without saying anything and then we get picked up.  I'm gonna miss that black eye when it's gone.

Hot bartenders, hot bar goers, fun atmosphere, not bad prices on drinks for a nice bar.  I will return!
author: Megan L.

description:
Mmmm!! I love martinis... vodka ones especially... 16oz. martinis for $11.  $12 or $13 with tip.  It makes 2 martinis basically and they are pretty yummy.  I had the Hottie or the Hot Tie according to Mike.  It had these spicy pickled green beans which are soooo good.  It was also made with pepper vodka.  I can't wait to try the other flavors next time.  

The music in here isn't that great and they allow animals in here... ummm... i'm not a big fan of having animals near my alcohol.  Maybe i'm just uptight.  It's a small little place but i don't need a super fancy place for drinking.  

I'm not sure how it would have been if we had stayed longer but it was a great appetizer to the rest of the night.  Let's just say i'm accident prone and  have a crazy scab and bruise from it.
author: Aaron G.

description:
I stopped going here because it's always so dull! People hardly move, never talk and my cocktails are never good. 

I don't particularly care for the people or the music they usually play as well. It's a little too pop-y for me. It's really quite sad, too. They have a nice space and plenty of places to sit. 

With all of the other options in the area, I don't see a reason to come back..
author: Ryan V.

description:
I came to Blondie's two weeks ago on Friday night for my friend's birthday party.  I've never heard of the place before so I really didn't know what to expect.  It's a pretty small and cozy martini bar that draws in a very diverse and friendly crowd.  The first thing I noticed when I looked up at the menu above the bar is that all the drinks listed were martini drinks.  The second thing I noticed is that they *only* accept cash.  Initially I thought the drinks were pretty expensive, but if you order a martini you get this huge drink, plus whatever is left in the shaker.  That totally reminded me of getting a milk shake.  That night I mainly ordered shots of grey goose (no milkshakes for me), and I must admit they poured good sized shots (each shot seemed like 1 1/2  shot) that got me buzzed.

This spot also has a nice little outdoor area with a couple of tables where you can sit down and smoke outside, while still inside the bar.  In the back they also have a small little dance floor to dance like no one is watching (I wish I wasn't watching some of them, that's for sure).  I also find it amazing how this little place manages to have two bars, the main bar in front and also one in the back by the restrooms. Music wise, early on they were stuck on 80s/90s hits, but afterwards they were playing hip hop.

Summary: 
The Good :) Chill, diverse, & huge drink portions. 
The Bad :( Cash only & overly crowded.
author: Mike S.

description: I've never eaten any food here but I am a frequenter for the martinis.  They are very good and you get the extra from the shaker on the side.  It's really like 2 and a half martinis.  Also, this place is fun for dancing on a weekend night.
author: Julie B.

description:
Yeah I thought it was the pizza place too!

This place is way bigger than Double Dutch. A lot of room to dance and there is an outside patio where you can sit and smoke. Insider there are also seating booths which looked way comfy than DD. 

The bar looked pretty nice and they had a menu of drinks for you to choose from.

Only down side is that they had a $5 cover charge when I came. 

Oh yeah they restrooms doesn't look friendly at all.
author: Tracy A.

description:
You gotta go for Blondie's specialty drinks. Yes, the ones up on the chalkboard.

I don't know about the atmosphere. Yes, they got the purple neon lights straight out the 80's. Wait... I love the 80's! But the music they were playing there was depressing though.

$11 for a drink!! You're kidding!!  Ahh but you get the entire hi ball glass worth. That's like 3 drinks man.

I got the Rob Roy, since I've been on a Manhattan binge. Wow, it was smooth... I thought it was almost water downed at first.

Deliciously deceptive.
author: Sam T.

description:
This bar is for white people who can't dance.

I'll be back.

(They play good popular music and the bartender looks like Mark Ruffalo - good call Kristin R! - minus stars for cash only and one girls stall)
author: Jessica L.

description:
Thanks for filtering all the gross people away from the bars I love. 

I almost gave you five stars for that.
author: Olivia W.

description: Tried every drink on their board. Been going for years. I rather go tight after work and take off before the late night folks arrive. You can bring in outside food to enjoy with your drink... Score!!!!
author: Amelia M.

description:
The whole no credit card thing has its pros and cons. I wanted to buy a round for my group of friends tonight, but didn't have any cash. So one of the friends picked up the tab. So it sucked that I couldn't buy drinks, but it was pretty awesome that I still got drinks and didn't pay for them, all without looking like a cheapskate!

The Saturday night DJ was great, playing popular rap and R&B while staying away from the truly shitty stuff that is ruining the genres. Not an easy tightrope to walk. They even took a request for "Lady Don't Tek No" by Latyrx. Nice.

It's not the club's fault, but my night ended on a down note. All I wanted to do was eat at Naan 'n Curry, but the group I was with was all about getting back to the East Bay ASAP. We decided to walk towards NNC while finding a cab, and almost made it there before one finally picked us up. And now I go to bed with a hungry stomach because I don't have any snacks in my cupboards or fridge.
author: Trey C.

description:
I'm probably the last person you would expect to have fun at Blondie's but I actually had a good time there this past Friday night.  I'm sure the fact that I spent the evening dancing with hotties Jay H and Vivian C (not to mention the numerous cocktails) had a lot to do with it!
I'm not sure that I'd return but on this evening Blondie's was a decent option to dance the booze away.
author: phil h.

description:
PACKED.  Saturday night, I arrived around 11 and this place was swingin.  Well worth the three dollar cover, my friends and I somehow squeezed between a man built like a Chevy truck and a bunch of wobbly, drunk Barbie types.

The coat check was $2 per item, but the guy let us put three jackets, a sweater, and a scarf on a hanger for the price of 1.  I gave him $7.

We got tequilla shots (pronounced: to-kill-ya), a round of four was about 20 bucks.  Pricey, but hey, its the City, whaddya expect.

Overall had a wonderful time there.  Crowded, sweaty, pumping music.  Just what I needed on a Saturday night!

CASH ONLY SUCKS.
author: Mari C.

description:
This place takes me back to about 11 years ago, when I first moved to SF.  I never went to Blondie's, even though I lived in the Mission.  There was a reason for that - in a word, choades.  My bike-ridin', veggie, organic food eating, poor ass could be found at Rainbow Grocery, the Elbo Room, Morning Due, and a few neighborhood dive bars.  Never Blondie's - it was like the Marina came to the Mission, and we all know you don't want that . . .

fast forward over a decade, and not much has changed.  After a certain hour, there's no reason to be there.  Drinks are pretty good, and they give you the whole mixer glass for refills, and it's pretty chill early in the evening, but it's just not worth it when it gets crowded on a weekend night.
author: Joe B.

description:
I've seen this place out of control at night so I'm assuming I loved the early evening vibe. Dark, semi-quiet, seats available by the windows - it was great.

Just if you come here, get ready to be WASTED. I had 2 drinks and, I swear, someone had to scoop me up off the floor. Not even martinis, just two regular drinks. Something called mandarin gremlin, or grobble, or something. And a greyhound. And I was done. Kevin, the cute bartender, serves a wicked strong punch-packing drink.
author: C P.

description:
Update from nicole d.:
"sorry you
didn't hear me when i spoke with you the night you lost your wallet. i said "give me your info and IF your wallet or any of its contents are found, i will call you. i will NOT call if they are not found" .  as you can imagine, we get a ton of calls regarding lost belongings; i would be calling people all day. this is why i explain at the time that i will only call if something is in fact found!"

While I appreciate her update nearly three weeks later, I actually don't imagine they get a lot of calls about lost items. I only have 8 years of restaurant and bar experience but was always able to either answer or return a phone call or respond to an email about a lost item.
The fact she messaged me here also indicates she does indeed have time to respond about this.

Regardless, it displays a clear lack of concern about her past or potential customers, that she has a policy of not returning calls/emails.

Interestingly enough, nicole d. also has time to review Yelp with a one star rating, complaining about people complaining about her bar!
author: laura g.

description:
So, I've never been there during actual going out hours.  Perhaps this is why I don't have the same impression as some of the other reviewers.  I find Blondie's to be mighty fine during the awkward post-lunch/pre-dinner drinking hours.  First, there is no cover.  Second, there are almost no other people here at this this time.  Third, the music is bartender selected and more than decent.  Fourth and foremost, the drinks are just as large.  

Also, you get the bonus of feeling a bit seedy for drinking in the afternoon, as there is no denying you are in a bar when it is so dark inside and so blazingly sunshiny out.  Really, who doesn't want to feel just a tad sleazy now and again?
author: L W.

description:
As I sat in a booth at Blondie's last night sipping my ridiculously strong "Johnny Social," listening to one of the best jazz drummers in the city performing on stage, I became sad that this bar doesn't get more love on Yelp.  But then again, more room at the bar for me.  

Some of you call it ghetto.  Some of you call it Marina.  Some of you call it yuppie.  Some of you call it hipster.  Some of you call it Bridge and Tunnel.  I call it the only bar in the city with a good mix of people.

I've been feeling disappointed by some of my former favorite stomping grounds  but I know Blondie's will always be off the hook.  I've always received excellent service here (probably over-served at times) and yes, sometimes it gets rowdy.  Everyone I'm dancing around with always looks like they're having a great time.
author: Kerry D.

description: Fun times, good DJ on the dance floor, and ridiculously strong martini's. After bar hopping for a few hours, we ended up at Blondie's. I ordered a chocolate martini for $11. It was definitely expensive but strong and huge (extra on the side to add to the glass when you finish the first glass...). I loved the chocolate garnish so much (I'm guessing it was a mini three muskateers bar), that I decided to order another chocolate martini to get more chocolate. I should have just begged for a piece of that chocolate because I definitely did not need the second martini! Oh well, you live and you learn and, if you're me, you often crave chocolate when you've been drinking... dangerous!
author: Meghan P.

description:
Two drinks stand out: Almond Mocha martini and the Mint Chocolate Kiss martini (and I don't even really like chocolate or mocha!).  4 thumbs up for these.  $12 dollar drinks, but they give you the shaker with the glass so it's actually two drinks in one.  Very worth it! 

Really good music to hang out too being played before dancing starts at 10-10:30pm.  Then it's more mainstream.
author: Himelick M.

description:
I had some friends visiting from Mexico and we headed to Blondie's on a Friday night. 

I could not believe how racist this place is. First i showed them my California ID and they let me in but when my friends showed their VISA, they were denied entry to this place. 

When I asked why, the bouncer said that the owner was trying to make the place better so our type of people were not welcome. I was enraged but instead of making a scene we left and went to the HOLLY  COW. 

I just can't believe that even now in 2007 we are still getting denied entry to places just because of our race.  So please if you believe in equality boycott this place.
author: Vanessa L.

description:
I'll be honest, I only come here when I am waiting for my table at Puerto next door. 

The cocktails are freakin huge, so don't be surprised by the large price tag. You can usually snag a table or bar stool, or at least I've never had a problem with it. It can be obnoxiously loud when someone is spinning, or on weekend nights. 

One (or two) pint sized cocktails later, and I'm ready for Burrito Time. I vaguely recall a decent beer selection, full of local breweries and some other favs, but this place is better for cocktails.
author: Brooke B.

description:
If I had known their mixed drinks came in pint glasses, I probably wouldn't have ordered one, since it was the drink that put me over the edge... but still, it was perfection in a pint glass. 

Besides the fantastic drinks, this place reminds me a little of a college bar. They had an IPod rocking out some favorite dance songs of today and yesterday, and the dance floor was clear enough that my girls and I could take it over (as well as the stage). Friendly crowd.
author: Alyssa S.

description:
Sunday afternoon. sidewalk table. a nat sherman and a sidecar. wholesome.


(sunday afternoon only.)
author: Megan W.

description:
Martini's are made of only the best tasting rocket fuel. Goes straight to the interior of the cranium liketysplit. How do I know? Friend's wanted me to pick them up on a Friday evening before dinner. I was stuck at work for a spell.

Call One: Yeah, we'll be at Blondie's. Pick us up when yer done with work. 

Call 2: (Inaudible ass dial sounds of bar for 1 minute) This place is AWESOME! We're drinkyrldldianfloji*#&*$ our drinks..piky up. 

Call 3: Chorus: WHERE ARE YOU??? We're f*#@! still here drinkalinkingly smashola. Bra*&$^#%@&!! C'mere an' get us if you dare!! Mother...(Inaudible bar din for 1 min due to failed phone disconnection. Stranger picks up phone from floor.) Hello, hello? Anybody there? 

Call 4: (2 minutes of bar noise.) Chorus: WE WANT FOOD..YEAH.. Where ..dr**$&#^* (phone drops on floor again. Disconnects).

I pull up and honk the horn. The parties in question try to exit with Martini  glasses and start argument with the bouncer. "What the F*&$^#..can't treat us like...." 

After some mumbo jumbo about their civil rights, they finally got in to the car oozing Martini stink and cursing like lady sailors.

In short: place is too crowded on the weekends. But they make a kick-ass Martini that's well worth patronage.

4 Sir Charles Barkley's
author: Johnny C.

description:
Yeah i like this joint! The bar tender is adorable to stare at and the space is nice and quaint! The drinks are reasonable and the place is dark and comfortable on a weekday. 

My girl friends and I went here on a Tuesday night, we got a booth to ourselves and a great live band showed up.. all for free!
author: Ashley M.

description:
This place has really gone down the tubes the last 5 years. It has become a place for Marina types to go after eating in the Mission.
Really to be avoided on a Saturday night. I'd rather go to Dalva's around the corner for better overall service, drinks, music and crowd.
author: miriam b.

description:
Hmmm... this is the place to come to if you are serious about martini's and want good value- a $10-12 martini at Blondie's is really like 3 martini's at any other spot around town.  They have every martini you can think of - gin/ vodka based and to top it off you get your own personal martini shaker so you can top your drink off as you sip yourself into the night.  There's usually some live performances/DJ every night of the week and on weekends there's a modest cover $3-5
If you find yourself stumbling out of Blondie's you'll have plenty of options for pub grub- since they don't have any food (and make it a point in how they named the establishment 'Blondie's Bar and No Grill).  There are a few outdoor tables and the bartenders responsive and charismatic!
author: Akash D.

description:
UPDATED 2/26/07
After taking the JEPET this Saturday, my roommates and I decided to treat ourselves to some martini bliss.

the scene and bartenders were different this time, but equally impressive.

The place was crowded but not packed, there were a good amount of people on the dance floor, and the music was still great.

The bartenders again were very attentive and made wonderful drinks. My roommate is obsessed with these green beans they have, and the bartender made sure he always had a few in his drink.

love this place!
************************************************
I can't believe so many people have problems with this place! Great martini's merit it at least three stars, add an amazing bartender, fun environment (you can actually talk to the people you're with without screaming), and reasonable prices...I loved it!
author: rachel c.

description: Perfect place if you like Martini's.  Twelve bucks for a martini, Drinks are huge and you can keep refiling your class with the left overs from the shaker.  (more like three drinks)  Atmosphere a little drab, but a fun place if your in the right mood!
author: Tashie P.

description:
So the first time I tried to come here, it was closed for some reason... no sign, nothing, just locked up during business hours.

Whatever, it's still supposed be the best martini in SF.

It is. First off, I've never seen larger than a 10oz. martini. They sell them by the pint here. WOOHOOO! (and at $11 for a Junipero martini, by far the best drink deal I've found in SF.) Two martini lunches are not suggested here. You'll be on the floor.

Had the Dagwood, f-in' awesome. Had a chocolate martini, even better. (I love chocolate, shutup.) I should have eaten before coming.

I still don't know how I got home last night.

This place fucking rocks. Now for a beer to cut this hangover.
author: Dave M.

description:
Dear Blondie's,  

Please go back to the Marina.  You are not wanted here in the Mission.  

Sincerely,  
Michael Micholic
author: Michael M.

description:
Went here for my birthday recently and LOVED it!! I had never been here before and when 2 of the girls I was with stated they were going to share a martini I thought WTH?!?! Well I understand why--you can share them and still have half a shaker left over--awesome! Now I get why they are $11.50-$12.50 a drink.

The Deep Blue Martini was awesome--it really does taste like a Blue Otter Pop! Our bartender, Molly, was a sweetheart! I liked the vibe of the place too. There was a DJ and some dancing in the back. First time here and I will definitely return!
author: Jeannette R.

description:
So... I'm not really a 'mission girl' but I always seem to have fun at Blondie's. I like the music selection - all kinds of random but good songs. No one here can dance. At least the night we went. Well... no one but me. :-) I looooove to dance and will give any place at least three stars that allows me to dance the night away. 

Also - we got there early and were able to avoid a cover. Not that the cover is high, but i'd rather not pay a cover. 

This place gets crowded so be prepared to fight em off.
author: Ali R.

description:
I know people will beg to differ with me when I call this place a martini bar but have you seen the menu? HELLO! 
I've practically tried all of the martinis and some of my favs are the chocolate (big surprise), polish ( I heart Chopin vodka), and the G spot (their take on the cosmo) all $11....SCORE! After downing your 16 oz martini, yes that's right they'll fill your martini glass then hand you the shaker so you can polish off the rest, go to the back to dance your butt off to what ever band is playing that night or whatever the do feels like spinning.

Bright neon lights line the ceiling and walls. There's few tables on the side and in the back, the tables are hard to come by. The scene is good mix mid 20's to late 30's, even saw peeps I normally see in the marina. Although these peeps are mellow and friendlier.
author: Lola L.

description:
Let me paint the scene....

3 ladies from the Marina walk in a bar--insert joke here--

Find a spot and park it at the bar. Cutie blond bartender brings us some delightful cocktails and a beer for this "vodka strike" chica. 

Then a fight break out between a friend and boyfriend. She runs out... I chase after her because one little marina girl running around mission sans her giant 5'11 friend... NOT ALLOWED. 

Grab her... run back... to grab other friend.... out of breath... too much running after pizza and beer....

Bouncers. Sweethearts were honestly concerned about very sad stormin norman who juts ran from bar. I ask... we have to go some place else.... can you suggest a place around here? " Uh... no. This is the only good place within walking distance" 

*roll eyes*
*Hail cab*

Yet another failed attempt to remove marina girls from the marina. 

It is what it is.
author: Nancy B.

description:
I give it a solid 3. 
One of my first nights out in San Francisco involved Cassanova' s and Blondies. 

Blondies for the ultimate lemon drop...and unfortunately one is enough, for fear of running into the ultimate chode. 

Bonus points for an outdoor seating area, but be prepared to be assaulted by random passerby's sympathy and a cigarette.

It's a meat market. I wouldn't go there past say, sundown, but it's alright to curl up with a friend in the wet spot back in the bar and hug your shaker.
author: Jessica P.

description:
The Mission is usually filled with hipsters and yuppies and Blondies is no exception. But I brave the douche-baggery, because I always have such a great time here. Just come with your friends ignore everyone else and you'll have tons of fun! Its one of my favorite night spots in the city. Remember to bring $3 for the cover charge. 

This is a design your own Martini bar and each drink is $11. But not only do you get a Martini glass full, you get the rest of the shaker which is 1 or 2 more drinks! Its like the happiest milkshake you'll ever try. And let me tell you, these babies are strong! You'll spend $20 and be good for the entire night, believe me.

After you're good and soused get on the dance floor. Its tiny and crowded(I actually like that) and the DJ is good. Fun hip-hop plays all night. I find myself dancing till last call and sad to leave.

Blondies is always packed so be prepared to fight for the very few booths or table. But you should be dancing instead of sitting anyways, cause that's way more fun. Getting a drink isn't that bad, because theres a main bar and  little bar in the back too.
author: Ashley R.

description:
Hmm i dont want to sound overly negative about this bar.. its on valencia so you shouldnt walk in with the greatest of expectations i guess.. I will give it one star for the smoking patio, and another because they had a pomegranate margarita that my girl said was great. 

but other than that its kind of a weird mixture of people.. and by people i mean the two or three people actually inhabbiting the bar. . . 
the bartender was straight up like "what do you want".... "Uh, okay Mr pissy ill have a beer and one of the floofy margaritas... " 
BArtender "No"
me, "excuse me, did you say no?"
barkeep, "One drink per person"
Me "okay pal, ill go get her ID"
Barkeep, "No have her bring it herself"

So yeah i wasnt impressed by the high level of customer service.. most empty bars are a lil more inclined to show a more friendly demeanor when trying to attract customers. 

anyways pass this place, take a glanse in, but i would spend your money elsewhere..
author: jamie z.

description:
Maybe this is me just having a gay old time with friends again, but I think Blondie's fits a niche quite well.  If you're looking for the experience comprised of dancing to a spectrum of hiphop/rap hits with other folks that enjoy the same thing (at least it seemed that way), then go here.  

It is cash only which is kind of a bother, but, surprisingly, the bar was never too packed to get a drink.  I was very satisfied with this aspect of the bar and towards the end of the night it was actually empty.  I site this in favor of Blondie's because it meant that everyone was dancing!  Again, I went with a group of friends so maybe I didn't notice if a "bunch of dudes" were standing around or not.  It is plausible that some folks might see this place as more or less a high school dance, but that's kind of what I like about it.  If you can just put your pride aside and fess up to loving a couple of the 'classic' Ying-Ying Twins songs, you'll have a blast.   The DJ is great; he played an array of hiphop/rap music.
author: Bill U.

description: Blondies is a great bar when you want to get away from the hipper bars, and when you want to get good cocktails. It's a bit of the bridge & tunnel bar of valencia, but that's not a bad thing in and of itself.
author: Shane P.

description: You can't go wrong with a place that serves you a martini with the shaker glass too! This place has a variety of great martinis from the sweet Blue Funk to the Polish that is a vodka martini with olives stuffed with a polish sausage. I'm not a fan of olives but my bf can not get enough of these polish olive delights. Definitely a good spot to start your night of gallivanting in the Mission.
author: Yvonne T.

description:
I hate that they have a cover charge but there are some sexxy mf up in there at times and they always make my martini large-- pricey but worth it.  The music is always good but the crowd doesn't really get good til later.  People really dance here but that's probably because they only have a few places to sit.  

I always grab my drinks in the back room.

TIP: ATM by the restrooms.
author: Rayna A.

description:
My friends and I went to Blondies to grab some drinks after a lukewarm experience at Luna Park (bad service but good food).

From the outside it looks like a crappy, white trash dive bar....but from the inside....it's still a crappy white trash dive bar.

Ok, maybe I'm being a bit harsh...but after my brief experience drinking there....I don't think I'd EVER go back.

I must have had the rudest beeytach bartender in history.

It was pretty loud and busy since everyone was trying to squeeze in there after dinner and I ordered some simple drinks (vodka tonic and a cosmo).

Given, it was loud, but I put my orders in and told the bartender that to use a specific brand vodka for the vodka tonic.  She (at least I THINK it was a she....or a pretty decent tranny, jury's out on this one) turned to me and complained pretty adamantly...."What am I supposed to do with this one (pointing at the vodka tonic) I already made it?!"

Having never heard this kind of question from any professional bartender I was at a loss as to what would be an appropriate response.  In my mind I thought, "I don't give a sh*t what you do with it since I'm not paying for it" but I just told her "I don't know...."  I saw her run to her manager to ask for instructions which was pretty confusing. 

In my experiences, although it sounds cliche, the customer is always right...and if there's some sort of slight correction to an order the drink should be remade with what the customer desires....or the customer can just walk the hell out of the bar.  If this were a respectable establishment....like any other bar....or even a Starbucks....there would be no confusion.  A new drink would be made without question and given to the customer (and if there was no buyer for the "incorrect" drink then that would just be dumped in the sink or given to the customer "on the house").  Not rocket science man!

Considering the 50 cents worth of plastic-bottle booze used on that drink....you'd think that genius would consider it a wise investment on a possible $1 tip / drink.  

Too bad the drinks were so terrible along with the service....and the $10/drink really didn't warrant any kind of tips whatsoever.

Just because it's SF drinks should not cost more than a good glass of scotch at any restaurant....

I said GOOD DAY SIR!



or .... PISS OFF WANKERS!    =)
author: Richard C.

description: Bondie's is definitely a fun spot in the Mission.  There is a $5 cover on Saturday night, but there drinks arent to expensive, if I remember correctly a bud was $4-5.  The ratio is 50:50.  Dance floor is kind of small, but the vibe is good, the crowd is easy going, and they play top 40 songs.
author: Mike M.

description:
Here you'll find a slightly more upscale crowd in the mission district. I thought the mission was only filled of starving artist, carpet munching, vegetarians. Nothing against carpet muching and vegetarianism... I can proudly say I've tried becoming a vegetarian and done some carpet munching myself =)

Blondies serves gigantic (but pricey) martinis. But the amount of alcohol served with justifies the price. The $3 cover is pretentious, and bouncer can be a dick. Blondies also is home to teh world's smallest dance floor, which sucks, but in contrast to the other options for hip hop on 16th/valencia (eg: skylark) it'll do... especially after a giant martini.
author: John M.

description:
Martinis= 2 oz.- swanky and  posh

Blondies' Martinis= 16 oz. - laidback, frumpy, dumbs you down to a dumb blonde 

Overall ounces of Incredible seat groovin, happy, funny, late-afternoon goodness
author: Daniella B.

description: Tuesday night bartender is a real D&ck Head.  After ordering one drink from him him my group and I were uncomfortable to go back and order another one.  Too bad because the place seems alright but the Tuesday bartender is SUCH A D-BAG
author: Captain J.

description:
We celebrated our friend's birthday here last night and we all really enjoyed ourselves. The music was great - a nice mix from Michael Jackson to Beyonce to Too Short. We made our place on the stage since we had 11 people with us. 

The crowd is interesting - a definite diverse crowd - and it made me glad I was with my friends. It's not my typical place to go to, but I had a blast dancing nonetheless. 

The drinks are pretty cheap - but then again they only accept cash and the bar menu overhead notes that there is a ATM $ Machine near the ladies' room. So, bring cash and your group of friends and that should equal a good time at Blondie's :)

Cheers!
author: Jackie D.

description:
When you're greeted with a cover charge at the door (even a $3 one) some expectations are raised.  After arriving my buddies and I promptly headed to "Blondies Wet Spot Bar" in the back room for shots and beers. 

The bartender looked skeptical as he poured our drinks and I have a suspicion the bill was fabricated.  

Life is too short to frequent Blondies. It was so . . Meh . .
author: Peter S.

description:
Place is nice and small.  Not too pricey, but not really cheap.  Hard to find parking on busy nights, but that's to be expected.  

If you go when bands are playing, the speakers are setup in a weird way so that the band is in front of you but it sounds like the singer's voice is behind you or to your left.

One plus is that there's a cool super-mini patio with seating for maybe 4 people max, but it still looks cool.
author: Sanjay P.

description:
Woof!  Good martini's and a lil sumthin sumthin' extra, basically an $11 martini worth two because you get the rest in a pint glass straight chillin' as you slurp down your drink. 

choice cawktails:  manhattan with jack, dirty martini  and the occasional "deep blue funk".   this place also makes a kick ass margarita.  my first visit was after being in traffic school all day and and I was LIT after one.  i am sure only having cigs, tic tacs and a pear all day didn't help much. CHICKABOOM!!!!  concrete is such an unforgiving surface.

there is a weekend night club scene where hip hop and funk are spun, but it's ridiculously crowded, can be very fun...if your into strange ass or crotch being rubbed up against you from all directions. DNA ALERT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: erica u.

description:
My straight girlfriend Mijiza just reviewed our experience at Blondies yesterday and I must confer.  I have a couple other things....

First, I totally googled "Bars to meet men in San Francisco" because my girlfriend Mijiza is available for a fabulous man.  By the way - if you are said fabulous man (and I mean FABULOUS!!!! And not in the gay way honey) - then you should contact her  :)

Unfortunately, there weren't many prizes there when we got there, but it was very early on a Thursday so we didn't expect much.  The drinks were fabulous.  I love how they give you extra - kinda like a milkshake - yummmmmeeeeeeee!

Blondies also holds a dear place in my heart as being the cause of the worst drunken fiasco of my life!  I won't get into all the selacious details, but just to warn you - the martini will sneak up on you later if you have too many - so be careful!

Also - the music!  OK - I can appreciate that I am maybe getting too old, but blaring house music is great at night, but during happy hour people are getting together to talk after work or whatever - not dance the night away.  Turn that shit down a little.
author: Daniel H.

description: Super crowded with the wrong crowd,  the music wasn't that great..I felt really dirty being in here.  I guess I should of tried a Martini =/
author: Helen C.

description:
Sunday night, went for a friend's birthday. 20 minutes later after everyone arrived, we all turned around and migrated to R Bar. 
Terrible service, inattentive SLOW bartender, and music that was making us sleep. 20 minute wait for a drink when there was only 20 people in the bar? ridiculous
author: Marina K.

description:
I love to dance.  For a six foot tall white girl, I'd like to think I have pretty good rythym.  Of course, I usually think this when I've had at least a drink or am dancing in the reflection of a window or mirror in my apartment.  But still, I can hang with most people on the dance floor.  I think it would be completely different if the average height weren't 5'5".  

Blondie's is a pretty good place to dance.  The DJ play's top 40 hits, great for any girls night out.  Just when your favorite song comes on, not only can you start grooving hard core, but you can also turn to your friend and say to her, a couple times, cause she doesn't hear you the first time, "I love this song!"  "...What?" "I LOVE this song!" "... oh yeah me too!"  So there, you've just A.) started dancing sexy so the guy you don't really want to talk to at all has just noticed you and B.) have just made yourself look like you've got lots of friends and lots to talk about with them.  That's what girls do here - that's actually what guys do here, too.  Even if you are the coolest person in the world and not like that at all, YOU might even get sucked in to doing that at Blondie's as well.

The martini's are good - you really do get two for the price of one ($11).  Personally I could only handle this place once a year, unless it's an early weekday night, before dinner. I give this place one star for no soap in the ladies bathroom (eew, very, very hot dance floor included) and the first time I walked in to this place, circa 2003 it smelled like sewage.  Great place to dance after five drinks and 1/2 a joint, though.
author: Kelly H.

description: Sooo laid-back! I really like this place, they play different types of music so you ll never get bored and their martinis are amazing! It is a dive bar (soooo Mission, San Francisco). you can sit by the window and people watch which just makes it that much better.
author: Kajal P.

description:
After a crazy and eventful week I, along w/ two of my bfs, had to get out and drink, dance and get stupid.  We did the perfunctory pre-party boozer shots at the apt.  Hopped into a cab and took off to the Mission to get some hipster partying under our belts. 

After a failed drink and dance attempt at Double Dutch and randomly running into Phil H., our drunken revelry took us to Blondie's.  

Now I've been here all of twice before...for happy hour drinks.  Pretty chill.  

When I went on Friday night though...it was fun.  I had a blast!!!!  The crowd was eclectic and true to my urban roots.  No shoving at the bar.  I even heard "excuse me" and "sorry" a few times.  We danced with barely any creepy leery factor.  The DJ was cool and played a lot of fun music.  Even the bartenders were smiling!!!  

I know this place isn't necessarily a destination spot for folks but if I happen to be in a dancing mood in the Mission I'll definitely consider going back.
author: Jay H.

description:
Last night one of our friends talked us into heading to Blondie's. After paying the $5 cover--I know--we fell into drinking and having a good time. Without resorting to neighborhood stereotypes, the crowd was very fashionable, young, and female, with all that entails. As noted in other reviews, the soundtrack was uninspired.

Overall, the service was pretty poor. Ordering a drink reminded me of ordering lunch from a really surly lunch truck. At one point, I tried to order a water for a girl that couldn't get the bartender's attention. When I tried to catch his eye, he shouted something at me not fit for print in a family newspaper.

About 45 minutes before closing time, someone broke a glass, and one of the staff came over to clean it up. He told me to move. I joked that I was very comfortable where I was and had closed-toe shoes. From there the conversation escalated in a really startling way. I never once raised my voice, but the guy seemed to think I was looking for trouble. He told me that if I didn't do what he said, then I would 'have to go'. I told him that I wasn't doing anything wrong, and that it suited me just fine to stay. At that point, he signaled for security. At one point, the angry staff member said he was going to get a cop. I told him to go for it, I hadn't done anything wrong.

It was at this point that all parties asked me to talk it over outside. Bar 101: move problems outside, shut the door. After about 10 minutes of this, security made a very compelling case for me to go out. The manager/owner/natural blonde, 'Blondie' then came out to talk to me. She seemed relieved that I was outside, but was good about talking to me and admitted that the situation could have been handled better. As a parting salvo, she told me that she hoped I would come back. I won't be back, sorry Blondie. Something tells me it doesn't break your heart.

In their defense, it was Saturday night, it was crowded, and it sounds like they get a fair amount of jerks through there. Still, an Anchor is an Anchor, and if I have a desire in the future to pay a cover, hang out with that kind of crowd,and be treated like a jerk I will go to the Marina.
author: Andrew W.
