description: I Had a really bad experience here during my birthday, the bartender was completely rude and I felt personally targeted and offended. Never coming back here again, the vibe was lame anyway.
author: Carmen J.

description:
The Good - the drinks and the music about 3/4 of the time.
The Bad - the coat check room is a bermuda triangle for expensive lipgloss...keep it in your pants pocket!
The Ugly - the bachleortte party bus stops here...obnoxious pre-brides shake and grind and make themselves look ridiculus. The bathroom...small, crowded, and a bad place to be during a girl-fight. 
Tip - if you go later, all of the Marina types have gotten "bored" (ie, there are not enough Sevens and Joe's Jeans in the room and they are feeling out of place) and have hopped in cabs (or limos) to return to more designer waters.
author: Jessa B.

description:
Okay, so points for the ha-ha clever 'Wet Bar' in the back that's really a wet bar -- the first couple of times a droplet hits your head or your shoulder you jump a little, then you get it.

I've been here three times - twice it was dominated by what I would describe as an off-work office support crowd. There was loud, sloppy drinking going on and a lot of stumbly, pushy dancing, to eighties tunes I've liked and gotten sick of twice in my life so far.

The other time was a birthday party and I allowed myself to be pulled into a dance circle. I really am not a snob -- really! -- but this made me feel like I was at some nightmare wedding.

I have to say something about drinking and dancing: they should arrest people for mixing the two. People think they can do a lot of things when they are drunk -- drive, fly, write, talk shit, philosophize, fight -- you get the picture. But dancing drunk people are the worst, because dancing is coordinated movement, and the whole wobbly thing of drunkenness undermines what little talent most of us bring to the table. So you're constantly getting an elbow or your toe flattened.

This is where the bruises you can't explain the next day come from. And Blondie's is the kind of place where you will generate them.
author: Karsten P.

description:
This is a great place to grab a beer while you're:
A) waiting for a table at Puerto Allegre
B) lucky enough to get a table in the super skinny area out front
C) people watching from said skinny area.

They have good beers, the drinks are pretty tasty too, the happy hour is pretty much priced as other happy hours around the area.

Its a fun place to watch people and drink. And if you're waiting for a table someplace else its good too.
author: Marz W.

description:
Okay... I have to say; I used to frequent this bar a lot. 

Picture this; early evening we were recently sent there (a small group of friends) by default, while waiting for our dinner table in the restaurant next door. 

There is a new bartender, I don't know his name but WHAT AN ASS. We waited literally 25mins for him to acknowledge us while he served other patrons while we stood quite literally in front of him. When we lodged our complaint he ignored us completely. We finally had to tell the second bartender, who was off duty of the problem, and when she asked if he served us... he still ignored us. 

I'm not trying to pull the gay card out here... but really if you don't like diversity, which is why San Francisco is amazing... then move to Utah you Jack Ass! 

An Addendum... when he heard us talking within our group to several members of the bar that we were going to yelp him, he finally apologized (begrudgingly). 

It was painful to watch!
author: patrick r.

description:
I normally stick to things with only one ingredient: beer, wine, shots, etc.  But because of their cocktail schtick with the big ass drinks, I went for a sweet girlie drink....a Deep Blue Funk.

Which was really good!

I'm only writing this review because the D.B.F. took me right back to when I was a little kid and my mom used to take me to KMart, and if I was a good boy while she was shopping, she'd get me a blue icee.  Always blue, I never wanted the red one.  This drink tasted just like tha blue icee, that unidentifiable fruit flavor of my childhood.

I probably won't schlep all the way back to the Mission just to go to Blondie's, but it was fun.
author: Kicker ..

description:
A friend and myself capped off a hell of a weekend last night by hitting up Blondie's. It was a great place to go after the following:

1) Flashdancing (http://www.yelp.com/topic/san-francisco-flashdance-tonight-woot) with 'deep on several street corners as cops continually kicked us out.

2) Wearing a glowing blue tron suit of my own design to YBCA and meeting a million interesting people in the process. 

3) Watching "Sex Galaxy" from the another hole in the head fest - a scifi B-movie about 100 years in the future when sex is made illegal :).

Having spent my adrenaline quota for the weekend, we were looking for a good spot to chill out and have some stiff drinks. Blondie's fit the bill perfectly. When you walk in, you think its going to be super trendy with the purple lights and all, but they actually are very focused on making some great cocktails. You can get some girly stuff, but there are plenty of traditional marvels here that they make well (*thank you guys for bringing back the sidecar!*)

At first, you think its super expensive at $11 a drink, but then you realize that you're actually paying for the equivalent of 2 drinks at a time...just like costco. Bartenders are cool to talk to - same goes with the other patrons. More punk-ish crowd, and *no* pink shirt popped collar types when I was there. A+. I'll be back! Doggies are welcome to get plastered with you here as well.
author: Sean C.

description: I went here for a girl friend's bday on Friday.  We came right after work.  We didn't get a booth at first, but some peeps ended up movin' and we jumped on it.  The place is really chill which I like, but if you don't get there early, you're probably not gonna get a place to sit.  People do tend to get there and camp in the seats.  I would have given this place 3 stars, but I had to add an extra one for the fact that I ordered a martini and they gave me a martini glass filled plus a water glass filled with ice and more martini!!!
author: Elena N.

description: This place is hella pretentious with no justification. The bartender put my gin martini onions in my wife's chocolate martini,and her chocolate kiss in mine. Eww.  And to think we paid $12.50 a drink for that privilege.
author: Kevin T.

description:
My friend and I are fun people. Not in a subjective my-mom-would-agree-before-licking-her-finger-and-wiping-dirt-on-my-cheek kinda way, but in that it's a fact. We're sexy, we're cute, we're popular to boot. 

We came to Blondie's on a Saturday afternoon around 4pm. We enjoy drinking in the afternoon and thought this place would be great after sitting in a toasty Dolores Park for a few hours. 

There were ten people in the place at most. We sat at the bar with everyone else and the bartender approached us. When it took a few minutes to order drinks (there are 30 martini choices), he seemed slightly annoyed. 

Okay, no problem, everyone has their bad days. We ordered our drinks and began a conversation about the differences between 18th and 19th century Romantic poetry. Kidding. We totally talked about split ends and our wide-set flows. 

We enjoyed our martini/3 martinis and watched the bartender interact with everyone else. A few of his friends were there and he was quite cordial with them. Naturally. Then strangers came up to the bar and he was friendly and helped them choose drinks. 

Was this a conspiracy? Did we finally meet our match? After our friendly spottings, we even tried chatting it up with him and he still seemed disinterested. 

Bartender: was it because we didn't have skinny jeans and v-neck striped shirts? Because if that's the case, we'll wear them next time. Promise.
author: Jared S.

description:
I came to this bar on an August afternoon with my two older brothers. One of the best and last memories I have of my brother. Place was pretty empty except for a few regulars with their dogs on the patio. I don't even remember what I ordered because my alcohol drinking brothers conned me into having a drink. I noticed everyone kept ordering bloody mary's from the cute bartender. I guess he noticed me checking him out and he gave me a sample. It was delicious! He used spicy string beans instead of celery which gave it a great kick. I know knew why his regulars came for just that.

I took a walk and got halfway lost getting there when I returned to San Francisco in November. I disappointed to see another bartender there in the middle of the afternoon and ended up leaving. I settled with a hot chocolate from a corner coffee joint off of South Van Ness and later learned it was a frequent bum hangout. I have yet to find somewhere in Miami with a bloody mary like that one!
author: Monica R.

description: I almost always have a good time at Blondie's, except when it's too packed to squeeze onto the dance floor. If there was more room for dancing, 4 stars fo sho.
author: jori m.

description:
Luckily for little ol' me, I can most DEFINITELY give stars based upon the time I choose to visit.  If you visit this joint after, say, 11:00, then yeah, you're going to be hearing some pretty dodgy music and pressing up against some kind of skanky woman who has a tool for a boyfriend and you can't get anywhere, and the tunes make you want to retch.  (My God, this is starting to sound like a seriously back-handed Yelp review, innit?)

HOWEVER, if you show up in the late afternoon, early evening, then you're in for a treat.  The drinks are a bargain, and they're well made.  I showed up with a buddy of mine early one night, and we had the pool table to ourselves for quite a while whilst Serge Gainsbourg (!) was playing full blast on the sound system.  (!!!)

My Black Velvet was expertly poured, and everything was happy.  Then, there's a nice little patio out front where you can smoke yer cigs and watch the craziness develop on Valencia as the minutes carry on and the sky gets darker and the nutjobs come out.  Oh, how I like this part of the evening!

So yeah, 3 stars from about 5-10:30.  When the shitty music starts and the place starts to reek of people with poor tastes, I leave.  If I was crazy enough to stay?  I'd give it 1 or 2 stars.

So check it out.  If you like that silly music then stay later!

OH, I almost forgot -- the 'silly tunes' I was referring to ... that phrase can mean almost anything to nearly anyone!  Think Fergie. Think Black Eyed Peas.  Think Vanilla Ice.  Think CRAP.

Thank you, that is all.
author: Thomas B.

description: I was really excited to go to Blondie's, as some friends of mine regularly go there and greatly enjoy it. I was there last Friday and was a touch surprised at how crap the music got. In the beginning it was alright, cheesy 90s remixes that were just what the dance floor needed. But then a new DJ came onboard and started playing, for lack of a better phrase, complete crap. The beat was too slow to dance to and the songs were unrecognizable, and once he started there was a noticeable mood change on the floor. The worst part was how into it the DJ was, like he was the greatest DJ around and was dropping some mad beats that everyone was loving. I might try it again but my expectations extremely low at this point.
author: Amy S.

description: Blondie's is nothing short of a San Francisco institution.  Think i first dropped in Blondie's circa 1998 and Blondie has done a fantastic job making sure the winning formula remains the same: great drinks, good crowd, cool vibe and plenty of entertainment.  One of my all-time favorite bars.  And thanks, Blondie, for years of great memories!
author: Kevin H.

description:
I've always been on the look out for a cool bar with a dancefloor and a good dj who knows how to spin the kind of beats that'll keep you on the dancefloor.  Yeah - this isn't that bar.  Not that it's Blondie's fault, exactly.  I used to come here as an alternative to all the super trendy, really expensive clubs in downtown (back in the days when it was a $2 cover).  And then a few months after I started coming, everyone else did, too.  And while I'm not the kind of person to really judge a crowd and use it against an establishment, I have to say that this is one of those times.  

First of all, the dancefloor is really small.  Secondly, Blondie's has an extensive martini menu and serves good portioned drinks.  Thirdly, when half the city seems to be coming into this little joint - well, do you see where this is going...?  It gets really crowded on the weekends and the bar patrons don't know how to share a dancefloor and before you know it, you are being attacked on all sides by elbows flying (in your face, on your side).

This place used to be fun and I agree with other Yelpers who say that on other nights this place gets better but for the most part when bar patrons kill my buzz it's time to move on and find a new spot to hang.
author: Lorraine D.

description:
Blondie and Bambi have a long long history... so here it goes

it's the 1st bar where Bambi learned how to play pool

it's the last bar where Bambi dumped the a@@S HO!!! BF...

it's the 1st bar where Bambi first  had an absolutely tasty Martini...

It's  the last bar where Bambi danced to west cost swing...

oh I can go on and on...

... that said Bambi and the Heffa  stopped by here last night before going to Maverick for dinner. It is pretty much the same. Usually a band on the weekend with Blondie (the owner's daughter) behind the bar pouring drinks. They still pack it on the weekend....I think happy hour at Blondie's on a hot evening is the best time.
author: Teddy d.

description: Lot of hate and nasty reviews. They make some awesome drinks in this place. Damn good sized drinks at that. If I was still single, I would say this is a good date spot...
author: Jim B.

description:
Blondie's is one of my favorite places in the city. The people who work there are great - everyone from the DJ, bouncers, coat check guy, bartenders. They are awesome, very friendly, and helpful. The drinks are very good too. The martini selection is fantastic and totally worth the price. They are so huge that I usually split one with a friend. If you don't want a very fancy drink, check out the bar in the back where the lines are shorter. 
If you go Friday or Saturday it's packed and gets very hot but the music is excellent. 
Only downside is the bathroom. There's only one stall for the girls so there is usually a wait. But it hasn't stopped me from going.
author: Franziska F.

description:
I will say one thing, I like this place a lot more than Skylark.

Sure, it's a different crowd, but I like it.

It feels more in tuned with the kind of surrounding I normally venture to.

The music is usally on par with what I like to hear at a bar or club.

One thing though, it's pretty small and too damn packed many of the times...
author: Mike V.

description:
HUGE martinies.... nuff said :)
....

ok fine, i'll say a lil more... i like it here, it's a good happy hour/pre-drinking place. love that the martinis come with a shaker for extra on the side! genius - all bars should do that. they have all kinds of martinis, but i'm a dirty vodka martini kinda girl so haven't really tried anything else. but my friends say the fruity ones are good too! cool music, but it has limited seating. i've only been here when it wasn't too packed so haven't had a prob finding a seat or getting a drink in a reasonable timeframe :) but be warned, you will walk out of there dzrunk
author: Lucy C.

description:
When we got there a strange woman immediately requested that we dance with her.  I didn't really trust her - I suspected that she had some sort of plot against us in motion.  

It was $3 to get in, and for that cover we got to listen to some music, stand awkwardly in the path of egress, and narrowly miss the ultimate fruition of a devious plot.
author: Sam M.

description:
I've been coming to Blondies for years now, and it is hands down my favorite bar in the Mission, if not all of San Francisco.  On weekdays, it's a great place to relax and have a stiff drink while listening to music. A drummer named Zack Hash frequently plays on Tuesdays and Thursdays with various other Jazz musicians from the Bay Area. He manages to bring together a very talented and underrated ensamble that has never managed to dissapoint. 

On weekends Blondies is as crazy as any Bar you've ever been to. As many people have mentioned, it can get a bit rowdy there, the $3 cover helps keep some of the ruckus outside, as well as make Blondies cater too a non-hipster crowd in a hipster infested neighborhood. On a typical night there is a very diverse blend of Black, White, Latino and Asians, ranging from about 21 - 35. This clientele makes for great bar conversation, interesting moments (I've never met so many crazy 30 year olds in one bar) and a very vibrant dancefloor. The staff is great. I've been going there for years, and its great to know the bouncers will say what's up and most of the bartender's recognize my face. Blondie is 1 in a million, really charismatic, makes stiff drinks, and occasionally if you catch her on the right night will do something border line crazy. 

Overall whether you're out to have a quick drink or trying to party hard all night this is the place to be.
author: Dave M.

description: Oh, the build-your-own martinis! Just a great place to watch the Mission walk by!
author: Robyn W.

description:
Growing up in a bar culture, I learned to appreciate a good martini when I see/drink one.  Don't expect not to have to pay for it though.  The average martinis are about $12 a pop but they are HUGE.  So if you want to get wasted, its well worth the money.  

I've been here on a weekday night when the bartender, Johnny, poured us top shelf liquor and knocked a few bucks off the price "because he liked us".  He also talked a little too much to my friend and myself about our relationship just because he was bored (yes, awkward!).  I've also been here on a Thursday night when the bartender couldn't give a shit who he was serving and refused to make any kind of conversation.  I feel like this place is hit or miss but the fact is, they mix a mean martini that is big enough to last you a while.  The crowd is pretty varied which can make for an interesting night or just a boring one.  Again, hit or miss kinda place but if you are really craving a dirty martini (which is too often for me) this is the only place I know in the neighborhood to really satisfy it.
author: Al D.

description:
I can't believe this place only has three stars.  Maybe because it doesn't neatly fit into any category that people are use to.  Definitely not a Mission hipster bar, and by no means trendy.  It's definitely not the place to go if you want to see and be seen, but not really a "dive bar" either.

It is a great place to go and meet friendly down to earth people.  Fantastic place if you want to shake your booty on the dance floor on a Friday night, or chill and have a drink with a live band on a Tuesday night.  They have a great selection of alcohol and the Martini's are only $11 (that might sound like a lot but it is actually like 2.5 drinks).  The bartenders and staff and generally nice, except Blondie who can be a bit of a ball buster until you put her in her place.

On the weekend there is a cover after like 10, so get there early.  It's also nice to get a table or seat at the bar before the place gets packed.
author: Lenza M.

description:
I'm actually a bit surprised about some of the reviews on here. Maybe they are actually taking criticisms on here and using them to improve the place, but I definitely had a different experience.

I came here with some friends to grab drinks and just have an all around good time. It came on the recommendation of my friend who was with us, and lives in the area. When we walked in we headed straight to the back because that was the only open seats available. When we headed toward the bar, I noticed this place has a lot of options for martinis. I personally went for a dirty vodka martini, which is easily my favorite to drink. I got to pick my Vodka (grey goose) and paid 12.50 for my Martini, as well as a pint class filled with the rest of my drink. To be honest, that is pretty cheap. When you think about it, you get say 2-2.5 martinis depending on your pour. After I was done with that, I proceeded to have 2 greyhounds (my favorite drink) which left me pretty drunk. I will say that I don't think I will ever order a greyhound from them again. It wasn't that it was bad, but after being spoiled with "fresh fruit drinks" at another bar, they just dont compare.

Ambience is interesting. When we first got there (around 8ish), it was more about sitting and interacting with your friends. By 10 or 11, there was a DJ playing music. I will say the music was pretty awesome; Prince, Michael Jackson, Tone Loc, and other awesome tunes from the 90s. Somebody has been listening my Pandora station.

I have to say this place is pretty awesome considering I am still feeling the consequences 24 hours later. Can't wait to head back and try more items on their massive martini menu.
author: Diana R.

description:
I don't understand all the low reviews... the Martinis alone bring this place up to 3 star status.

There is a wonderful variety of martinis to choose from, all are 11 bucks.. pricey you say.. not considering you get the martini glass full of wonderful booze, but also the mixer used.. basically you get a martini plus a pint glass full of refills (it equals out to 3 martinis... for 11 bucks.. SCORE)

As I joyfully sipped my Martini (realizing 11 dollars was going to get me tipsy.. I'm a cheap date) my ears were filled with the wonderful sounds of Led Zeppelin and the Rolling Stones among others.. Classic rock + triple martinis = Friday happy hour bliss

The bartender was nice enough to let us bring food in and that may have been my only mistake (enchiladas plus vodka not good) AND I have to give more shoutouts to the bartender, Sven. (no hes not from Sweden or Switzerland, hes from MN.. yay midwest). He manned this entire bar for most of the time I was there and made it look easy. Hes got great bartender skills... I think all the girls there were fixated on his skills and of course cute factor. Definitely worth another trip! 

My friends and I met here around 7pm on Friday so we arrived before the crowding and cover charge, which is my preferred method. If people are downgrading based on those things, they should come early.. I think its a great place to start the night.
author: Hailey P.

description:
The lame music forced us out halfway through the first drink. So, it was a Tuesday before a xmas, but really? 

This place was so disappointing that it kinda killed the buzz for our whole night and we all headed for bart or our cars after we left.
author: Char Z.

description:
I go to Blondie's for the hotties.

No, not the skinny denim green-haired bicycle messenger Mission-aries (not my type), but the hefty, spicy, pint-sized pepper-flavored Absolut hottie that has become my favorite Friday night cocktail.

Everyone looks hotter after a couple of these.
author: Alison C.

description:
Soooo the martinis are actually not pints.... 16 oz is a bit of an exaggeration.  They shake up your martini, and then hand you the remaining pint glass, with all the ice in it, and the strainer.  $11 for basically 1.5 5 oz martinis.  Liquor selection is pretty good.  I got the blondie martini--hendricks gin, a float of cointreau, and a slice of orange.  very tasty!  and enough cucumbery hendricks to satisfy a martini purist like myself.  The bartender in the Wet Spot in the back was very generous, since I asked whether it was actually a pint or liquor or not.
Later, I chatted with her, and she said she never had hendricks before, because she doesn't like gin.  And she mentioned Tangueray No. 10 as something I should try.  No one was around, so she just poured me a shot for free!  It pays to tip your bartender... ;)

crowd... was "interesting"... lots of unattractive people trying to hook up. The music was not for me either--very mainstream gangsta hiphop.  The few attractive girls there left pretty early on.
author: Fong L.

description:
what? Cover? for what? fuck this.

who's idea was this? I'm going to 500 club. seee u laater.

but Bartender in the there works out at my gym, mofo can lift some serious poundage. kinda demoralizing.

one star for having the balls to charge cover for a lame scene.
2nd star for neon lights and sketchy coat-check.
author: An u.

description:
I think the best night to go to Blondies must be Monday. My friend just played an open mic there (joey -. is an awesome singer songwriter btw).

I was the first there...arriving at 6:30. Admittedly, I'm a bit of a shut-in, so I was glad when the bar was mostly deserted. But after a while, I felt awkward sitting alone, so I asked the bartender where to get a taco...he recommended Mariachis a few doors down.

Good suggestion, really. On a side note: they have $2 tacos at Mariachis. But anyway, Blondies was a good venue, we could sit on bar stools and watch the show and I usually just drink beer, so no complaints on drink prices: $4 hefeweizen.
author: carrie c.

description:
Wow, not that I'm complaining, but I ordered a martini, not a 1/5 of vodka!  You definitly get your moneys worth on drinks at Blondies.

As expressed in other reviews, this place is awesome after work or for a predinner drink.  

However, unless you are wanting to groove to an odd mix of hip hop in a cramped space with a hit or miss crowd, you may want to pass on this place later in the evening.

Note to Blondies:  Thank you for the extra pint glass of vodka...but what should I do with it when there is nowhere to sit?   Walk around the bar double fisitng?

Not really my scene but it is an SF staple...it has been around for as long as I can remember.  Kind of dead on the weekdays, packed to the gills on the weekends.

And yeah, that coat check guy always dancing with the hanger - totally guys!!
author: mademoiselle m.

description: Came here last Friday for the first time with a group of friends. Since its not a club, just a bar, charging cover is just ridiculous (minus 1 star). But I paid it anyway. The reason this place gets 4 stars is their martinis. They are huge. You get a martini glass and a shaker full of drink all for $12.50. I think that's a fair price, seeing as the mission can be expensive if you frequent the "hip" places. The music wasn't to my liking, but it rarely is. We managed to get a table, so it was nice to be able to sit down. All in all, a good, drunk, Friday night.
author: Stephanie W.

description:
One star for a bloody mary that looked like a freakin' garden.

I tried to bring a friend here once and it was "hip hop night". The bouncer didn't let me in because I was wearing sneakers. Just as I turned away, some MC Serch wannabe with vintage shelltoes sauntered in totally unopposed. WTF? If I wear shoes from the set of Breakin II that cost $1000 at Harput's, that's ok, but my semi-smelly five year old Simples with ollie-holes don't cut it? I'm going to the Kilowatt to drink with the guy with the pierced face. Screw you.
author: Sam S.

description:
Haven't been here during the weekend yet, but some of the talent you can find on the Wednesday night jam sessions is amazing.  Jazz, funk, blues, and the like by some seriously talented musicians.  

Chill midweek atmosphere in a cozy venue.  

Oh yeah, the mini patio out front is also great for people watching.
author: randolph m.

description:
The owner commented on my review: 

"Clearly you have not (been to my establishment), b/c your accusations are SO off the mark -  my bouncers are some of the most even tempered, friendly, professional security in the city!"

Dear owner, I have been to your place several times.  Last time an even tempered, friendly, professional gentleman with a physique of a linebacker knocked down my 140-lb friend and started choking him for attempting to take out a water bottle which he brought in himself.  When I tried to release his chokehold, two more even tempered professional gentlemen grabbed me from behind and someone choked me until I blacked out.  They all work for you, I have no doubt.  

As for whether or not you switch drinks - that's between you and your maker - I think the physical assault is enough reason to never set foot there again.
author: Coala B.

description:
Probably the best martini's in San Francisco! I've worked in the liquor industry for years and never  tasted such a good Rob Roy in my life! Their "Irish" twist on that  dink is to die for. The drinks at Blondie's are good and strong you never need more than two martinis at her establishment. All the bartenders are good at making drinks, but Blondie herself makes them the BEST!

I tend to only go on the weeknights, because on the weekends they have a cover. I don't pay a cover to go into a BAR
author: Michael R.

description: First word comes to mind: LAME! lol. Ok so I go with my girls; on payday weekend of course. You have to pay $3 to get in (even when you are Blonde... shouldn't you get in for free??). You have to park on Mission and 16th because there is no such thing as parking near there, and 16th & Mission is the crappiest area (gang banger heaven). Got two drinks: Cran vodka & Malibu Pineapple; cost me $14. And they were watered down. The music? Pretty good arrangement. There is a random old dude just swinging his t-shirt trying to get everyone "hyphy" in the dance floor. lol. It's just not a good bar.
author: Melzie C.

description:
Before this weekend I'd been to Blondie's once on a Sunday.  On a weekend afternoon the bartender was chill and there was a giant but sweet dog taking up one of the booths.  I'd have given it three stars based on that experience.  

This weekend we wanted to go dancing and someone suggested Blondie's.  I had it in my head that the crowd was very Bridge & Tunnel (whatever that really means), but since I recently moved to Sacramento and technically B&T myself I agreed to go.  Again, I'm not really sure how you pick an out-of-towner by looks alone, but if all of us from across the bay make creepy eyes at women, are ghetto not-so-fab, or stupidly wasted and trying to climb on the bar to dance, I can see why people have a problem with us.  We are pain in the ass.  

We lasted twenty minutes and went over to Delirium.
author: Katie S.

description:
Easily the best martini I've had in SF.  Blondie's is a great place for drinks after work on weekdays.  Furthermore, not only to you get a healthy size martini glass, but you also get what's left over in the shaker (which is almost another drink).  After drinks, you can leave (or stumble) out of Blondie's and find many great restaurants nearby.

One quick note, you may want to avoid Blondie's on late evenings during the weekends if you don't like rowdy crowds.  The ambiance is definitely gone on the weekends.
author: Shawn S.

description:
Marina in the Mission.

Grinding drunk couples on the floor.
Collared shirts staring at girls dancing with no intention to dance themselves.
A DJ who literally clears out the floor because his music is crap and says "maybe later" to any requests.
Gross, gross and no.

Eek! Methinks not.
author: A W.

description:
I used to be a fan of Blondies. The martinis are spendy but you get a lot for your dollars. However, when I come in with two rugby teams worth of girls and we're treated as poorly as we were on Saturday night, you better believe that we won't make that mistake again. 

The bouncer at the door was a douche from the beginning, talking about how they had the Mayweather fight on so that meant we were required to drink...well, buddy, we didn't come for the fight, we came for drinks and dancing. While we were waiting for the fight to end so the music could start, the same bouncer came over and told us we needed to get more drinks or go. Seeing as half our group had just gotten there and were just starting their drinks, and the other half were still finishing, we weren't quite in the mood to buy another....yet. 

Cue thirty women who came to party walking out to other, better Mission bars where our money will be better appreciated. Like a previous poster mentioned...if you're looking for a martini with an attitude chaser, go here. Otherwise, save yourself some frustration and go to Double Dutch.
author: Ginna B.

description:
Man, people sure are hating on this joint.  But then again, they seem to be hitting Blondie's up when it's packed with the Mission yuppies and I'd be hating on that too.   

I've never been in Blondie's when there are more than 15 people there, so I'm just going to write about the quality of the drinks.  The quality is high.  Ultra high if you want a proper potato vodka martini made just the way you like it, especially if the way you like it is 4 martinis.  Because that's what you get.  16 ounces of liquor in a pint glass with a strainer on it.  For like 12 bucks.  Don't bring someone you want to impress, do bring your boys and a stretcher to carry your ass home.
author: matthew w.

description:
I had the same conversation like 9 times in a week after going to this place.

me: Have you ever been to Blondie's?
the other guy: Uhh, yeah....wait, the pizza?
me: Not the pizza, the bar.
the other guy: Oh.  No.  Where is it?
me: Like 16th and Valencia.
the other guy: OK.  Wait...16th and Valencia?
me: Yeah.  It's easy to miss.

So Blondie's not-the-pizza actually-on-16th'n'Val has a BAD RAP on Yelp.  I'm not going to argue, but Jesus.  You guys are not pleased.  Well, I've been there once, at 3 PM on a Saturday.  It was actually the day of that big parade that happened in the Mission a couple months ago.  Carnaval.  Maybe it was a Sunday.

My friend Josh told me they make really good martinis.  So I went up to the bar and said "I heard you guys make good martinis."  The dude shrugged.  So I ordered one and I found out why Josh likes them so much.  They're served in a cocktail glass with about 3/4 of a pint glass full of gin on the side and a strainer.  It's twelve bucks but it's about 3 1/2 martinis.  209, too.  Anyway, I drank it in about 45 minutes and spent the rest of the afternoon watching Opera and trying to sober up in Dolores Park.

Oh, and Josh is an alcoholic.  When he said they were really good martinis he meant they're enormous.  But they're still totally decent.

And I'll hang out any place with a couple of booths and a table or two outside with ashtrays that'll serve me a martini with 12oz of gin on the side.  I'll say it again, y'all yelpers gotta start drinking earlier in the day!
author: Nick P.

description:
A happy bar!  I always feel a fun, upbeat energy when I go here.  People are just having FUN.  So nice to see.  Anyhow, the bar is always packed.
The dance floor is usually very crowded (and therefore, hot).  I like this bar because there's an eclectic mix of people.
author: Sarah F.

description: I have found the Marinian embassy in the Mission, and its name is Blondie's. This is pretty much the only place to dance to horrible top 40 in the neighborhood, so it'll do.
author: Kevin L.

description: The service was horrible. The bar wasn't even busy, and it took 20 minutes to get service. The bartender would purposefully avoid eye contact as he passed by. When I ordered a second drink, the bartender charged me for the guy next to me who ordered a beer. How much more ridiculous can this place be? Then when I called the bartender out, he shot back at me. I asked to speak to the manager. Turns out the bartender is the manager. Next was the wrath of bartender-manager's retaliation. I will *never* go to this place, and make sure to let the Yelp world and my offline world know to never go here. Horrible experience.
author: Galen B.

description:
This place is a nice Mission bar. Good service and good drinks.  Music is good. On Friday and Saturday nights it can get pretty packed in here.  One of my favorite bars in the Mission.

The only beef I have with this bar is they don't accept credit cards.
author: Joe E.

description: Martinis by the pint, good f-ing martinis by the pint, need I say more?
author: Mateo E.

description: Haven't been here for a while. The alcohol is a bargain, go for the martinis and you'll get a pint of vodka. Cheesy scene with bad music, chances are lizadies will be dancing on the bar by midnight and that usually includes Blonde herself.
author: Jeremy S.

description:
It's really purple and dark here on a quiet Sunday night. And my Anchor set me back $5. FIVE DOLLARS.

At least the bartender was cool, brought his chill dog to work. Dog envy. Big time.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
After Double Dutch, we decided to end the night here...

HUGE STRONG DRINKS...should be the only reason you enter

$5 cover on a friday night to enter into this black light inspired bar...learn from my experience and start here, but end somewhere else

The space is a good size...just be sure to come with a fun crowd of your own, the regulars are well...just eh regular
author: Gladys D.

description:
Blondie's can be hit or miss.  But I will say that any place that gives you not only a martini glass full of martini, but also a shaker full, fulling admitting that "martini" is a euphemism for "large cup of vodka" is pretty awesome.  

I went here on Saturday and for once it wasn't packed door-to-door, probably due to the rain.  The interesting thing is, I thought that the condensation dripping from the ceiling was caused by too many people in too little space.  Turns out, it's just some gross thing that happens at Blondie's.  Unfortunately, it did not alleviate the problems caused by one women's bathroom stall.  Seriously club-owners, why would you ever think that you should combine women, booze and one toilet?

The only other issue was that someone spilled a drink on the ground and I fell in it.  Now, a bartender saw this, saw I had a drink in my hand, apologized profusely and made me a new drink.  This is despite the fact that I slipped because a) I was drunk and b) because I thought I was slick and ducked under the arm of someone who was trying to block the spill and c) my drink was already empty.  The bartender poured me a vodka soda, served in the large water-sized glass and the "soda" in the vodka soda was once again a euphemism for "vodka."  Suffice to say, that was game over for me.  

Minus one star for the bathroom issue because I have a bladder the size of a peanut, and seriously, minus one star for gross condensation dripping from the ceiling.  

Gas rating: 2
The minus stars in this case correlate directly to gas points.
author: Soo C.

description:
Upside - its close by restaurants where u don't have to drive.
Downside - It's Blondie's

What kind of music are they playing?  By the time I figured it out I was out the door!  My cousin took me here on Friday and I was asking her if the people here were just washed up or old?  I mean how would you feel if you saw women trying to hard to look or dress like a teenager when all the flabs - yes flabs were hanging!   And the MEN, wow is Miami Vice a fashion statement again?  What year are we in?

Ow wait, I wonder if I should give them another star for just reminding me why I don't like this kind of scene anymore!
author: May A.

description:
In my three times visiting Blondie's I've had three very different, but very memorable experiences.

The first was literally my first evening out in SF. I was sheparded here by my new co-workers with the girls from Beantown.  We were greeted by a colorful, somewhat ghetto-fabulous crowd swaying their groins to deliciously cheesy 90's mixes.  Highlights of the night included the more than 50 varieties of martinis to choose from, and the DJ's "wingman" clad in a Giants jersey and aviator glasses, who delightfully twirled a dirty white towel above his head for two hours (impressive stamina I must say).

The second visit was a bit more "eventful," in that during my friends trip to the women's bathroom she was subject to witness a girl getting beaten senselessly over the head with a pint glass.  Don't know if it was because of another man, trash talk, or just for the plain fun of it,  but regardless, in a matter of seconds the girl was on the floor surrounded in a pool of blood. When my ghost-faced friend relayed the action to us, we proceeded to barley make it out of the bar before the cops had cornered off the block.  A slight damper on the evening, but I'm confident that as long as you don't talk too much shit and your people 'got your back' you'll be more fortunate than that poor girl.

Third time: I promised myself I'd leave the bathroom if I saw any girls eyeing my head as if it were a punching bag and went back on a slow Tuesday night to take advantage martinis' ability to knock you (and your date) on your asses ASAP.  After a delicious chocolate mint martini (garnished with a bite-sized Milky Way on a toothpick), we left the bar unscathed, tipsy and happy.

All in all, Blondie's is a good time; a fun place to shake your bootie in the Mission if you don't feel like dealing with the hipsters, and most importantly, has all the martinis you could ever want.
author: Nicole C.

description: Nice dive bar in the mission.Didn't drink but  the drinks from what I hear are great especially the Martini's. Overall the staffwas very friendly and will be back sometime in the near future...
author: Richard G.

description:
All the guys here are probably named "Joey" or "Doug".  It's like when all 50 of them decided to come out here together, each of them looked at the guy to his right to see what was "cool" and decided to wear the same black button-up, use the same slick-back style to cover up the bald spot, and said, "Dude, can you be my wingman?"

UGH.

First thing that happened when my girlfriends and I walked through the door (besides being charged $3 a pop) was some guy grabbing my arm and saying, "I gotta introduce you to my friend!"  Yes, please, touch me like you own me and smile while doing it.  P.S. Your friend is ugly.

Two stars for the crowd/space-to-dance ratio and a genuinely danceable music mix.
author: Eartha K.

description:
Blondie's is like that obnoxious friend of a friend that you want to like, but every encounter with them proves just how much of an impossibility it is.  

It seems promising enough - a large, interesting drink menu looms overhead  in a seemingly cool, low-key environment.  Unfortunately, I have been disappointed with my "inventive" drink upon each visit to Blondie's.  The last drink I had there, a Zen Green Tea/sake martini, tasted less like green tea and sake and more like minty ass.  My friend had the martini with the sausage stuffed olive, and the grey lumpiness of the sausage was a stomach-turner.  We considered ordering one more round before heading off to greener pastures, but service was sloooooow, mainly due to one of the bartenders larger interest in complaining to her co-worker about her other co-worker.

There are certainly plenty of better options in this area of the Mission to get your drink on.
author: Tanya N.

description:
Does anyone remember when this place used to be THE lesbian club on Sunday nights?

What happened?
author: Leslie Ann R.

description:
Nice if you want sugary drinks that will give you a bitch of a hangover the next day. I am talking about the kind in which the base of your skull feels like it is melting in a searing hot pool of molten metal. Other than that its the usual drop in for one drink kind of stop before heading out to your real destination. 
The bartender and security guy were friendly enough, but not enough to redeem this place. Too bad. The drinks are big, but taste like jolly ranchers. Hey- if that's your bag I won't judge.
author: Stacy T.

description:
Live music. Trippy lights. Vast selection of martinis and cosmos. I went with the Pomegranate Cosmo, my friends went for the martinis. Naturally, theirs were better.

11 bucks for a cosmo seems pricey but they fill up your glass and then give you the shaker which is the equivalent of another martini. So when you think about it, they were really only $5.50 each! A bargain at any price really.
author: Erin F.

description:
Came here on a Monday night to see my friend play a gig (indie rock kind of guy and the place was practically empty) so when my girls and I were out last night looking for some fun dancing I didn't think of this place.  We happened to be wandering by, however, looking for a place to take some cheap-ish shots before heading to other dance clubs we had read about, and decided to go here.  

After talking Blondie down from a $5 cover for all to a 2 for one deal (we're not that cheap we just didn't want to pay cover to just take some quick shots and bounce!) we made our way to the back bar b/c she told us there was no line.

As I'm sure you realize where this little tale is going...we didn't just take shots here.  During our drinking sesh in "The Wet Spot Bar" we noticed that we had all started to head nod uncontrollably to the beats and were drawn to the dance party out on the floor.  We ended up staying all night and got down...it was exactly what we had been looking for!  

...One of us even ended up taking the cute bartender home...you can't really beat that.
author: Ariana K.

description: Everytime I go bar hopping around Valencia, I tend to always hit up Blondies! I really like this bar, the atmosphere is great, the music and the vibe is cool. The only thing that sucks is when there's a long line for the bathroom. Why, because they only have one stall!! BLAH!! Other than that, I always have a good time here! FYI..IT'S A CASH ONLY BAR!
author: Rosalyn T.

description:
This place is typically overcrowded on weekends and the bartenders are unattentive at best.  Drinks are overpriced and it draws a hostile thug crowd, I have seen multiple fights here and if you bring girls they will no doubt get accosted all night.  

It's not bad during the week but there are better places in the Mission.  The music is also sub-par.
author: Ryder M.

description:
the thing that was most memorable about this place was the coat check guy. He is the happiest guy ever, swinging his towel around his head and dancing with the patrons. It is worth it just to checkout this guy. 

Other than that the drinks are ok. I remember the toilet being clogged and it is the ONLY womens toilet so a big minus there seeing as there is an eternal line for the womens bathroom. One toilet is defnitely not enough. 

The DJ was ok but luckily I like early 90s hip hop and reggae and dancehall. If you're not into that then definitely not the place for you.

The music definitely called for some dancing. I just remember that there was a girl that over danced. You know.... they think they are so great and try to do elaborate moves but end up looking silly? I'm not saying that to hate... i actually do dance in a dance crew. I'm all for people being brave enough to get out there on the dance floor but c'mon... look in a mirror. Provided entertainment though.
author: kimy l.

description:
3 stars just for the pint glass used to hold my cocktail. Where can you get a cocktail pint for only  $7?
CHEERS!
author: Kelli H.

description:
I mean, where else are you ever going to meet a combination "hype-man/coat check guy"??????  Recently started going to Blondies when you hit that part of the night where you need to hear songs like California Love, and Nutin but a G Thang.  

On the real tip, I've only seen like 1 attractive guy here so don't go to pick up on men unless you like yours seedy and thuggish.  No hatin, I just like my men wearing a powersuit....or with Ginger hair and a hoodie.

My girlfriends always get the ginormo cocktails, which I'm cool off of...cause I don't like gettin sloppy.  I know enough about drinks though, to know that them buggers pack a ruthless punch.

Raw smoking area too.  If only I could blaze a bleezy, we would be set.
author: Kia S.

description: It's too bad that the guy couldn't handle his role as a good o'le fashioned bartender tonight. I went on a Thursday night cuz a friend of mind was playing sax with this delightful blues/ soul band called the Cosmic Soul Cats. The band kicks ass and are highly recommended. HOWEVER, it turns out that the bouncer was sweet as pie but the swiss or swedish bartender was a TOTAL DICK who apparently does NOT work well with the public!!!!! It's too bad he doesn't have the personality or demeanor to treat patrons as they deserve since he is unable to deal with the volume of people there. This is definitely not the job for him since he felt the need to bitch at us as much as he did. I will never ever again frequent that venue where bartenders think they can treat us patrons like doormats or pieces of shit when we are the ones paying their tips especially after waiting for our drinks for 15 minutes. This place is for the hipster, gringo, sell-outs!!! Not recommended for the educated, intelligent, cultured types. Don't bother. Go the Casanova across the street or the Sycamore around the corner on the Mission and Sycamore b/w 17th and 18th. (MUCH better experience guaranteed!!!!)
author: Christina N.

description:
I'm originally part of the B & T crowd so I love hip hop and I always have a good time at this place...when I'm drunk and when it's crowded.  Best bet is to send an early group (ro sham bo for the privilege) to secure a booth and then meet them there after 11 when you've already got a good buzz going.  If you are part of said early group, hit as many of the giant martinis as possible and you won't notice the empty dance floor.

I love the bartenders here and the crazy coat check guy is my hero.
author: Erin H.

description: oh so divey with a martini aficionado twist! relaxed atmosphere, attentive bartenders, and you have the option of people watching and smoking cigs on the patio with your drink(s)? -love it!
author: Ang H.

description:
Great place to get a martini done right with enough for a second martini left in the tumbler.  These martinis always do me in, especially when I order multiple ones.   These are well-crafted with subtle details such as coating the glass in vermouth before pouring.  I especially like a dirty gin martini or a Gibson.

The unfortunate part is the seating.  There are few tables, and the ones they have are a little bit awkward.  Space at the bar is limited and it isn't the type of places that yields slowful drinking.

I take advantage of Arinell right across the street for some post-martini carbo loading.
author: Jeff A.

description: Came here during peak weekend nights and also once during the day on a Saturday. The place can get extremely packed during peak hours. Great Martinis and friendly bartender.
author: Samantha C.

description: II went here last year and it was fun but this time it wasn't something to brag about, they Danny near kicked everyone out around 1:45am...helloooo clubs.and bars don't close till 2am..
author: Ingrid M.

description: been here once, prob wont be back bc it wasnt really my scene, but my experience was mediocre.  Although the bar was almost empty other than a few of the bartenders friends, it took more than 10 maybe 15 mins for her to pour one beer and make one drink.  The beer she gave me was a solid cup of foam, so it was completely flat by the time the foam was settled and it was drinkable. That being said, my girlfriends drink was very good (even though it was $12.50), if your into the sweet sugary drinks and dont mind paying $12.50, i would recommend the melon drop, the gf loved it.
author: daniel p.

description: Love this place! The friends and I love coming here! This is a safe neighborhood, full of young, sexy people. Did I mention there is a police station a block away with some of SFPD's sexiest cops around? Anyways, back to Blondies... They have the best drinks EVER! Their drinks are amazing. They make you martinis, lemon drops, etc. and give you the drink in a fancy cup plus the leftover drink in a separate glass. They have great music and a great atmosphere. People of all ages enjoy this place. Last week a group of older people were getting down on the dance floor. It was quite entertaining. One of the best bars in town for sure. Want entertainment, a good time, good drinks, and a friendly atmosphere... come on over to Blondie's!
author: Maggie G.

description:
Wow, this place is getting ripped apart in here.  Poor Blondie's.  I went there with friends and I didn't talk to anyone else so i can't vouch for the crowd, though they seemed to be enjoying themselves.  

I liked the big variety of big martinis.  Come here on the way to something else, have a couple of those, and then go have a good time.  That way everybody's happy.

80s music doesn't really work for bars anymore, it belongs in banks and department stores.  As a former 80s devotee I mourn its passing.
author: Cassio P.

description:
I've only been to Blondie's twice over the past 8 years, but they're still putting out consistantly good, strong drinks. Tonight's Junipero Gin Gimlet was well prepared, and getting a full 16 ounces of gimlet for under $10 was perfect.

The bar was a little crowded up front, but in the back by the pool tables there were lots of seats available.

It's no frills, and no grill... just good, strong cocktails and beer.
author: Avery G.

description:
Shitty Crowd - Check

Overcrowed Bar - Check

Rude Staff - Check

Maybe I'm getting too old but places like this just don't quite do it for me anymore. Maybe if I was 22 and looking to hook up with some wasted skanks I'd love it but I'm pushing 30 and married some I don't quite like it. I only went here because a friend that I work with is cool with the DJ there (who actually was pretty good).

I'll just leave it like this, If I want to go to a North Beach bar then I'll to North Beach not the Mission.
author: Kamau W.

description:
The huge martini's are a plus and the prices are good, but they have only one bartender.

A tad dive-y but I went there to see my friend play jazz and chilled with some other friends and all that's really all one needs right - good friends and good drinks.

Plus, Cable Car Pizza is right across the street for some late night drunken munchies.
author: Lauren G.

description:
Fun place but nothing stands out...........

There is a make your own martini option on the menu which intrigued me but at the same time there were too many options which then made me not want to create a drink for fear of f**king it up and wasting $12.  

Live music and big booths for friends to convene in.  

The chocolate mint martini tasted like mouthwash to me.  

Always packed though.
author: Denise B.

description:
cantelope martini.  WOW.  Yummers.  And yeah, at first it seems like $11 is a ripoff for a drink, but when you realize that you get a chocolate-shake-style leftover glass full of the liquid courage as well, it all becomes worth it.

And....these drinks are serious.  No messing around.  I got a good buzz going after about half of my drink.  

Will definitely go back :)
author: Jen M.

description:
I had a fun time here with my girls. Bigger dance floor then most bars in the Mission. Good music, nice bartenders, nice bouncers. Got a couple of free shots. They played songs we requested. No dress code, no club bullshit, just a good place to cut loose. 
Although one bathroom never good, but at least it was clean!
author: S. M.

description:
how cant you give this place a perfect score? heres two reasons regardless if certain nights have cover charge or the bartender was snobby to you. 

#1: 16oz top shelf martini for $12.50. (make sure to get a spicy green bean. trust me)

#2: macallan 18 $9/shot
author: Ricky Y.

description:
I am a fairly laid-back individual who can fit into Lower Haight dive bar just as easily as a swanky North Beach outfit.  Yet somehow I managed to feel wholly out-of-place in Blondie's.  I honestly felt like I, little unprentious me, outclassed everyone in the club with the exception of my other girlfriends.  And possibly these guys from the Marina who were going to be Stanford GSB students who performed what could quite easily be the funniest dance I've ever seen to "Billy Jean" - like I was actually almost falling onto the beer-splattered floor laughing so hard.  However, two stars for the following.

One for allowing me to shake it all out on the stage to an awesome DJ.  Clearly we were there too long because we reheard a couple of songs from the start of the night when we were leaving.  It's all stuff you'd hear on the radio, poorly mixed sometimes, but I didn't go for cutting edge hip hop.  It was guilty pleasure music that made me happy.  Also getting shoved aside by a very short and very wide couple freak dancing was pretty awesome and reminded me of when I lived in Hampton VA.

One star for the coat check guy, who every time a song he liked came on strutted onto the stage and swung a white towel over his head as though he were cheering for his football team.  Thanks for the night of endless laughter.

I might come back here if like all of my friends decided it was the place to be one night, but I definitely wouldn't go expecting to meet anyone interesting, have a place to sit and talk, or get amazing drinks.
author: Becky N.

description:
Here on a Sat. night, came with group of friends after hitting Casanova for a while. Music was Top 40 mostly, but we instantly liked Blondie's Wet Spot bar, which was a great place for all of us to sit, talk and have some drinks. After a half hour though, we were abruptly told to leave the Wet Spot as they were closing it - at 11pm?!  Have no idea why as we all bought drinks, weren't rowdy and were having a good time chatting. 

So, into the loud club we went where the DJ had schizophrenia with the tunes. Would get a good song on that everyone knew, the dance floor would fill up, then literally a minute later, switch to something completely different that no one knew and everyone would leave the floor. This happened several times, pretty weak. On closing time, there was no usual last call and the music was cut off abruptly and everyone herded out the door like cattle. Lame.

Only upside to the place were the cocktails - huge menu and strong. Would recommend coming here for pre-dinner drinks, but definitely not for dancing. Guess that's why it was pretty empty all night on a Saturday.
author: Habsfan B.

description: They have a load of drinks to choose from. Takes a while to get drinks and it's pretty pricey but the serving size is large so I guess it's fair.
author: Michelle P.

description:
I feel Blondie's needs a 3.75 star rating...but 4 will have to do. 

The back bar deal is hottt. I appreciate a bar that will play Madonna and then A Tribe Called Quest. The dj rocks every time I've been there...the old skool rap is another great touch. 

I think the $3 cover needs to be waved...the drinks are pricey enough, and you're going to charge me to come in? 

Oh, and one bathroom for the ladies? This is wrong on so many fronts. one?!? pretty much UNacceptable and a design flaw if you ask me. 

3.75 all the way.
author: Natalie C.

description:
Tired of getting a small cocktail?  How about a martini glass *plus* an extra 12 oz. glass?  Hooray alcohol!

The interiors are actually pretty small and narrow, but they've somehow managed to pack a bar, lounge chairs, a stage, and a pool table into it.  I was forewarned that they tend to give large quantities of drink and Blondie's lived up to that reputation.  I only had 1 "drink", a lemon drop, but it was about the size of 2 1/2 drinks.  Pretty smooth!

Times visited: 1
author: Amy L.

description:
I love the big martinis and all the different types to try.  The Mellon Martini is one of my favorites.  Let's just say when I get off the bar stool I stumble off...very strong drinks.  
The past few times I've been here I was not feeling the vibe like I use to.  I agree with Jessica L this bar is for white people who can't dance :)
author: Michelle M.

description:
What is Blondie's great for?  A drink after work with friends.

What is Blondie's terrible for?  A late night out with friends.  

After work, this place is still pretty mellow, hasn't filled up and there's still no cover.  There's an eclectic mix of people coming here and I've always found it to be a super friendly environment.

There are great martini's here that are super reasonably priced considering you get two (a full glass plus a full shaker) for $11.  The G-Spot and the Pink Martini are both winners.
author: Laura K.

description:
Since finding this spot on yelp I've been back three times. Great spot to hang out with a group of friends for a couple of hours before your night really begins! We normally order the G-spot, bohemian, and Jordania - sweet and delish! Not sure if the prices went up, thought the drinks were $9 each during happy hour but it may have gone up to $11. Still worth it - you'll definitely walk out of there with a buzz....

till next time...
author: izzie c.

description: Came into town last saturday and stopped at Blondie's for a cocktail or two before dinner. Fantastic bartender, who was personable with mad mixocolgist skills!! He also played some great music. We all had a great time and will be back!!
author: John C.

description:
generally a good cocktail venue but today sucked.
two patrons including me and and the service slow! Two people!
the owner was surly and was breaking in a bartender who was completely unskilled.
it is now off my list.
author: david p.

description: Excellent drinks.  They come big and strong.  I love a good vodka gimlet, keep up the good work!
author: Michelle D.

description: Nice venue, no cover, good drinks and good crowd. I'm a regular.
author: J R.

description:
Valentine's Day was supposed to be girls' night out (it was either that or stay in and watch "Transformers", but I was overruled), aiming for drinks and dancing in the Mission. We peeked in a couple places but were unimpressed with the music. Thanks for nothing, Yelp.

Just kidding; please don't take it personally. After all, you did lead us to Blondie's. I gasped at the $11.50 drink price, and then gasped again when I saw the 16 oz. martini. I should have brought a Nalgene to carry it around all night. So: thumbs up for the drinks. I've admitted elsewhere to a predilection for girly drinks, and I got value for my money at Blondie's.

The dance floor was pretty empty that Saturday night. I blame the DJ. There is cheesy music which you can't help but dance to, and there is corny music you hate yourself for listening to, and he was playing the latter. Every now and again he'd throw in a Top 40 dance hit, or a hiphop number, and get my hopes up. But the very next undanceable rap song would send me slinking off the floor again.

Well, at least I got some amusement from the crowd. There was the guy who approached my friend and said, "My friend thinks you're cute!" and then disappeared. Cowardly Guys: 1

Then there was the middle-aged lady wearing a fairly fancy evening dress (red lace), sports bra, and army boots. She was dancing up a storm, if you count aerobic exercise type moves a ... storm. Funny Dancers: 1

Lastly, there was Scarf, a youngish guy with tweed driving cap, tweed blazer, and a long scarf thrown jauntily over his shoulder. He watched us at the bar with our enormous martinis, and then followed us to the dance floor where he stood near us and watched us some more. My girlfriends thought he was creepy but I hoped he was harmless and want to give him some props for wistfully following us for so long. Potentially Creepy Stalkers: 1

I haven't really thought this scoring system through, but I don't think the drinks and fairly entertaining people will be enough to get me out to Blondie's again. I wanted to dance and this ain't the place for that.
author: S R.

description:
Note:  this review is based on my first (which was also my last) visit there about 3 years ago.

I went there with an male aquaintance and sat in the outdoor patio area.  When we were about to leave, the bar was incredibly crowded and we could not get back inside to leave through the doors.  So my companion decided to step over the  hip high little railing.  I followed.  And just as my one leg had gone over, one of the bouncers came over and SHOVED me and I fell backwards, with one leg still hooked over the railing.  Just by chance, I was able to stop my falling all the way, in time to prevent from smashing against the chairs or table and split my head open. 

I was shocked and pissed off.  Unfortunately my companion had been looking the other way and completely missed seeing the bouncer shove me over.  He thought I just lost my balance.  The bouncer had purposedly come over to push me over and slipped quickly back to his position at the door.  I yelled at him asking him why the hell he had done that.  (If it was illegal to step over the railings, he could have said so verbally WITHOUT laying a hand on me, much less pushing me over.)   He responded by sneering and insulting me for my behavior:  ie yelling at him.   Talk about a loser with a power trip.

Btw, I'm female and petite and the bouncer was about twice the size of me.  My companion, while not exactly the type that worked out, was 6'4" and the bouncer clearly ignored him and went after me.  

I called Blondie's the next day to leave a message of complaint.  A woman identifying herself as the owner called me back a week later, sounding very concerned.  I described the incident and she wasn't happy about it.  I was only able to generally describe the bouncer/doorguy who pushed me over, but unfortunately there were two black guys working at the door there around the same time, same build, but different color clothing and I told her that and gave the clothing description I had.  She also took my name down and said she'd comp me a few drinks at the bar the next time I chose to visit.

I'm not sure if she was able to do anything or if she even spoke to her bouncers, (hope the other guy didn't get in trouble), but not knowing that, I didn't feel comfortable going back.  What I should have done that night, however, was call the cops and charge that bouncer for assault.n  Hindsight may be 20/20, but it's always too late.
author: Animal K.

description:
disclaimer: saturday was my first visit, and it was EARLY, like 9 pm. so there only a couple people inside.
NONETHELESS....this is my new favorite bar.  
first of all, Blondie? she ROCKS.  sweet, charming, take no bullshit, lay down the law, dirt brushed off her shoulder, she is bringin sexy back.  
second, she made me an unbeliveable dirty martini.  oooooh yes. and they have stuffed olives...which i love, blue cheese is the best.  and? get this, in addition to your perfect fabulous amazing martini, you get the shaker and another pint glass full of martini to add to your drink at your leisure.  
faded. quickly. and happily.  i will be back as soon as possible.
author: rachel l.

description:
This is my first time in San Fran and the friend I was visiting decided to go to Blondie's.  We had to wait till midnight to get in because there was a fight or something.  

The bartender was horrible.  He did not know how to make a few drinks.  He made a martini and let it sit in ice.  I am a bartender and you cannot do that to a martini.  He was rude and he ignored my friend's order.  Since that bartender was rude, I decided to go the the girl bartender.  She did not have a good grasp of who was next.  I had to wait 20 minutes to get a drink when I was there before most of the people she took.  There were only 2 bartenders for a saturday night.  They needed at least one more bartender.  

The only thing I liked about the place was the music! The music was wonderful.  The crowd was probably around their late 20s to 30s.
author: Patricia T.

description:
Ugly crowd! Sorry. I'm superficial. But I was the pivot for my dear friend and we couldn't find one cute girl for him. I'm sure they were very nice people and intelligent as well, but those are qualities that can't be determined in a bump and grind contest.

There's a bar in the back that is less crowded than the main bar and the music was wonderful, so I can't hate too much!
author: Eli B.

description:
Good people watching here.... good place to sit out ffront if you wanna have a smoke and people watch .... 
When you order a martini here they give you the whole pint glass full ... so you really get like 2 1/2 martinis :) 
It's a little douchy here but if you BYOB (bring your own beeyoch) it's not a bad place to kick it.
author: Jeremy R.

description:
Points for good live music/bands. Yummy 16oz!! specialty drinks, nice sized full bar, and several round booths for you to crowd into and get sloppy. 

Dark interior, pink lights, open windows in the front where there's a tiny outside patio as well. 

Very chill atmosphere, it didn't get overly crowded, though i was there on a Monday evening. =) would definitely head back here for another Mission night out =)
author: Lulu C.

description:
Came here on a Saturday night just for drinks and a little dancing. A friend recommended this place to me so I decided to check it out. The bartenders were very friendly and very helpful in recommending drinks. The drinks are pretty good priced, with all kinds of selections. 

They do have a small dance floor, but not many people were dancing around. Overall, it's a cool place with cool music... nothing fancy, just come with the right crowd and it could be a cool kick-it spot.
author: Melissa Z.

description:
Eight dollars for a well drink.  EIGHT!!!  3 vodka crans turn out to be $24.  Served in itty-bitty glasses.  The decor is ok, the staff is ok, but the prices aren't.  Kinda atrocious, really.

$8 for cheap vodka crans~
author: Eddie J.

description: Blondie's is the "chill bar" you can enjoy some cool music, admission is pretty cheap, and it can be a fun & relaxing place depending on the crowd.......other times however, it gets a little too packed and this place is really small compared to some of the other clubs in San Francisco so if you're claustrophobic....maybe you should consider another place, other wise it's pretty cool. I'm taking a star away for the overpriced drinks, and the lack of parking
author: Irene N.

description:
Question: "What is the most effective way to get absolutely hammered for less than $20 in San Francisco?"

Answer: "Have 2 Wise Guy's and stumble home."
author: Mike P.

description:
What's that you say?  You are tired of the hipster scene?  You are over velvet paintings and old vinyl?  You don't want good beer selection?  You want to pay $10 for a drink and feel hip when you say 'Gray Goose, biatch'?  

Well kids if you want to mix it up with lost marina-ites in the same tired blue striped button down from the Gap and shake your booty to top 40 crap, run straight to Blondie's!  

Really, it's not THAT bad.  Some times you wanna mix things up from the usual mission haunts.  Just remember to bring condoms, Blondie's is dirty dirty.
author: Carmen R.

description:
If you like your bars like you like your martinis -- nice and dirty -- than this is the place for you.

The only reason I'd go back is for the fact that you get 16 oz. of a damn fine drink. But trust me. To make it through the night, you're gonna need every last drop!
author: Heather L.

description:
Went to Blondie's last night, so there was a big holiday crowd. weird layout with not many seats.

Major plus for the music. I'm not a big jazz guy, but the jazz band was playing "Everything in It's Right Place"  by Radiohead!!! There was room to dance, but you couldn't really dance to Radiohead.

The drinks were good, but seriously over-priced for the area/atmosphere. A Tokyo Tea/ Jordannia was $22. WTH??! I mean, some of the original cocktails include a tumbler and an extra glass of leftover drink, but still.

So yeah, come with money and a small party.
author: Alexander D.

description:
I don't know how we ended up here.  We were escaping Elbo Room in a state of embarassing drunkeness and walked to the nearest neon lights.

The clientele, as well as the bartender, was intimidating, making me grateful that I had two beefy guys with me to sort out any potential ugliness.

They carry high-end liquor!  Woohoo.  Which sorta makes up for the scariness factor.  Love my Hendricks.
author: Susan C.

description:
Very valuable lesson - read top to bottom, left to right. We came here because the place next door with margaritas was too crowded, and we really just wanted a quick drink and hop on Bart. And then I was shocked that three drinks came out to over 30 dollars, and the three drinks were really 10 or 11 drinks. Right 16 oz., probably should have read that the first time.

But very tasty!
author: Jenny M.

description: Rude D-bag bartenders with a $6 charge on tap. Crap I can buy a six pack for a price of one drink on tap.
author: Sonlay V.

description:
Here's a 4 letter word for you:  F.O.U.L

That's what Blondie's is.  An out of place relic of the city's mid-90s gentrification-boom, on any given night expect at least 2 SUVs double parked out front, quite possibly more.  Inside expect lots of silicone implants and bad attitudes all around.  

This dump is a taint on the neighborhood.
author: Matthew M.

description: I like going here on a weeknight, to hang out with dagwood (the german shepard) and sip on a deep blue funk.  it's like a melted popsicle with an alcoholic additive.  Weekends there are too annoying.  There should be a rule: if you own a BMW or live in the Marina, you're NOT allowed in.
author: Stitchy M.

description:
I'm not sure I qualify to review this place b/c I only came here 2x- the 2nd time was a Friday in late December last year.  The first time was probably a year ago; it wasn't memorable.

Since 18, I probably have a total of 3 drinks per year, so yeah, I'm a cheap date (if i wasn't taken by my boyfriend- sucker!). 
I liked the pink martini and was really afraid that drink was going to mess me up since the bartender (who looks like Ike Barinholtz from MadTV) promised me he'd make the drink really good and strong. For a lightweight, it surprisingly didn't mess me up at all. The bartender filled up 3/4 of the mixing glass with Grey Goose vodka (strong alcohol content to me) and I was still able to coherently string words together to form moderately correct English sentences, and people even understood me when I spoke....!

The atmosphere was.... ah... dark and there weren't that many people. That surprised me. No one crossed boundaries when I was there with 4 guys (don't ask), everyone seemed pretty chill and mellow.

I wouldn't mind going back, but I'm not a bar person and when I do go to a bar once in awhile, I don't tend to stay any longer than 1.5 painstaking hours (for some reason, alcohol freezes time for me and I feel the pains of living life whereas I rather breeze through)
author: K K.

description: Interesting spot,  The Martini's are over-hyped thimbles and they over charge for the well. Show up with a heat on and have fun mixing it up with the bridge & tunnel crowd.
author: Vince S.

description:
I agree Blondie's doesn't really belong on Valencia and would be better suited in the Marine, then i wouldn't even know it existed.

I'm normally partial to tequila and Jack Daniel's, but every once in a great while I have a hankering for some froo--froo, over-priced bastardization of a traditional cocktail, as are most of Blondie's martini permutations. Sorry, make that Froo-Froo with a cap F. Bruno from the Zam-Zam lounge on Haight street would spin in his grave.

Unfortunately their drinks taste kind of good or I would relish the act of ordering one only to spit it out on the floor like, a Frenchman drinking American wine, exclaiming loudly that it taste like piss.
author: Steve R.

description:
Since there are a number of detailed reviews I'll just leave you with a simple piece of advice.

If you are going to Blondies make sure you order the following:

Absolut Peppar Bloody Mary with spicy marinated string beans.

The spicy string beans are heavenly....so much so I keep a jar in my office...I think I'll munch a few right now...
author: Deep S.

description: Some friends and I went to Blondie's last Saturday and had an overall good time. The drinks were, as usual, very good. My big complaint was the music. We wanted to dance and the DJ was playing the same type of hip-hop throughout the night. Don't get me wrong, hip-hop is fine, but we asked him to change it up since nobody was dancing and even gave suggestions, but he didn't bother to listen. We made some friends at the bar who also complained about the music. Last year we also went on a Saturday and the dance floor was packed. Maybe next year will be better?
author: Suzy Q.

description: I've been walking by this place for years, but I hate crowded bars and this place always seems to be.  On a Tuesday night around 10:00 PM the place was pretty quiet so in I went for my first Blondie's  martini experience.  Stoli with bleu cheese olives please.  That was so good I'll have another.  All and all a good experience.  Not sure when I'll be back, but a good experience none the less.
author: Corey V.

description: The first time I came here, I wasn't a big fan...kinda lame, not a place I would particularly want to go back to, however, after we left the Pride party we were at...we decided to hit up the mission.  We just so happen to walk  into Blondies to grab a drink, to my surprise we ended up staying ALL NIGHT.  Had a totaly blast, met some really interesting people.  The crowd was chill I couldn't tell you how much the drinks were, all I know is I gave my BF $40.00 and we left drunk.  They had a good mix of top 40's with a little salsa thrown in...I'd officially go back
author: Ashley J.

description: DJ had the place jumping, I was moving, and the dance floor was flowing. Great martini's and a good section of beer. Terri  who works the door and the floor, a great guy that made me feel welcome. and that  whats I'm talking about!!!
author: Brandi R.

description: Not the best bar, although the cool purple neon suggests otherwise.  You should defs go around the corner to Double Dutch on 16th at Guerrero, WAY better.  I write this as I sit at the bar waiting for my friend so we can go somewhere else.  I won't sit here again.  The bartenders are way more interested in hanging out and chatting with each other or their friends than serving drinks.  So, basically this place is a must if you want to wait and beg for drinks.
author: Emily T.

description: A big group of us came on a Friday night around 10:30pm.  $3 cover & $15 martini's. Wow! and they don't take credit cards either.  I'm amazed that so many bars don't take credit cards...just bad business sense to me.  But we stayed and drank and danced all night.  It wasn't too crowded, so you actually had room to groove and plenty of table space, which you need because they serve each martini with shaker.  D.J. was just ok...he played the entire Black Eye Peas album, so he must have a thing for them. Not sure yet...but don't think I'd come back.
author: Autumn C.
