description: Yeah. . . I'm not going to lie. . . I love this place. . . I honestly don't even know why, it's just always a good time. . . and the bouncers are always hot AND flirty. . . nice! Sometimes they play good music. . . sometimes they don't. . . Sometimes the drinks are cheap. . . sometimes they aren't. . . either way, I always manage to have fun here. . . It's a pretty mixed crowd, the people are friendly and/or talkative, and it's in a cool location. . . It should be your last stop of the night as it is directly across the street from this bomb Mexican spot that stays open late. . . I think. . .
author: Francesca L.

description: This review is based solely on the amazing and well made Martini's.  I was hear on a Sunday afternoon and felt like rounding the afternoon off with a smooth cocktail.  The martinis are awesome, creative, and huge. 16 OUNCES... 'nough said.  Watch out for a surly bartender - kind of expected when I walked in, but obviously doesn't change my overall feeling about the place, again based solely on the drinks.
author: Julian A.

description: So my first night in the Mission going to bars, after Double Dutch, we came to Blondies and it was packed! We even turned around and wanted to go somewhere else but we ended up going to Blondies anyways... After a $3 cover charge, we slipped our way inside since my other co-worker and her gf was already in there and had a table saved for us. Music was good and I like how they have 2 separate bars, one in the outside and one near the bathroom in the back area, small but better then squeezing your way out to the bar. Lots of people dancing and just hanging out and enjoying their time with friends. Again, I'm not sure how much drinks were since my co-workers were buying me my drinks. There were some but rarely any good looking guys in here, more good looking girls then guys. Highlight of my night? getting hit on by a girl! All I know is that this won't be the last time I come here!
author: Juliane N.

description: Live bands on Thursday. I must have been feeling myself cause oh boy was i giggin all by myself to the music. It was fabulous. Drinks were great, vibe was great & the outdoor patio is AWESOME!
author: Lois R.

description:
i didn't think I could hate a bar.  but, alas, it is possible.
in trying to entertain a friend with whom I have completely opposite tastes, she insisted we would have a great time here, so we went inside.
but, before getting inside, the bouncer was a dick who actually called women "bitch" under his breath after they walked inside
the music hasn't moved from mid-90's, which typically is not so bad in my mind, but "Color me Bad" doesn't even count as music to me.
i had to resort to my bitchiness and insist we leave before i lost my mind and went on a rampage
author: Jessica L.

description: Conveniently located 10 blocks from the nearest hospital.
author: Tom L.

description: Decent local joint, good bartenders, comfortable seating, and lots of open space.  Appeared to be another bar in the back that wasn't open yet, didn't check that one out but was intrigued.  Crowd was kind of random but we were there at kind of an odd time of evening.
author: Jaimie M.

description:
so this was one of the stops during one of the crazy girls night out, wowee!  

since it was between beauty bar and the makeout room, i vaguely remember a chocolate martini - they give you the whole shaker, sitting in a comfy booth, and dancing it up on the small dance floor.  

since i am petite, ahem, ok short...the strategy here is using elbows.
a little nudge to get your way to the bar or getting the annoying chick with big hair that keeps flicking gelled locks into your face on the dance floor.
author: Anh V.

description: Now I haven't been here in a few years, but just about every time I went here in the past, I had a great time.  No, it doesn't have much in the way of ambiance, but they play good music to shake your bootie to, and they pour a hefty fruity martini for a pretty cheap price.  It's no wonder I've had so much luck meeting guys at this place.  I don't want to go back again, for fear that my glorified view of this place will be ruined.  I'm also scared that I've gotten too old for this place.  Hmmm. . .maybe I'll take my chances again some time soon.
author: Danielle B.

description:
ewwww.

sweaty sleazy dudes galore.
author: Sid D.

description:
This was my first time and I am definitely coming back. I met up with a friend whom I have not seen in ages. I assume we were early since hardly anybody was in. I can count how many people except for the ones doing game hunts in the city - pretty cool I might say! It's been a while since I encountered people this type of game. 

We've been to one bar already - you might say started early and went to this place for more drinks and decided to order G-Spot cosmo and my friend ordered the Jackie-O cosmo. I really really liked it and the fact that they give us the whole mixing glass and not just the martini glass. So per drink is about $25.00 per since it's a brand drink and I get 2 drinks for the price of ????? - well it's on the pricey side but worth the wait. The difference between the G-Spot and the Jackie-O cosmos are the G-Spot has raspberries and Jackie-O has orange. 

Yes, you heard it, we waited for a little over 5 minutes while the bartender are making drinks for people who were somewhat ahead of us. While waiting we were able to catch the Giants game in Arizona which by the way they won. Yeah for the Giants! Finally! The bartender is on the slow side but he did acknowledged us and before ordering the cosmos, I was contemplating on the Lemon Drop.

Well, after the cosmos, we had the lemon drop and yes, I like their Lemon Drop too!

Definitely will come back!
author: Lileth M.

description: The best way to spend a Sunday afternoon bender in the Mission, especially before or after lunch at Puerto Alegre. They've gotten a bit stingy with the booze the last few times I've been, so I no longer feel justified in paying 10 dollars for the drink. Still, it's a winner. At nights, it's hoochie central. Avoid, unless you like hoochies.
author: Maria D.

description:
Thursday night cruising the mission. No cover at Blondies. I'm in. Not many people. Music "okay." Drinks, fairly good and decently priced.

Saturday night cruising the mission. Decide to drop by this place for a drink. $3.00 dollar cover? Really? Geez. Pay the $3.00 and order a drink. Bartender was a bit snooty and looked like she hated her job. Music was better than Thursday night, but not as good as Double Dutch or Skylark, nearby. At least the bathroom didn't have a line.
author: Ro F.

description: Yeah it's a hella cheesy tiny place with early ninetines "hits" on constant rotation, but its like a slow motion soft-core porn and you just can't  change the channel if you have nothing else to do on a friday night, or are meeting a booty-call and don't want to stray to far from the house order a martini chill at the bar & let the madness unfold.
author: Kia B.

description: This has the kind of vibe I like for a bar.  Usually a punk rock waitress with attitude and great martinis where they give you the shaker to fill up your glass for round two.  With different kinds of stuffed olives to put a smile on anyone's face, Blondies is a fun cool bar which is a home run every time.
author: david c.

description: Nice dive bar in the Mission. Drinks are a little steep but hey it's the Mission. Has a nice little dance area! Can get a little crowded up on stage. The talent is pretty good as it attracts the young who probably just turn 21 (or maybe fake ID's). Good for hanging and getting a few beers.
author: Eric R.

description: And by "martini," we meant "pint glass of vodka."  Come to Blondie's, where it's ghetto night every night.
author: Geoff K.

description: I absolutely hate this bar.  People get really drunk and push.  They play bad music too.  It's like Marina invades Mission every night.  (wow i can't believe how much i hate this place. shocking)
author: Julia H.

description:
i'm sure i'm being way too harsh because the reasons why i do not like this bar is because i think everyone who goes here are complete douchebags - so i might be slightly biased in my opionions. 

came here for a drink while waiting for a table at puerto alegre. first, i'll get to the positives. it's right next door to puerto alegre - so we didn't have to walk very far away, which made it easy to go back and forth to check on the status of our table. also, the service was good, but i think that's because it was dead when we came here, which is surprising since this place is always packed with jacknuts. lastly, they were playing the giants game on the tv.

okay, now for the negatives. the decor and BAD country music that was playing while we were in here reminded me of the awful motel watering holes i'd go to while in alabama for work a few years back. i also thought they could ease off a little on all the black light. 

lastly, (and this is by means the fault of this establishment - but it did make our experience here a little less amusing) a huge beatle crawled up my gf's back while here. thanks friendly girl for pointing that out to her!

i won't be back.
author: James J.

description: This place is awful! The bouncers are manhandling people and crowded with gang members who want to start fights. Do not go here. There are so many cooler places to go in the mission such as Skylark, Double Dutch and Casanova.
author: jey o.

description: I was there on a thursday. They had a live band, reasonably priced drinks. Not the most complete bar, but certainly adequate. The cool thing about this place is the giant open windows. On a nice evening (such as Thursday), it's great to have a bit of a breeze. It makes you realize how stuffy most bars are. I'd definitely go back if I were in the area.
author: Derek S.

description: Best Place to have a Drink------ while you wait for a table at Puerto Alegre.  To be honest I really have no idea what goes on at this place during the weekend, but what I see from walking by and remembering the dot com bubble and coming to this bar back when the neighborhood was completely different.  It looks too packed after 10PM and too filled with a BT crowd.  Best to stop by during the evening to grab a drink and remember your twenties while you wait for your seat next door.
author: Aaron B.

description: Went there for a happy hour and though there were no specials, the $11 martinis were quite good.  Ask for an extra glass to split it with your friend and there's enough for 2 drinks in the shaker they give you.  The live music was way too loud and made it hard to talk to anyone further than 2 feet away from you.  Got crowded later in the evening which is tough as there's not much space between the bar and the booths against the wall.  Also, minus another star for the women's bathroom.  I can handle dirty but having just one stall for the entire bar just kills me.
author: Allison K.

description: I don't see why Blondie's has such terrible reviews.  Let me start by saying that the only reason we went here was b/c Casanova was too nosiy and crowded, as usual for a Friday at 9pm.  I've always heard they serve martini's in pint glasses and play 80's music, which seems to be my scene, so I said, Why not?  We get inside, SURPRISED to find 3 bar stools open right next to eachother.  It was great; low key, dark, and the music kicked ass.  I'll definitely be heading back for another 'before dinner drink.'  BEWARE:  THIS IS A CASH ONLY BAR!  There is an ATM right near the ladies room in the back that charges a $2 fee.
author: Jenny W.

description: I disagree that this place is a slice of the Marina; maybe on the weekdays, but on weekend nights, it is total THUGVILLE and is full of halter top east bay bizzels crammed in shoulder-to-shoulder after about 10pm.  The bouncers are certified a-holes and have major unnecessary attitude and mis-directed hostility.  This place is a travesty of unparalleled proportions unless you are working on a girl who wants to dance.  The only pluses here are that they have a little sidecar room tucked away in back which doesn't get as crowded and they have an enclosed front patio area.
author: Rick H.

description: My friend's band had a gig here, and played a damn good show.  I can't say much for the venue.  The martinis are good, but definitely too expensive.  I got excited because they wrote on the wall that they offer PBR by the bottle -- which, if you've ever tried it, makes PBR taste far better.  I ordered it...and was treated to a can popped open.  Great.  I could've bummed a can of PBR from a beer pong game if that's what I'd wanted to drink.  I don't think I'd go back independent of another gig.
author: Nick B.

description: There is nothing like a 16oz martini to end a rough "short" week.  I met my gay boyfriend here last night for an after-work cocktail, all I gotta say, is the moment I dived into my martini I was a very, very, happy, happy girl.  The blaring music made it hard for us to really dish, but we snuggled up in our little booth with our fabulous concoctions and got our dish on anyway!
author: Mijiza M. S.

description: Martini's with the shaker to re-fill it ?!? I'm sold. The crowed on a Friday night was good (from what I remember). The $3 cover charge is unnecessary.
author: Melinda Q.

description: Sat, I stuck my head in Skylark, which was not cracking.  On my way back to the car, I decide to check out Blondies.  The only thing good about this place was the bouncer.  He actually wanted to learn how to pronouce my name.  He let me in to take a look around (cuz I wasn't paying $3 from what I saw from outside).  Crowded and bright, with a bunch of (drunk?) folks dancing with their friends.  I spent 2 mins in there and bounced!
author: One Black Mans POV.. ..

description: Never again.  Smelled like puke in the main room (and there was actual puke next to the dance floor to back that up) and smelled like bathroom in the back bar area (which was still preferable to the front room b/c there was space to move). *shudder*  And to think I paid $5 cover for this?  Bleh.
author: Melinda C.

description: Even though I had a great time dancing and hanging out here, I feel I can only give it three stars because I was already drunk when I got here. As the night went on it got more and more packed and they started charging cover which I never agree with (especially in the Mission!)- The bar tenders seemed attentive to me, but I am female so I can't speak for the men in the crowd! I would definitely go back, maybe even just buzzed!
author: Jessica R.

description:
I have no real negative feelings towards this bar, but no overwhelmingly positive ones either.  Which kind of makes me think I shouldn't review it, but I haven't been going out much lately so I'm reaching here. 

The music is OK.  The drinks are OK.  The bartenders are slightly rude.  The crowd is low drama but also not very interesting or classy.  

I just took one more star off, I was originally going to give it 3.
author: Jessi C.

description: A great bar with great martinis.  The extra glass full of martini is the clincher.  The bar tenders are also really nice and care about providing great service.  I recently left a jacket here, told the bartender about it, and he looked for it at the end of the night and actually stopped someone else from taking.  Tom and Anna thank you so much for your help with the jacket, you guys rock.
author: Jake A.

description: Best Martinis in town... and they're HUGE! Sometimes there's a cover charge (max $5) but the drinks are great. Sometime there is Live music, I've caught a folk band, a jazz band, R&B soul... can't beat good local live music and huge yummy drinks. LOVIN IT
author: Kissandtel L.

description: Love the huge martini selection ,the random music acts that come through here, the big booths, outside smoking deck, and dark interior perfect for getting a little naughty. Fun place to come with friends, not so much to pick people up, but definitely a good time especially once you've had a gigantic martini!
author: Snora E.

description: You won't find me here on the weekend, but this place isn't bad for a mid-week cocktail.  Aside from the terrible music, this place scores points for giving you a full pint glass of vodka-delicious along with your drink, and who doesn't love that?
author: Kyla B.

description: Every memory of Blondie's is a little hazy, but what I do know is that they've got a great DJ on deck every weekend, and pour strong drinks, which everybody knows is the perfect recipe for a fun night out in the Mission!
author: Kelly C.

description: My place to go for a martini that kicks serious a$$. The Jackie O. martini is delish. And it's a good price for a large drink (16 oz). There's also a dance floor for you to go dumb on after downing a few. The only thing I'm against is their Mai Tai. It was crazy strong. Might as well have given me a shot of Captain Morgan instead (blech).
author: Rhia R.

description: They play Blondie, serve stiff, fat ass, get you wasted drinks, the bartender is sweet, and you can sit outside and smoke!  What is not to love?
author: Rikki D.

description: I've got to give Blondie's a shout for hosting Tuesday Crosswords and Jazz.  Live jazz, crossword puzzles, and a tall martini sure make Tuesday nights more interesting (and Wednesday morning a lot more difficult).
author: Rachel B.

description: I don't see a problem with Blondies, I actually like the place.  I like their martinis, blue cheese stuffed olives and when I come after work, I can sit outside and have one or two cancer sticks while slowly sipping.  Plus, when my cousin came here for a visit and we just wanted to hang out somewhere casual. relaxed and nearby, the owner was nice enough to reserve one of the booths for us.  So they are AOK with me.
author: Nanette D.

description: There is no booth where I would rather park my keister than one of the three at Blondies.  Great Mission crowd and an outstanding Cosmo.  You never know what you will get with the music or the service at the bar, but the breeze is great from the open front wall.  A great city experience.
author: Dayna V.

description:
get in, get drunk, get out.

great HUGE martini's, total frat party crowd.

start your tour of the mission here early, get yo' buzz on, and then go to a better bar...  like dalva or delirium or kilowatt or amnesia or skylark or makeout room...  you get the drift...
author: Tony A.

description: Girlz night out, big and moderately expensive drinks (cash only!), good DJ, if you like hip hop and some old 80s jams - like Michael Jackson.  We got the party started Friday night with some crazy coat check dude that works there swinging his towel and coat hanger with us in the middle of the dance floor.  Around 11:30, it got super crowded with some hoochies and hoodrats.  But, still fun.
author: Audra E.

description:
i'm a barbie girl, in the barbie world, life in plastic, it's fantastic! you can brush my hair, undress me everywhere, imagination, life is your creation, come on barbie, let's go party..."

so they go to blondie's. needless to say, this is another one of those "do not enter" bar in the mission. i'm not sure which place is worse in the mission. blondie's or beauty bar? anyway, if you're not into to the "barbie" song, avoid it like the avian flu.
author: frisco j.

description: The inside of Blondie's smells like a keg of Meister Brau spilled and a toilet overflowed ten years ago and no one cared to mop it up, they just let it seep into the floor and dry.  It is one of the smelliest bars in the city and the main reason why I hate this bar.  If you must go, get a seat by the window so you can breathe.
author: Jake A.

description: I like hip hop for shaking the booty and this place plays hip hop so plus one star but really it's way too crowded to do anything. Only go here if you enjoy getting elbowed in your back and face while dancing.
author: Cathy T.

description: Blondies was a great bar, although there were waaaay too many people there when I went. Their specialty drinks were amazing, not to mention, they give you the extra drinks (so it's like ordering one drink and getting two). There is a $3 cover charge, but for an SF bar, that's nothing. They play typical house music there, some rap, and hiphop included. The peope were fun-very friendly and everyone loves to dance. I'd go there again!
author: Krystinne M.

description: Gigantor drinks or not...ghhhhhet-me-outto!  Unless you enjoy narsties grinding on the 4 ft square platform with dirty man whipping a towel around his head and staring up their skirts...I would suggest you go elsewhere, or perhaps go for happy hours and get the heck out of dodge before the sketch-bus makes a stop here on it's way to Hi Fi...good gracious where's that fondue fork?!?
author: Sarah D.

description: well this place has a hold on the more pronounced part of me.. my alcoholic party side! I'm similar to a mullet- business in the front, party in the back!! every time you order a martini they make it in a pint glass, which is a huge plus! i really started getting loose and letting my pants down after a few of those pints of my famed 7and 7s! They put it up in a martini glass for me, noticing what kind of a classy gentleman I am( well when I walked through the door at least) I don't get my nickname for nothing, so this bar fed my needs and even put on a show for me. I was one of the only wasted patrons there at the time, but this creepy little band played for me none the less! The more I drank the better they sounded.
author: Kyle B.

description: Blondie knows how to make a mean martini!  Love that i can select the type of olives for my chopin martini!
author: Dilly M.

description:
I have had a love/hate relationship with Blondies. I am elated that the place is still here and has survived. Blondie herself is a very nice woman who sometimes makes an appearance. The martinis are the big draw, and for good reason.  They are big, delicious and come in a variety of flavors. 

I generally like the open atmosphere. The music is usually great and the place generally draws a good group. However, every now and then the crowd is too young and obnoxious. I don't believe it is the bars fault, however, they could d a better job of managing that. 

The staff is great and otherwise a worth while place to visit.
author: Joe R.

description: Im here alot on Fridays.  I love it!  Drinks are pretty cheap and strong!  How many times do I leave this place feelin very inebriated? Plenty! I love the dancefloor because it's bigger than the other ones around the area and i love the music they play.  Makes me feel like I'm in highschool all over again.  People here are pretty cool and laidback and everytime I'm here I always meet someone new.  This place is not for everyone tho.
author: ShayShay G.

description: Run. Far away. Even with one of their 12 oz martinis in me (which I admit, was tasty), the crowd was unbearable. Who were those people?
author: Michelle O.

description: ummmm...no...hell no. OK drinks, shitty crowd. please pour bleach on the sidewalk in front to remove the vomit aroma.
author: City G.

description:
Rented cable cars 
Bring screaming Marina types
To Mission's sore thumb
author: HaikuReview X.

description: This place is filled with people from every neighborhood, which makes it eclectic and fun.  Also, when they give you your $7 martini, they give you the "extra" in a pint to carry around and refill yourself.  Makes for a cheap night.  The only downside is that sometimes there is a cover ($3) and it gets too hot and crowded to deal.
author: Sarah C.

description:
I've been to Blondie's a couple of times, and while the guys can be a little skeezy and the girls a little sleazy, this bar is worth a visit or many for several reasons:  

The drinks are fantastic, the music is fun, the people watching is absolutely entertaining... and most important...  
no one takes better care of her customers than Blondie herself.  She's a true believer in whatever her clients need.  I think this speaks volumes for the type of place where I will always spend my money.
author: Nivita S.

description: We came here only for the martinis at happy hour.  They made us a dirty martini of the regular size for the happy hour price, which was a really nice gesture.  We like the early p.m. vibe.  The martinis were essentially perfect and the olives were large and some of the best we have ever had.
author: Thelma Lee G.

description: I love Blondie's... they have g reat live music and outside smoking area and always a cool crowd of people. It's a great place to hang out before hitting up other bars in the mission. Most of the time I find a booth to sit at or at the bar. I went here on Halloween and it was a lot of fun. Drinks are reasonable and on halloween the cover was only $5 bucks, which I think is a deal. Why go to a crowded club or even the elbow room across the street that place never even has ANY elbow room!
author: Danielle K.

description: When I moved to the Mission, I wanted to find a bar where I could meet chill people, listen to some funky music, and not worry about my ass getting grabbed if I felt like shaking it. With a great mix of old stuff from Tribe to the new stuff from Ludacris, the DJ find something everyone likes. What really did it for me was when the bartender gave me a free drink for taking a little too long to get to me. Now that's good customer service!
author: Susan L.

description: Feeling like a martini? Any kind of martini, one you never thought of, one you never thought youd find? Blondies is your place. Its a pretty chill atmosphere too....
author: Erin M.

description: Sometimes its just way too crowded in here and I usually hate cash only bars....but their martini's just make it all worth coming in here.  An absolute bang for the buck!
author: Medwin M.

description: Conozco el DJ.  OK lets be fair: it is what it is... a mindless place to have some mindless fun.  And admit it, we ALL want to have some mindless fun now and then.  If I wanted to use my brain or if were expecting a classy crowd, I wouldn't go anywhere near The Mission.  So don't blame it on Blondies.  Lighten up people.
author: abdullah s.

description: Do yourself a favor (if, of course, "favor" = "buying and consuming liquor") and go to Blondies some Friday after work, say 5:30ish. Order a 16 oz dirty Chopin martini, sit in the patio area, and watch the neighborhood pass by. It will relax you.
author: Josh E.

description: Blondies is a great place to hang out if you like a mixed crowd and like watching all the eye candy go by:-)!!!
author: Chantel S.

description: like all mission bars i have a very hard time at this place on thursday/friday/saturday nights. its just too many people in too small of a place. however during the week blondies is very nice. i especially like sitting in the semi-outdoor smoking area right on valencia. brings somewhat of a european cafe feel to it. very friendly staff and not too expensive... what else could you ask for?
author: Andrew D.

description:
I have NEVER EVER felt so RACIALLY DISCRIMINATED AGAINST in any establishment in SF.  

I was with about 12 Asian American friends (ALL SOBER) celebrating a friend's birthday in the Mission district after an amazing dinner and we were ALL DENIED SERVICE from the bar.  The bartender asked for ALL our IDs (which is completely understandable) and after waiting 10 minutes without service, we were told to leave for no GOOD reason!  I asked why we were denied service and his response was "can't you see that I'm busy!"  

Yes, I do understand that you are busy with about 10 people sitting at the bar (more than half already served), but I was in no hurry... I was with 12 friends and I know that can be a bit overwhelming, but there was no reason for us to be turned away!

I cannot grasp the idea of any business that would turn away paying customers because the bartender at a BAR cannot handle it!   I personally think the owner needs to reevaluate his/ her staff, if the bartender on a Sunday night (11/11/2007) at 8 pm cannot handle more than 10 customers, that is a business that will be short lived despite the great location.  

This has always been a place I wanted to go to because of the location and the ambiance, but after this experience, I would much rather walk down to the Elbow Room, the 500 Club, the Beauty Bar, and even Doc's Clock, than this degrading place.  And I COMPLETELY agree with some of the comments posted, this is a crappy place to spend your money. 

 If you want to feel like you're not worth a thing from the staff, Blondie's is a place to be!   To think... I thought this was behind us (especially in SF)... but I guess not..

PS: I'm ONLY giving Blondie's a 1 star because I can't post without marking something..  it deserves nothing for the service I did not get!
author: Allyson L.

description: I guess going to a bar is like anything else.  Personal.  We all look for something different when we go out but for me, Blondies is IT.  I like to start the evening here or end the evening here.  It is a chill place with cool people.  The martinis are 11 bucks but there is tons to choose from and u actually get almost 3 drinks out of them.  Its got a cool vibe, djs and sometimes live music in which I like how it's a place where people begin to move if they feel like movin and so organically dancin begins.  This is not only my favorite bar in the mission, but my favorite in all of SF.  I guess I'm glad not everyone shares my opinion or it would be slammed all the time!
author: Sherri T.

description: This place is great. The cocktails are amazing. Whenever I order a martini and get handed the shaker, I'm a happy girl. The one problem with this place, as with many others in the city, is that on the weekends and even some week nights, the place gets really crowded. And not the good kind of crowd... in my opinion anyway. I've found the best night for this place is Sunday. It's laid back, not crowded, and there's a great blues band that plays every week. Those guys are awesome, and really friendly!
author: Elise K.

description:
This place has my favorite drink.  Period.  It's not for everyone, as it's totally sweet & probably too girly for the tough guys.  It's called the Deep Blue Funk.  I was first introduced to the drink after a nasty break up... my friend Glen assured me that the DBF was the perfect ANTI-DBF.  We've figured it out... it tastes like Spree candy.  And it's actually blue.  It's around $10, but you get about two drinks out of the full shaker they give you with a martini glass.

It doesn't hurt that they've got outdoor tables next to the sidewalk (without being ON the sidewalk) where you can people watch and pretend that the little railing around you will keep you separate from the throng of people murking past you in various states of depravity (c'mon, this is the heart of the Mission we're talking about here). 

I went here to start out my birthday last year and had the original "Blondie" tell me to "man up" when I tried to refuse a complimentary shot.  Of COURSE I took the shot and I loved the ballsy attitude that exuded from her every pore.

Is this place an evening destination?  Probably not for me... I'm not into the late night crowd & the music can really be iffy.  Is this a great place to hit for happy hour or kick off your night with?  YES.  It's also the perfect sunny afternoon spot for a day off with a good friend while you're trying to mend a broken heart.
author: Kelly W.

description: I went on a week night. First time. Head about how great the drinks were... AND THEY WERE! Best drinks I have had in SF. $11 but you get to keep the left overs like an old fashion milk shake so it is like having 2 drinks. 2 drinks was good for me and then I was out on the dance floor dancing to the great DJ. Very friendly bartenders. Defiantly will be back.
author: Kris K.

description: I like Blondie's when monkeys fly. One star for the day the owner was bartending and bought rounds of drinks for me. Curiously, I was the only person at the bar.   This bar USED to be a place where I would enjoy a very big martini. Now, its more of a meat market and I stay away.
author: Jon F.

description: Can I please get a martini?  Yes, which one would you like on our massive wall of martinis.  How about the lemon drop.  Holy shit, this is a pint of martini.  Mmm, that was good.  What next?  How about a G-Spot?  Sounds good.  Mmmmm.  Ok, let's try that dirty martini, shaken not stired.  Eh, tastes like olives in vodka.  I'm not as hardcore as James Bond.  Ok, time to dance.
author: Vanessa Z.

description: I have to give this place 4 stars based on the talent that performs on open mic night. HOLY SHIT were the only words that could come to my mouth while watching a 250 pound Jamaican whistle La Bamba. The Jamaican's intro was "I just had a bloody mary and this is La Bamba". It was an awesome salute to the late Ritchie Valens. If you are ever stuck waiting for a table at Puerto Allegre on a Wednesday night. Go next door to Blondies to kill time. You won't regret it. I promise.
author: John S.

description: The second star is only because I have some funny memories of my moron friends smuggling some glasses and martini-making kits out of the bar one night.  Otherwise, this place is ghet-to.  If you're looking to bump and grind with some shitfaced Hayward-ites, look no further.
author: Eric L.

description: Great Place! Good drinks.  Friendly bartenders.  Its more relaxed during the weekdays but I have fun there whenever I go.
author: Rob P.

description: If I wanted to pretend like I was having a good time, I would come here.
author: Mike D.

description:
Uggh.  I agree with everything that's been said in the 1/2 star reviews.  I disagree with everything in the 3-5 star reviews.  

You couldn't design a joint with less character...and yet, it's always packed.  Go figure.
author: Chris A.

description: Without a doubt one of my favorite places in the City. Blondie's is THE place to go if you wanna have a laid back night with friends while in the Mish. Total dive atmosphere, stiff drinks served up in 16oz sizes along with your shaker, mellow crowd and various types of music make Blondie's the ultimate place to go get plastered w/friends. Its's definitely not the trendiest place to hit up, but whether you go in after work, on the way to a restaurant, after a movie, or even as your night's destination Blondie's will not disappoint. My ultimate favorite drink: Chocolate Mint Kiss. Spectacular!!!
author: Joey C.

description: I got here by mistake because my friends ran into some of their friends from LA. The bartender poured me a rum and coke that was all rum; after that about 3 more. Next thing you know I was trying to get up stairs to dance to "Thriller" with all the clubbers that were there.  I had a good time until the next morning...
author: Liz O.

description: The bartender was shitfaced, danced on the bar, broke a bunch of stuff, got broken glass into our drinks and then refused to make us new ones or give us our money back. It's like your worst nightmare of a marina bar on bad acid.
author: Matt L.

description: Randomly been going to Blondie's for about 7 years now.  I've always loved the different vibes going on.  From live funk bands to disco nights, to quiet Sunday afternoons.  Gotta love places that allow dogs in the bars.  My partner and I took Kenya out (our Dane) for a stroll and brought her in the bar.  She's big, and I love that she was allowed in.  Big doesn't mean aggressive, and they obviously know it.  Another benefit- huge!- is the fact that you get your money's worth in Martinis, and what a selection!
author: Andre S.

description: Ventured to Blondies on a Saturday night, we arrived around 10 and scored a booth.  Fills up quickly, if you get there 11pm dont plan on sitting. the blue funk martini tasted like a blue sweet tart and it was INCREDIBLE.  the bohemian martini was a miss. 12/drink.  you get the strainer with your martini glass  the out of town crowd my significant girlfriend had to mingle with to get our drinks were rude and the music wasn't great for dancing or lounging.   the blue haze gives this place a few stars, but the atmosphere and the music doesn't put it at the top of our list for favorite sf bars
author: Ariana P.

description:
Blondie's makes me laugh.  It's a fish out of water, but happily so. 

Their Web site says they serve "pint-size" martinis.  I used to think that pint-size meant small.  Not so here--Blondie's, she's more literal than that.

And in addition to learning a new (and more accurate) definition of "pint-size," I also learned that ordering a DIY martini at Blondie's and asking for grapefruit flavored vodka nets you, well, a pint of grapefruit flavored vodka.  Case closed.  Next time around, I plan on being a little more explicit when placing my order, so that I can make it to at least Round 2.
author: Hannah J.

description: I was invited to Blondie's to hear a friend's band perform.  I left immediately after they played.  There was nothing compelling me to stay and nothing compelling me to go back.
author: Megan M.

description: This was the first stop after dinner for my friend's birthday party.  I really liked this spot although the music selection of the DJ made me feel like I was at a high school dance where they only played the songs that were familiar, but not huge hits.  I was okay with this, but kind of wish he had played more current hits.  The crowd was interesting and I actually really liked the short time we spent here.  The drinks were decent and the bartenders were cool enough.  I would definitely make this a stop next time I'm out in the Mission.
author: Ruben P.

description: Too bad you can't give stars based on the time of night you go here. Great for a happy hour quality Grey Goose martini (although the amount of alcohol they give you has decreased lately), but as the night wears on be aware of your surroundings. The dance floor can range from a lot of fun with cute girls to downright scary. Floating between 2 to 4 stars.
author: Michael E.

description: We come for the fun martinis - *i* don't need the extra martini to come in the shaker, but somehow both the martini glass and the martini in the shaker always get drunk by *someone*.  I blame my guy friends who secretly like the fancy drinks but won't order one themselves.
author: kiki d.

description: Martinis and other drinks are HUGE. Dance music is bumpin' late 80s/early 90s. Watch out though, some of the dancers who frequent this place are pushy and like to dominate the stage...
author: Flora B.

description: If you're in the mood for some MC Hammer and V Ice mixed in with the latest from KMEL this is your place
author: Philip M.

description: Great place after work.  Tons of martini concoctions gauranteed to meet the needs of even the pickiest drinkers.  They are pricey, but are really large.  There is a very small outside section for smokers and their friends.  Very fun place on a warm day to people-watch the valencia corridor pre-night scene.  After 9-ish it turns into a dance club and the atmoshpere gradually changes into a scene I would not do.  If you are looking for a great martini and a place to chill with friends after work, blondies serves it up.
author: Adrian N.

description:
this establishment seems a little out of place by the people you see hanging out here...
i came here for an open mic one time when a friend of a friend was performing...
so in that sense it was pretty cool, but other than that, i didn't care for their martinis which are a big gulp a size of a martini...
author: charlotte s.

description: Best Martini's in SF and strong ones too!! Get there early if you want a seat at the bar or one of the few booths they have. Really small bar that turns into a mini club after 9pm. They play music from hip hop, house, freestyle. Its always super crowded. Cover after 9pm I believe is $5. Door man at the door be prepared to have your hand stamped and ID checked.
author: Dezo P.

description: Crowd and nights are pretty hit and miss, but I think there are much better alternatives around the mission.
author: Ossama A.

description: Strong drinks and the cheesy guilty pleasure songs you love to sing at the top of your lungs!
author: Erika L.

description: Well, i kinda disagree with the whole comparisson to the marina, maybe it was just the night i went, but it was a saturday and the crowd seemed to be super diverse.  The coat check man was hilarious, and it almost felt a lil ghetto fabulous there...i had a great time.  I was browning out after two martinis and the music brought me back to spring break '03.  The whole time i was there i had two drinks, my friends and I went to get mexican food accross the street after we were through witht the place....the boys were disapoint and want to head to lavende lounge just to get the bacon wrapped hot dogs from the vendor outside, but we didn't make it, so they settled for the mexican food accross the street which turned out to be not so great, i just ate the gumballs from the gumball machine!
author: Lyndsey H.

description: I actually haven't been to Blondie's since 2000, when it was jam-packed with dot-com carpetbaggers and phonies-galore.  I hear that the crowd is somewhat different now, but I can't imagine that it's much of an improvement.  There's no way a place can go from being as unbelievably lame as it was then to reasonably cool now.  There are many, many better options in the Mission (i.e., any other establishment that has a liquor license and at least one bar stool), so don't waste your time here.
author: Andrew E.

description: Pretty good music, not too inviting ambiance... Their lemondrop martini was good but I'm still debating whether it was worth the $15? Anyways I'm not going to return here in the near future.
author: Maria H.

description: Fun little bar when I lived in the Mission 4 years ago.  It reminded me of a college bar.
author: Diane R.

description: I hate this place, and I don't feel a need to add any comment regarding that statement. Had to put star, would rather give none.
author: Shad M.

description: Try to grab one of the tables on the little patio on Valencia St.  It makes people watching fun.  they have an extensive and impressive drink menu, but lately the crowd had been a bit 'bridge and tunnel' for my taste.
author: Marina F.

description: This is a huge stop for party buses and it becomes so unbearably crowded by 11 pm. Docking stars because it always smells like "something", because people get way too wasted here, and because the security & the coat check are kinda creepy at times.  Two stars because the martinis are tasty and one of the bartenders are really cute (*wink*).
author: Kat F.

description: I am a little torn about Blondie's.  I had a good time, but I do't thing that it  was great.  The music they played made me want to dance, but the problem was that no one there knew how to dance.  The back bar is the best.  The bartender was awesome and she was really talkative when the crowd died down.  She supported our DD by giving her lots of refills.  The drinks are fairly expensive, but strong so it makes it worth it.  Overall, if you're looking for a fun place on a Saturday night, Blondie's is a good choice.
author: Kimmi S.

description:
one of those places that depends heavily on the crowd your with if you want a good time; so i wouldn't go out of my way for it.

 three dollars at the door seems fair, music was alright, except for the man on the stage bustin a move while he's shouting "$2 COAT CHECK YO! $2 COAT CHECK!" lol.

i ordered the SIDECAR, and $11 dollars later found that it tasted like lemonade with a little zip to it. whatev. at least the bar tender was sweet; i haven't seem that in a while.

oh for you not in the know: yes you can park in the middle of the street!
author: Ray R.

description: The drinks are great.  You're paying the price of one drink, but you get the whole shaker which is Pure Gold.  A great place to bring friends and wander around Mission.
author: evan t.

description: This used to be my favorite city hangout...It's changed so much, drinks are overpriced and the panhandlers in front are really annoying.
author: Adelina R.

description: Blondie's is really fun to go to on a Thursday night.  $2 cover and they play really great music.  It's just a fun atmosphere.  Beware though, it tends to get pretty hot in there, so leave your jacket in the car.
author: Julia E.

description: Lay low kinda bar with a martini menu full of fun surprises.
author: Mel H.

description:
i sweat more here than at the gym!  it was so crowded, i thought there was some kind of cash give-away or something in the aisle...the place is ok. music is sometimes really good...

---so it's really a toss up.  i usually consider this place if im already in the mission district.
author: Roy N.

description: a place for everyone who dont fit in any whr!! also i love it when they have 90's music night.. a definite visit when in SF
author: Anita B.

description: Despite getting rediculously inebriated everytime I step in the place, I always seem to be conscious of how I'd be having a better time talking with the homeless guy outside trying to sell me his bic-pen artwork.  Predictable top-40 dance tracks (was that 50 cent, AGAIN?), wasted girls on the worlds smallest dance floor, and staff that are more willing to drag you out and administer a swift beating then serve you a drink.
author: Anony M.

description: Crowd is BAD. As in last time i was there someone threw up on my shoe. SOMEONE THREW UP ON MY SHOE!!! Super cheesy scene, think Marinas take a field trip to the mission meets san jo crowd meets 30s singles...not a good combo.
author: Nicole S.

description: If i could give it a negative rating, I would. I will never NEVER come back here again. I can't believe I willingly paid $3 to enter the crap hole that it is. The people there were not pleasant - many drunk off their asses and disgusting. Its a tiny place, so when someone vomits, everyone can smell it. And damn sure someone threw up, cuz the place reeked of vomit. I stayed no more than 10 minutes. Why didn't I leave sooner? cuz I'm a cheapo and I paid $3. I must stay $3 worth.
author: Carol L.

description: This is my spot to go when I want a $10 chocolate martini and a $10 chula from San Jose.  Get your bump and grind on to a little, yep Bump and Grind.  I think I heard "I wish I was a little bit taller, I wish I was a baller..." the last time I had the misfortune to find myself here.  Don't know about mid-week, but don't go on a weekend.
author: matt c.

description:
as with many places in SF [and particularly in the mission] this place is great during the week and a terrible place of torture on weekend nights.

i guess they gotta pay the billz...
author: Clover Dan ..

description: The drinks are well made here.  If you run out of ideas on what to drink, there's a chalkboard filled with their specials to choose from.  Their specialty drinks are large and they'll give you the shaker with the leftover.  Read the other reviews for info on the decor or people.  I went to drink!
author: Naomi N.

description:
Dig the martinskies....  Good place to start a night of drinking with a solid martini and a smoky.

Some things are so wrong but feel so right!
author: Richard C.

description: Head straight to the back room (affectionately known as the "Wet Spot") and get a giant martini that will last you all night... finally a place that gives you the whole drink, so you can keep topping your glass off.  Definitely a dive bar atmosphere, very fun, with lots of (pretty skanky) dancing!
author: Stephanie P.

description: I really dislike Saturday night at Blondies; it reminds me of hip-hoppy guido Jersey shore bars where unattractive, overly coiffed guys have an excuse to rub up against you. I really like it on sunny Sundays, though, when you can be alone with the friendly bartender, drinking by the big open window.
author: Shannon R.

description: Great Bar.  Best Martini's in the city, friendly staff, nice stage and low lighting, jazz on tuesdays and thursdays.  Sit in a comfy booth or pull up a chair to the patio for a smoke.
author: Zach H.

description:
it's a weird vibe inside, a funny mix of hip hop heads and hipsters. with a dance floor, dj, and sports showing on all the tvs.  it's very dark inside.

but i DO know that their martini selection is amazing!!  i got a whole meal served in my martini- there were olives stuffed with feta, olives with sausage, olives with garlic, olives with smoke salmon...i can't even remember. all i know is it satisfied my raging appetite as i waited for over an hour to get seated at Puerto Alegre.
author: Hella M.

description: I should hate this place but their martinis (and options on how they are prepared) make this a necessary stop on one's Mission swirl.
author: John B.

description: Pour me a drink and pour me another.  Street "patio" offers unique Mission interactive theatre.  Now if they could just do something about the music and lighting.
author: Nate B.

description: The martinis are the stiffest drinks in the city.  They're $11 a piece, but most people can only handle one or two, making it a great value.  The bouncers and bartenders are always great.
author: Jeremiah J.

description:
Fun place and drinks stand out.
Love their martinis.  Jacquie O is my favorite - they use fresh oranges to make it.  They also make a killer sidecar. The bartenders are very friendly so is the doorman working on weekends.  Just watch for the moody daugther of the owner.  You never know where you stand with her.  She usually works the weekend shifts.  I recommend the Sunday afternoon small tables by the window for people watching while sipping on you favorite drink.
author: Monica R.

description: You might have to weave through a bunch a skeevy people to get to the bar but the delicious Lemondrop martini waiting for you is more than worth it!
author: Noelle P.

description: Okay, so I didn't even like Blondie's in the 90's when Swingers and beautiful babies were the vibe in the city...And recently, I've stayed away thinking that it was teeming with Marina chicks gone wild and fratty fratty frat boys. But that was not the case on any of the enjoyable (week)nights I have gone this summer. The bar was nice and dark inside, with sweet bartenders, booths, and good tunes--Ipod or mellow band. To sum up, go on a week night, and as you sit at one of the outdoor tables savoring your smoke and pint of martini, you can smile at all the hipsters fighting for a spot at the bar in 'Nova's across the street.
author: allie h.

description: I will NEVER go here again. I wanted to punch the bar tender in the face after he humiliated me. First of all, this place is $7.00 for a very small, weak, bottom shelf cocktail, and in the Mission, thats a little steep considering every bar around it is $4.00. My friends band was playing and I was waiting on that, but I told the bartender i couldnt afford another one. He started hitting on me in a very subtle way and told me not to worry about it, just order what I want and smiles and doesnt take my money. I put my money on the bar anyways and he wouldnt take it, an hour and a half later its still there (for the first drink), and he IS taking every one elses money right away. My friends band shows up, and one of the band members says to the bartender he wants to buy me a drink. The bartender (I believe this to be the case anyways), thinks this is my boyfriend and humiliates me by telling this guy in the band (who've only known 2 weeks, as I just moved here) that I owe $28.00 for the last three drinks and looks to him to pay for it! WHAT AN ASSHOLE!
author: Nanda S.

description: The last time I went to Blondies with the crew (of which included a Filipino friend dressed as Luke Skywalker in Tatooine outfit) I drank their version of a Three Wisemen  (Jack Daniels, Jim Beam, And Old Grandad (I believe), on the rocks) served promptly by overly attentive bartenders , which is always a plus considering the size of crowds this place pulls on the weekend. After copious glasses of just whiskey and ice we flagged down an unmarked limo whose windows were held together by duct tape, to take us to our prospective locations. Upon arrival to my apartment in Pac Heights, I proceeded to vomit large amounts of previously mentioned drinks in our courtyard while the security guard watched on. In my drunken stupor I did manage to leave my wallet in the limo never to be seen again,  however I did pocket a glass from the bar ware cabinet in the limo(who got the last laugh sucka). The bar ware became my property due to the fact that I always become overly deviant and like to "appropriate" items during said drinking binges. All and all a good time to be had at Blondies. They were penalized the one star because their music was piped in and was on a loop and we were there long enough for it to repeat enough to be irritating. At least to me....
author: Bucky K.

description: fat chicks, shitty music, normally priced drinks, 3 dollar cover charge. mostly fat chicks.
author: Victor B.

description: Okay, okay I don't know why all y'all are so skerd of craziness! When I go out I like to see other people havin a good time, I mean call me weird but it puts me in the mood to have a good time too! So I went to Blondies this past Friday night with a group of 8 (count em 8!) ladies for the first time. We had started at the Elbo Room, but it was $10 that night to go upstairs and we weren't feelin the entertainment choice for $10, and the downstairs was PACKED and it was only 10:30. Soooooo we mosied on down to Blondies at the suggestion of an adorable boy who shall remain nameless, and were greeted by an awesome bouncer, good music, and strong drinks. These are all things I appreciate about a bar. So if you order a martini, you not only get a martini, but you also get a pint glass filled with more martini goodness...I did not have a martini and I think I'm glad cuz the 2 friends who did were feelin pretty rough by the end of the night. Two shouts for Goldschlager! yum yum! Anyway, I got my groove on and sweated out all alcohol consumed for about 3 hours before we were kicked out into the fresh air at closing time. Sweat baby, sweat baby, sex is a Texas drought...
author: Amanda S.

description: omg!  there are so many reasons not to go to this bar, that I don't even know were to start, but i'll give you a few ideas......  Yuppies, bridge and tunnel, frat boys, dumb bee-outches.
author: Pammy S.

description: i know ... I know .... everyone, lots of folks come here ... but I have to say ...as much fun as folks have on weekends.. My favorite days are Sundays and Mondays ... love it! Not too crowded, great Staff (love em) and I have been fortunate enough to be there on live music nights! I like the vibe.. I like being close to everything we can all eat and bring it (for the most part).. I feel like I own a bar stool.... it ruly is one of my comfort spots!
author: Dora G.

description: you gotta love the giant drinks! even though you gotta deal with the marina and bridge and tunnel crowd.
author: A P.

description: Blondie's is a decent spot in the mission; diverse crowd in ethnicity, but mostly a mid 20's / 30's crowd.  Good music, strong drinks, and naked girl art on the walls.  not too much more to ask out of a bar.
author: Jerry T.

description: Blondie's is the Bomb!  I've been going here for over 10 years.  Deep Blue Funk is my drink, Morgan is my DJ, and my groove is on!
author: Parousha Z.

description: This place might be ok earlier in the night.  I got there later on and it was packed with a bunch of punks and thugs just pushing their way around.  It was so crowded that we left after about 5 minutes.
author: Tom Z.

description: I always enjoy stopping in on the weekend.  Can be very packed or 1/2 empty depending on the night.  They play music you can dance too and you will work up a sweat.  Full bar will have any drink you ask for.
author: Dave H.

description: Decent stop-off if you're waiting to get in to Puerto Alegre.  The martini's are not as generous as they once were, though.
author: J R.

description: After giving Blondie's a couple tries, mostly late night, I was always struck with a feeling that I've seen the scene before.  I finally figured it out!  That bar brings me back to a college club, where sorority girls got wasted on the stiff drinks and immediately headed to the dance-floor, thugs sat in the shadows waiting until they could move in and grind on the blacked-out victims, and all the other riff raff that ensued.  It was damn entertaining back then, but now it's kinda depressing.  The too-old sorority girls still hunting for the best drink deals (they do have a pretty good one), and the thugs of the Mission hear the click of those stilettos on the pavement and come running.  I don't recommend ordering the martinis until you've consumed many other good drinks elsewhere... that's the only way they'll be enjoyable.  Might be more bearable if a seat in the window ever opened up, but they never do.  If you care about anything besides decent drink deals, stay far, far away.
author: Tara G.

description: This bar was the place to be circa 2000 and 2001. This was a staple of my college drunken existence- back when I thought Long Island Ice Tea was a sophisticated drink, and my ID said my name was "Monica" and I lived in Maine. I think around this time period, I had really gotten into gross sweet drinks, like Chocolate Martinis's, so the 16 oz martinis were a really great deal for me at the time because I drank like a champ.  i had many memorable girls nites out  during my youth spent here, followed by greasy slices of pizza at cable car and whatever strange men we had met at Blondies. We noticed that the crowd really started going downhill at the end of our college careers- the people who came here just started getting more ghetto, and seemed to all be from the out of town, bridge and tunnel types. That, and they jacked up the drink prices and started playing really awful music. I walked by this place the other night and my assessment was still the same- it looked crowded, nasty and ghetto. In any case, I will give this place a solid two starts for the poignant memories I experienced here, but besides that I try to avoid it.
author: Manali K.

description: Their drink menu is creative, but his place is a bit overrated. This place is a zoo... at happy hour the crowd has usually yet to fill this place, but in the evenings (particularly on the weekends) there are so many other places in the neighborhood that offer equally good drinks without the craziness of blondie's.
author: Michael H.

description: This place was hoppin', but it was super ghetto.  The bartenders were too drunk to function.  I've only been once, but I probably won't go back unless I'm with some rowdy friends.
author: Donna F.

description: This is the most confusing bar ever. It's like they took a college dive bar and started serving overpriced martinis. Seriously, what the hell? On top of that it's tiny and they charge a cover. Not worth it.
author: Michael G.

description: I'm one of the bartenders who works at blondie's, and specifically, I'm the one that Jen wrote her review about on 1/30/09.  In the spirit of fairness, I'm giving us an average rating so as not to skew our overall.  I've never rebutted a review about the bar I work at, or even so much as written a review on yelp, but I had to go on the record about my incredibly brief interaction with Jen.  Without dwelling too long on how busy it was, since that's fairly subjective, I'll only say that I had a lot of other people to help.  As far as what I said to Jen, when she asked me what martini I would recommend, which is a difficult and nebulous question, my response was, verbatim, "please don't ask me that right now."  And for the record, your friend who was with you ordered the beer you drank.  It was Anchor Steam, it cost you $5 dollars, and to me at least, it seemed like he understood why I didn't want to go into your question.  He jumped right in with his suggestion.
author: Sven F.

description: ok, usually when i come here, it's because i'm waiting for a table at puerto alegre. but if you are lucky enough to get a seat on the patio on a nice day where you can watch the sidewalk traffic, it can be a really nice afternoon. and more importantly, order one martini, and they will pour you your glass and hand you the rest of the shaker. sure, one drink is about $12, but you basically get 2 for the price of one. this is the kind of place i like to come for a pre-game drink. i always get fairly buzzed, and it's a laid back atmosphere. but beware: i made the mistake of trying to come here a little later once, and some silly bouncer actually thought i should pay a cover. a cover at blondies? not worth it. stick happy hour.
author: Mary Beth D.
